comment: Does not hold a charge

Similar to some other negative reviews I have seen of this speaker, it does not last even close to 7-8 hours. It dies after 3.5 hours on a full charge. Very disappointing. Strangely, it is never on "low" battery. It dies while on medium.

This is the first Bose I’ve ever owned. SO excited to upgrade my music. And at first, it was the BOMB! I was literally in tears listening to songs I’ve known for decades, realizing I’d been missing so much. Not just bass, but an extra trill here, a run I’d neverheard, a violin, and extra guitar riff. Truly glorious hearing the fullness of the music as it was played. The battery life was awesome. It also didn’t drain my iPhone even for many hours at my Labor Day cookout. It won’t blast the guy down the block with volume, but who wants to be that chucklehead anyway?! Syncimg was a snap. And it DOES play while charging. Here’s the sucky part, and why I returned it to Bose: the physical volume buttons on the speaker did not work. At all. Not even a little bit. And this was from right outta the box. After 3 days of fiddling with it, I called Bose, (20 min hold!) explained the issue, and she started trying to walk me through a reset that was also clearly NOT correct. (She kept telling me to press and hold the power button until the language selection voice prompt came on. The language selection is not on the power button. It’s on the multi-function button. This is in the manual. I mentioned this. This did not register with her. Sigh.)

THIS IS JUNK. My original review was good but after the first year it started to do strange things and now at just uner two years it is useless. In the last year it started to refuse to charge from a USB wall chargers. It will ONLY charge from a computer or tablet. It will not charge while playing. So at two years it may need a new battery ($45+) or a trash can. It only plays for 1.5 hrs and then takes 3-4 to charge to only 1/3 full and will not charge any farther. The new firmware provides no indication of charging and the thing seems to be on standby all the time.  So it goes totally DEAD in a week of not using it.  B O S E  is now junk.  These problems are easy to find on the web. Many of them are dead or dying.

I really like this refreshed version. It sounds great. I took it to the beach and left it on the night stand and played music and it was loud enough and sounded good. Ive had other Bose speakers that are in a box now not being used because they sounded terrible. These sound good. Audiophiles hate Bose but for the majority of people they're a good step up in class. All the brands in the 350-400 over the ear headphone range sound exactly the same. You have to spend way way up there to get something that sounds different. I tried on some 1800 headphones and it sounded like I was in a big room listening to music, that was okay but all my beats, b&o, Sony, Bose headphones sound good too just not like your in a huge room having sound come at you. I can see where some people would appreciate that but that's not what Americans have been used to, that's something unique that not everyone needs and they were huge and lacked technology even though they sounded good using old tech from long ago. Plus, no name brand recognition. I've found an apple music subscription with an apple headphone (beats) and apple wire are very much optimized to work together and if you have apple music you want beats, they're tuned for them perfectly.

I'm not one to trash a product knowing that user error can in many cases cause an unsatisfactory experience but in this case I'm going to trash this product.  First, the item was used for less than a total of 24 hours worth of play time over the course of a year.  After returning from the beach the item was set on the shelf and left for about 6-8 months.  When I returned to charge the device and use it, guess what.....it didn't work.  I tried numerous attempts to get the device to turn on or even take a charge.  After visiting the Bose forums and doing some research it appears that the device goes into a "sleep" mode if not used for a period of 2 weeks.  I attempted on numerous occasions to follow the trouble shooting ideas within the Bose forums and via YouTube but nothing worked.  I finally broke down and called Bose to attempt to trouble shoot with them over the phone and was told "well the device is out of warranty and you have tried all the troubleshooting ideas so....let's just get you a new one.....that'll be $129.99 or you can send the one you have back and for only $75 you can have a refurbished one"  I'm sorry Bose, why would I buy another one when the first one didn't  hold up and was caused by a known issue that you have purposely installed in your firmware.  After additional attempts I was able to get some lights to come on temporarily but still the device doesn't work.  Bose knows the issue exists and yet won't stand behind their product.  I wasn't looking to get a replacement or even a new one, but I was at least expecting for the price paid that I would get some legit support and not a sales pitch.  Never again Bose.....I should have listened to the old adage "No high's, no low's, that's Bose" and gone with a different product.

I have only had this a few days, as of now, I am only giving it 2 STARZ. It does not keep its connection. Initially, I had it connected to a couple of different mobile devices at the same time. The next day, it would not stay connected to either device. It is supposed to search for the most recently connected device when you turn the speaker on, however it does not do that. I will give the manufacturer an opportunity to fix the problem. I will update my review at that time. I also used the recommended app, Bose Connect. The iPhone app did not work at all. The iPad app worked the first time, but not after the initial set up. I am not sure if this is a problem with the app, or the speaker.

Lets just hypothetically say that I bought this as a gift in December 2017 for an ungrateful person.  In September 2018 this same ungrateful person pissed me off, so naturally I decided to destroy this bose speaker. I ran water over it but i noticed the water rolling off. I then submerged it in water and watched until little bubbles formed.  I removed it and placed it back.  The next day,  this same ungrateful person is blasting perfect sound quality music from this damn speaker... al hypothetically of courseNeedless to say Bose has gained a loyal customer in myself

So I have had this speaker for just over a year. It still sounds very good. It has great battery life. Always connects to my phone or computer without issue. The rubber exterior is great for easy gripping and handling. I have never had a need to use it near water, so I cannot comment on splash resistance.Update: I have had this speaker for over 2 years.Still sounds fantastic. Still has great battery life. Guess I never had to, but now I use the microphone function. Since I have been working from home. I use this has a speaker/microphone as I have grown tired of wearing headphones all day. This connects to my work computer and i am able to use it for my Skype communication. Calls come in clear and I can be clearly heard by others.

I had this speaker for two days and returned it. The quality I know and expect from Bose was not found in this speaker. You know how you go to a store and they have a Bose display where you can test the speakers? You know how impressed you are with even the smallest Bose speaker's sound? Yeah, none of that happens with this speaker.The sound from this SoundLink speaker is tinny and unimpressive. I can honestly say my Kindle Fire HD 10 has a more crisp sound than this Bose speaker. There's barely any bass and if it's not placed directly in front of your ears you'd think it was a cheapo no-name $40 speaker.
The sound is fantastic and a perfect portable speaker.  Easy download for Bluetooth.  When active or playing music and your phone rings it will alert you through the speaker, nice feature.

So after two years of this speaker sitting on the same table and using this speaker once a day, I hadn't used it in a couple of weeks and it had fully discharged. I plugged it in and ran an errand for an hour. I came back to some sort of dystopian hell with the voice prompts loudly cycling through "connected, not connected" or something along those lines. It was so loud and the volume buttons don't seem to apply to the voice prompts, I was a bit concerned because I live in an apartment building and have neighbors who I am sure hated me due to this.I then remembered that I had to update the firmware one time so I searched for the updater app on Google to find Bose trying to get me to use the mobile app instead of desktop. I tried that via my iPhone but the update was painfully slow. If you've ever done a big update on an Apple Watch via Bluetooth imagine this but 10 fold. It could never finish due to the speaker deciding to randomly disconnect from bluetooth. This like the voice prompt cycling was another new behavior that came out of the blue (pun not intended).

Worked fine for a while, but for no reason it no longer plays sound even though the device is paired with my iPhone. A superficial search on google shows that the device in all it’s incarnations has this issue, going all the way back to 2012. From this, I’ve decided Bose has had plenty of time to get the bugs out of this device, so I’m asking Amazon for a full refund.
I'm flight attendant and have literally turned my car back around to go back home and get it when I forgot it at home.It gives amazing sound that fills a car or room beautifully.

~edit: this has turned out to be EXTREMELY ANNOYING, I am going to try and return it~ The speaker sounds and looks amazing. There is only one thing that I don’t like about it... whenever you pause your music for too long or if you turn your music off the speaker will say “connected to (name)’s iPhone” repeatedly  until you turn off the speaker. Also, if you turn off your Bluetooth on your device but don’t walk over and turn off the speaker it will repeatedly say “ready to connect.” It’s surprisingly more annoying than you would think. It would be nice if there was a way to turn off this feature

The sound quality overall is pretty decent, and the speaker pairs easily with my phone. However this weird thing happened to me-- the speaker died and for some reason went into this mode and wouldn't recharge. I looked it up and apparently it's a common issue. I was able to fix the speaker by going through the factory reset process, but I had to try it multiple times before it turned on again. I also wish the speaker turned off automatically if it hadn't been used for a while, because I often drain the battery forgetting to turn it off.

I was happy with a lot about this one over my last two BOSE.It connected quickly, didn't drop randomly, not too base driven so music and podcasts sounded good and it seemed durable in terms of dirt and dust but without warning it stopped working in the middle of use sitting on my desk.

TBH initially I wasn't pleased with the sound of it at all! I've gotten so used to listening to music underneath the bump and vibration of (Beats) bass that I didn't recognize real quality any more. I didn't pay attention to the fact that I can clearly hear every instrument (individually) as well as every lyric spoke within the song playing. I didn't notice the awesomeness of this tiny little box until I was in a completely separate room away from it, yet I heard every sound described above in perfectly pristine quality as if the music was live & followed me into the next room. Suddenly I remembered the quality sound of the Bose products my parents owned. The beauty of clear, quality sound wrapping around you.The overall appearance of the speaker speaks to it not being a cheap reproduction. The texture is great to the touch. It feels very durable and is comfortable on the hands, easy to grip & carry.

Super unhappy with the product. When I first received it it was perfect. No issues at all and really good quality sound. Within the first two months I had to keep troubleshooting the speaker because it’s known to just turn off or go into a power saving mode. But it’s finally just stopped troubleshooting all together and won’t come back on at all . Super sad I always loved the boss product

What an amazing little speaker! I listen to everything from classical, rock, pop and rap music and this speaker allows me to enjoy it all! Battery life is incredible. Easy to pair. Same quality you've come to love and expect from Bose.

Small, yet the sound quality is impressive.I appreciate it DOES NOT require an app that needs permissions to run and access to things like your contacts, location, all your photos like some other companies do.

It is OK and most people will be satisfied. Perhaps I should have spent more money and ordered a speaker with better sound quality for music listening.  But I wanted something small.  And in my opinion,  the pros outweigh the  cons.  The pros?  Pairs easily.  Small footprint.  Very nice design. Worth the price for what it is designed to do.  And importantly, at least for me, it is one of the very few bluetooth speakers available at this time that will work with the  new Amazon Echo Input which, I believe, is shipping now.  As far as I can determine, there are not yet a lot of speakers that will work with the Echo Input.  According to the list from Amazon, this one will.

I had the older Bose soundlink and I loved that one. I had it for a very long time, I got a ton of use out of it. The charging port somehow got moved and it was really hard to charge I had to literally hold it in. So I got this one a week or so ago and WOW! The sound quality is so much better than the older one! There are a bunch of new features, some annoying like it will read the number when someone calls. That drove me crazy but eve ty thing can be turned off. I like it. I’m afraid I won’t get the use out of the party mode, it sounds interesting but I don’t see much use for me personally. Oh the app that is recommended for whatever reason isn’t that good, maybe it’s user error but it kept freezing my phone and my phone is current on updates. I know this review isn’t for the app sorry I get side tracked! Ok for a Bluetooth speaker in the medium (this is medium to me idk I guess there are crazy expensive speakers out there...?) anything this speaker is perfect for me and for my usage! I use it practically all day and night, at night I plug it in and listen to sleep stories or sleepscapes on the calm app and it’s amazing it sounds so great!! I love the size i love that it is water resistant, this is the perfect little speaker!

I am a musician/songwriter/producer with a very discerning ear, and I was stunningly surprised by the sound of this little gem ... the bass response was the very first thing I heard, and I really didn't "hear" it, I FELT it - the volume was way down (just out of the box) and one of my cats looked very concerned as she hates thunder and thought that's what is WAS, (as did I) ... as I slowly turned it up the other frequencies kicked in and the clarity and sound quality clearly was just as impressive. The pairing is quick and seamless, the controls very user-friendly, and the volume it reaches without sacrificing quality is beyond surprising for such a size ... I swore I'd never spend a lot on bluetooth speakers, (as I own a recording studio and have a great stereo system there and in my house), so I got one of these at a bit over a Franklin, and within twenty minutes of listening to the Bose Soundlink Color II, I bought ANOTHER, as they can be used in tandem and in true STEREO. The sound of both is really superb, and comparable to my very expensive studio near-field monitors. I rarely take the time to write reviews for Amazon, (though I buy almost everything here), but I just HAD to share the joy and pleasure of these little bargains! I love the midnight blue color as well, the water-resistance, the non-slip texturing, and the amazing battery life. A++

I saw this Bose unit while looking for a blue tooth speaker to replace a different brand speaker I purchased from Costco that worked well & sounded good, while it worked.. then, after only a few months of gentle use (not played loudly)  it simply died one day. Disappointed in that brand, for sure. So, instead of all the return hassles, I figured why not try a better known 'high quality' brand from somewhere other than Costco. Bought this Bose Soundlink Color II for about $130.  then, after only a few months of gentle use (not played loudly)  it simply died one day. (Sound familiar?, LOL! gotta laugh so I don't scream,LOL!)  Disappointed in that brand also now, for sure.I don't know if these reviews are monitored.

I liked how easy the speaker was to set up as well as the ease of using the app (optional) to utilize the features this speaker has.This is it. The speaker itself did not have a deep range like a Bose speaker should be known for. As others have stated, when the speaker is turned up loud, bass suffers as a result and in turn, this speaker becomes tinny and cheap sounding. The only range where this sounds good is at 75% and lower.

I purchased the speaker in March 2017, and here 4 months later it has stopped working. I used the below method to reset the speaker and it's working fine again. strange bug for a product line that I've always enjoyed.Plug soundlink in to wall charger

Ok, even though I had read the product reviews and knew that people had trouble getting and keeping this speaker charged, I thought that I would be the exception. Turns out I wasn’t. The speaker comes with a cable for charging, but not a plug. So I used whatever I had around.I charged this speaker overnight, sometimes for days, and still when I turned it on it would say, ‘ Low battery.’
This is really a terrible product coming from Bose. It has none of the usability or sound quality of their excellent headphones.* Sound quality is poor (bass heavy) and cannot be adjusted.

Stopped working after a year.  Called Bose to start process of repair.  They asked for the Serial Number (found at bottom of speaker); I read to them the number and they replied: "This is not an authorized Bose product."Several times I reread the SN and several times they searched.  Even if I wanted to pay to repair the speaker, Bose could not help because it is not a legit Bose speaker.

I am giving this product 3 stars as an average of three components:5 stars: The sound quality is great and the app/bluetooth works seamlessly with either my phone or my computer. Now that I've overcome the obstacles listed below, I am excited for a lifetime of using this product!

Love the Boze color soundlink for the great sound, I’ve had two others with more or less success as far as life span and ease of connectivity. Connectivity is almost always easy and good (this one occasionally has a little lag time from when it “says” it’s connected to your device to when the sound actually comes through). A negative of both of my other Colorlinks was the misalignment of the rubber cover and the charging port - causing difficulty in connecting the device for charging and eventually damaging the port. Also, short lifespan for one of my other Colorlinks. For this particular one, tho, so far/so good- except for the delayed connecting time. OH! ALSO! An annoying feature is that only 2 devices can be connected to the device at one time and if one of those is not disconnected, no other device can connect. In other words, you cannot disconnect other devices from the speaker, leaving you unable to connect to the speaker. It seems even if the other phones are within range.

I'm not happy with this product.  I bought it to pair with my MacBook Pro, but it hasn't worked out well at all.  The bluetooth connection constantly drops with no warning and then the only way to reestablish it is to simultaneously power the speaker, even though the speaker still has plenty of power!  The controls are very confusing, the human voice is difficult to understand (yes, I have her set to English), and the "user's guide" literature is a joke (but it's in 21 languages!).  There's marginally more information on the website- and that's where I learned to disable the powersaver feature- but I still haven't been able to employ the speaker with any consistency.  Right now I'm charging the speaker but the voice that used to give me the power status has gone silent.  The only reason I haven't returned it is because I was hopeful i could reach a tech support representative on the phone who could tell me what's going on, but I've been unsuccessful there on 2-3 attempts, left listening to "a specialist will be right with you" recording ad nauseum for 30+ minutes each time.  If my experience is any indication, Bose has lost its way.

I bought this to pair with an Echo Dot.  Setup was very easy - almost effortless.  Sound is much better than what the Dot, or even the full-sized Echo, can produce, and I am very pleased with its performance.Deducted one star because it comes with a charging cable only - the wall plug is not included.  I'm guessing their theory is that it will be charged by a computer and used on the go.  And, yes, "everyone" has a wall plug anyway.  But to package a product without all necessary accessories is just not right.

I always wanted to have a bose speaker. I finally bought it and love it! It sounds really great but I have used it’s for less than a month and I left it charging for 6 hours because I was going camping and when I got to camp it hadn’t charge, I thought my cable wasn’t working but I have charged other devices with it and worked perfect. I put it to charge today for 4 hours and when Ari turned it on it said “battery low” and shut off. I am kind of disappointed with this speaker. Specially because I have been wanting to get it’s for this long!

I like this speaker. I bought it to replace the Bose Soundlink speaker (original edition).  The sound is great, and it fits into the case I bought for the original, so that's nice.Now for the annoyances: The on/off, Bluetooth, and volume up+ and down- buttons are harder to press than on the original. The thing that bugs me the most is that they are VERY poorly marked--the icons are pale and almost impossible to see, so you have to look hard at them when you want to adjust something, until you know their placement and can do it by memory!

Don’t buy this!  I bought this in mid-January 2018 & within a month the power just went dead. It wouldn’t charge no matter what connecton I used. Looked on the net for help & found that dozens of other folks have experienced the same problem. Some were able to eventually get it to work again, but many, like me, couldn’t.  I also have the original Bose Sound Link & that still works great after more than a year. I highly recommend that over the Sound Link II.

I was surprised in every way upon the Sound Link Color II's arrival, connection and playback of music.To start with, the instructions were so poor, it made us wonder if we bought a fake from China.  We later found an online manual, and wondered why it was not included with our speaker.  Not to worry though, we had a lengthy set of safety precautions in twenty-one, I kid you not - twenty-one, different languages.

As with all Bose audio equipment, the sound quality of this device is superb, but its endurance--not so much.  Within less that one month of use, it went dead.  Totally.  I contacted Bose, and they are sending a replacement, which I hope proves to be a lot more long lived.  A word to the wise:  save the box and everything that came with the speaker, along with your receipt.

Bought it once. Returned it because it stopped working soon after purchase. Bought it a second time, and it stopped working after initial battery charge. Called Bose. Re-set the processor per rep's instructions and topped off the battery charge. Used it for about 15 minutes. Died again. Completely dead again. Called Bose and was told that it shouldn't do that. Duh. Dog product. Returned for refund and will look for different speaker this time.

Sometimes it is a bear to get my phone to synch up. I have to toggle the Bose unit and the phone Bluetooth.Also, the speaker phone does NOT work well with Bluetooth.  The volume of the incoming call is terrible.  I had to use an aux cable input to get good speaker phone functionality.

Besides the color everything is perfect. Wish I would of got black but it's all good. All I care about really is the amazing sound this pumps out. I also watched Netflix and got crips perfect sound and zero lag. You won't be mad getting this, but get black just to be safe. 😂📻🔊🔈🔊🔈 Red looks like a hot orange pink, but I'm still good with it to take to Hawaii. 🌴🌴📻🔊🔈

I read many of the reviews prior to purchasing.  I understand that many have made comments on issues with it not being 'easy' to connect or even to increase or decrease volume.  Understanding that information, I still decided to purchase. First of all, I love bose products and bose sound. I own several of their other products and will continue to own bose products.so, this is my review - the instructions that came with the speaker were poor at best.  while there isn't much to connecting a bluetooth, it simplly didn't give much info that was helpful.  I got mine paired with minimal effort, pushing buttons and using my phone to actually make sure the process worked well.  with that said, I had a very specific reason for ordering this particular bluetooth speaker; I wanted a speaker to use as a speaker phone, so I could enjoy having a phone call with family members that live away, while my hubby could participate as well.  This speaker seemed to offer the appropriate qualities to do that.  upon me trying to figure out how to do this, I became perplexed.  I watched youtube 'how-to' videos and again no answers.  I decided to call the bose customer service and spoke with a lovely person that listened to my request, put me on hold, went to their 'training lab', tried a few options and found a solution that worked for me.  yay!  I was soooooooo pleased.  I received actual great customer service without being on hold for hours and getting disappointed.  Now that i know how to make my speaker operate as I needed it to, I am very please with it.  it sounds great, and I can easily answer and place calls easily.  The only thing that is a bit annoying is that the volume up and down buttons have a slow response, but that is a minor issue.
Sound is good but the hardware to charge it is absolutely awful.

This little baby blasts! Really like this a lot - I am a long time bose fan. My only complaint is that I ordered white and I got a color that was more icy blue/gray. I know I got the right one bc the actual blue is VERY blue. Just a heads up to all that the white is not a true white. ....However - I like the color so am keeping it and still giving 5 stars

Bought as a gift for Father's day. My dad absolutely loves it. Great sound and great range. It didn't come with the wall charger so he called Bose and they mailed him one free of charge within 48 hrs. The customer service rep said they get calls all the time for the missing charger. That is strange but, if they send it that fast I think it's no big deal. You can use a phone charger while you wait for it.

There are many terrible aspects to this lemon Bose speaker.  But the two worst are:  1) when it’s charging, it makes a terrible beeping noise INCESSANTLY and 2) the gosh darn thing charges for hours and then only plays for ONE HOUR AT MOST!  It’s truly a horrible purchase!

Bought this when it was deal of the day and under 100$. I do have a Bose soundlink  mini so i was hoping for comparable quality but it does not quite meet that sound standard. If you're looking for full bass sound, look elsewhere.Pros

This is a well built speaker that puts out good sound. Love that it's weather proof. The problem is that a Bose software update adds a "feature" (that you can't disable) which has this speaker always looking for previously paired devices using low-energy Bluetooth scanning. After this update, you can push the power button and it looks like the speaker is off, but it's not really off, and as soon as it finds the last phone/tablet/PC you paired it with, it turns itself back on to full power. Annoying as hell and also runs down the battery. It's a well documented problem on Bose forums, but there is no fix in sight. If you're only using this speaker with one device and you don't care that it stays on all the time, I guess it's still a good option, but that's a weird use case for a portable speaker.

I am happy with it overall.  A couple random observations to pass forward.1. The white is NOT white.  As another reviewer noted (which I didn't see until I received mine) it grayer but not a cool true grey.  If I'd known I'd have gone with black - it doesn't blend with my decor as well.

This was on sale for Prime day, so I figured why not since Bose has a good reputation and I have some of their products and love them (speakers in my car and two sets of headphones). I did go to my nearby Bestbuy and listen to the soundlink in person (although the limited edition color is amazon exclusive), and it sounded decent enough but it's always hard to get a good feel until you have it at home and can really test it. Well, for $89 on sale this speaker performs as well as my $20-$40 speakers, so I was very underwhelmed and disappointed in this. It is a good speaker, but I know I can get way better for within this price range, especially when the normal price is $130! Maybe some people will really like it, but I strongly urge you to at least try and find a store to test it at before purchasing. Then again, amazon does have a great return policy... (thankfully). Also, as other reviewers stated, be aware it only comes with a usb charging cord.

The first speaker I ordered "skipped" as soon as I began to use it. I returned it for another which worked perfectly. However, after two weeks, this one has begun to skip. We can't listen to music--which of course is why we bought the speaker in the first place. Unfortunately, since this replacement appeared to be working just fine, I disposed of the boxes, wrapping, etc...and I'm not sure I can return it. I guess Bose is just not what it used to be back in the "old days""After several days of trying to fix this speaker, I am lowering my rating to one star.  I have been trying all the recommended fix: hold the Lazarus (3 dot) button for 15 seconds. Then the power went off and won't come back on no matter what I do. Yes, it is plugged in; yes I pressed Lazarus again. $129 down the drain. DO NOT DISCARD THE BOX/WRAP/ETC when it seems to be working just fine. Wait at least a month or two...because that may be all the time you have with this speaker.

I have owned one of my Bose Color Soundlinks for a minimum of three years. This one I purchased as a birthday gift for my teenage son. They're easy to pair to your phones, Amazon Firestick etc.  The TV in the master bedroom sits along the wall of my teenager's bedroom. So if I watch TV at night, I paired my Bose to my Firestick in my room and place it near my pillow and turn the volume down so it's not disturbing him.For music, you can't beat listening to it through a Bose speaker. My childhood piano teacher went to Julliard for her Master's degree. She ear trained me in music and piano theory at the end of a Steinway concert grand piano. So trust me implicitly when I say that Bose speakers are one of the most perfect devices invented for music. I can also go into the settings on my iPhone and change my music equalizer on my phone to various settings. I love both of our Bose speakers. I wouldn't own any other type. It's the best $129.00 investment.

My Soundlink 2 worked great for a few months and then just stopped charging. I looked it up and realized it was a very common issue. I followed instructions on how to perform a reset to get it charging again which did end up working if I did this repeatedly throughout my time with this more-trouble-than-its-worth speaker. Eventually even resetting it stopped working and I realized that it's new way to charge was by being attached to my laptop and using the bose app to connect. It's such a pain to charge, it's just not worth it. I dont even use my bose speaker anymore. I am a bose junky and usually swear by all their products but I absolutely cannot back this little speaker and would recommend looking elsewhere for a speaker with better charging capabilities.

I am quite surprised with the performance of this speaker. Being a Bose product, I had expected outstanding high quality sound on Bluetooth AND direct line-in connection. What I have found, is that the direct line-in has better quality than Bluetooth. When connected on Bluetooth, the music has that "fuzz-out" effect (barely noticeable to the non-musically inclined) like you would get if the treble (high frequency) was turned up to the point that the speakers can't handle it.Not very impressed with this Bose product. I took a chance on it; this speaker was the first brand name Bluetooth speaker I've ever bought.

This speaker did not even last a month. After a few weeks, it stopped holding a charge. We called customer service and they sent us a label to send it back and get a *replacement*. However, they sent back the same machine instead and, surprise, it still had the same problem. When we asked to get a refund, they refused, saying that the 30-day warranty period had finished because they start counting it from - get this - not the purchase date but the manufacture date. It's the second time that we've had a bad experience with Bose, which is supposed to be such a nice brand. They've lost a customer. In the long run, it's cheaper to provide good customer service. Disappointing.

I purchased Bose SoundLink Color Bluetooth Speaker II - Aquatic Blue on November 2016.  It has been working great until yesterday when it died at all. It does not turn on, even changing cables o USB wall chargers.  3 months of life!  Unbelievable!Any comment from Bose?

In an age with off the shelf Natural Voice synthesis WHY has Bose allowed this slurry voice be the audible prompts? Everytime I hear it I edge a little closer to hating the device.  It's that bad.  It's shamefully lazy or excessively beancountified.The clarity of fidelity music played through a wire are a few bits shy of what I would expect from Bose.  Something is missing but I cannot yet characterize it.  Why not the route of Boston Acoustics with their Oontz "brand" for inferior lower cost products to preserve integrity of the Trademark?  Yes, playing streaming compressed music over bluetooth degrades quality more. For a wide variety of music types in an outdoor setting this is an acceptable trade for portable convenience.

Disappointed with sound.I've been a bose owner of various products for over 10years and this product does not live up to the bose sound. It's no different than a $25 Bluetooth speaker I have already which actually sounds better since that one is stereo and this is mono. Construction is nice but sound is most important and it does not live up to expectations.

This might be the worst purchase ever. It is such a pain to charge. You have to use the cord it came with. You can’t use one that fits. So right now I cannot charge this because I cannot find the freaking cord that came with the product because I think the housekeeper organize things and now it’s missing. So I tried all kinds of different chords that fit and I plugged it in and I cannot charge it. So it’s unusable. Do not buy this and less you plan to never detach the cord from it. Because if you lose it  this might be the worst purchase ever. It is such a pain to charge. You have to use the cord it came with. You can’t use one that fits. So right now I cannot charge this because I cannot find the freaking cord that came with the product because I think the housekeeper organize things and now it’s missing. So I tried all kinds of different cords that fit and I plugged it in and I cannot charge it. So it’s unusable. Do not buy this unless you plan to never detach the cord from it. Because if you lose it You’re doomed to never hearing music out of this again. Why would they do this? Why would you make a product that only the tiny cord that came with it will charge it. It makes no sense. You should be able to use a universal cord. Or at least give me a warning when I open the box that says “do not lose this cord!”.

I bought this for work so I would have something to jam out to. Well it worked pretty good the first day, It sounded pretty good other than the bass was a little weak. I left it on the charger when I left but when I got to work the next day it wasn't showing that it was charging so I tried to power it up and nothing.. so it wont charge, it wont turn on. I googled it to see if there is a fix and apparently lots of people are having this problem. Anyway I tried all of the recommended fix procedures "even the one by bose" and none of them worked. Returning it and going back to JBL.
I did not own these long enough to test the battery life or durability.  I only kept them about an hour before returning them.  First, the good:1.  They appear sturdy and well built.

I've had this unit for a little over two years. The sound quality was excellent.Unfortunately it was chronically unreliable-- the battery life was much less than what the specifications indicated, and the unit would frequently not turn on when I try to use it, unless I used one of the "press multi button for 15 seconds while unplugging and replugging the power cord while walking in circles three times  backwards under an oak tree during a full moon while singing the Ave Maria" routines, none of which work anymore.

I bought this to test out the sound quality vs. the Tribit Bluetooth speaker, https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0784ZQFHZ/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o09_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1To my opinion, the Tribit own over this speaker in terms of:

I like this speaker. I purchased it in May despite the reviews I read about it. So, surprise when mine completely stopped dead this past weekend. It was charging via an outlet, but no matter how much I tried to turn it on or reset it. It would not work. I finally contacted Bose tech support who were very nice, and they are sending a replacement. Fingers crossed on the replacement.Update of replacement

So, I will say that the Bose sounded great for it's short lifespan of 2 months.  I bought this as a present for my wife and two months in, it just stopped working.  I contacted Amazon and they thought that it might be a bad charging cord.  So, I bought another charging cord.  Nope!  Wasn't the charging cord.  I tried to call Bose Tech support but they are closed.  So, i am leaving this review so that people know that it might start out great but can very quickly leave you feeling like you wasted $130.  I cannot recommend this speaker to anyone.

It’s funny that my $60 Bluetooth iPhone I bought 4 years ago never cuts out but this one won’t stop. I’ve only had it a day and I decided it’s not for me. Every time it connects this annoying voice says "connected to device 57877KLPR.. "  can’t it just make a pleasant sound to let me know it’s connected? Anyway I decided to order a different speaker and send this back. I need it for a party and I don’t want to risk it cutting out constantly. It says the Bose website to listen to audio but don’t be connect to WiFi to prevent the cutting out. Is that a joke? All my music is accessed through WiFi and yeah I can save some offline but I shouldn’t have to do that! and I plan on using my speaker for streaming tv & movies. Again my $60 Ihome doesn’t have a problem why does this? This is not a promo for ihome the speakers are not great which is why I’m upgrading so I hope I can find the best of both worlds. Good connection and good sound!

I have only had the Bose Speaker less than a week but the speaker quality is excellent. It is actually the 2nd Bose Speaker in my house.  But...how could they not include a wall plug? I mean, seriously, how much more would that have cost Bose?  You don't buy a car without a steering wheel included!
This is without a doubt the best bluetooth enabled speaker system.  So many features have been well designed.  I will list a few:1. From the app, you can turn on the speaker remotely.

THIS IS THE 2nd TIME I BOUGHT THIS SPECIFIC BOSE SPEAKER AND ITS FAR BELOW QUALITY FROM THE 1st SPEAKER I BOUGHT FROM BEST BUY THAT HAD SUPERB SOUND QUALITY AS TO BE EXPECTED FROM BY BOSE....THIS SPEAKER IS IS LOUD BUT WITH STATIC IN THE BACKGROUND MUSIC AND AWFUL VOLUME....THE FIRST SPEAKER FROM BEST BUY I GAVE TO MY NEPHEW AND I COMPARED BOTH SIDE BY SIDE AND THE BEST BUY SPEAKER HAS AWESOME VOLUME BECAUSE I DONT EVEN HAVE PUT VOLUME TO MAXIMUM TO GET SUPERB EXCELLENT SOUND....THIS CRAPPY SPEAKER HAS THE VOLUME TO THE MAXIMUM AND SOUNDS DISGUSTING....I GUESS MAYBE I BOUGHT A USED ONE...BUT IM KEEPING IT BCS IM WAY PAST THE RETURN TIME FRAME....SOUND IS SO HORRIBLE I CANT ENJOY MY MUSIC BECAUSE IT IRRITATES ME BECAUSE I KNOW WHAT BOSE SPEAKERS SHOULD SOUND LIKE.....THE SOUND IS LIKE A CHEAP AM/FM RADIO THAT HAS 1 BAD SPEAKER WITH NO BASS AND CRACKLY TREBLE.

There are a lot of reviews saying the unit died after awhile. Hoping these aren't true. I find it's very beautifully designed, with a high quality feel and function. Looks great. The sound is excellent with good bass and clear midrange and treble. Has a very good sound stage, not stereo but it sounds broad, much bigger than you'd expect. Very good companion speaker since at low volumes it sounds quite full and present. What I was surprised at is a comparison with the Bose SoundLink Micro which I bought for a friend. The two speakers sound almost identical. The Color 2 does get louder, but not by a lot. And the Micro is much more compact and completely waterproof. Honestly, I'd go with the Micro. For 30 dollars less you get virtually the same speaker, much smaller and waterproof. So much easier to carry around the Micro and it has that great strap to attach it to whatever. Very interesting comparison. But I'll keep this because it does get louder and it does sound excellent. I do wish it played even louder for outside. But you won't be disappointed although the JBL Charger 3 has more bass, gets louder and costs the same. But it isn't as svelt as this (it's significantly larger and tube shaped) and the midrange/highs don't sound as good. Check them out at Best Buy. I gave the Micro 5 stars but the Color 2 has 4 for not being very much better and more expensive.

This speaker had an excellent sound, but it stopped working after a few weeks I got it. The speaker doesn't turn on, even if connected to a powered USB port.Update: Fix: Follow these simple instructions: 1: Plug Soundlink in the wall charger, 2: Hold down the play/pause button for 15 seconds (the three dots button), 3: Before releasing the play/pause button, unplug the charge cord from the unit.  4: Release the button. 5: Plug the unit back into the wall charger. Last Step: Press the power button, and your Speaker should power on again.﻿

What can I say? It's a Bose product! Sound quality is awesome as always. Louder than I expected from a Bluetooth speaker! Bose never disappoints! I was afraid to spend so much on a Bluetooth speaker, but sooo worth it!! Very happy I did!UPDATE: I've always been so impressed with bose! Obviously. ..^^ It was my understanding they never blew up! My bluetooth now rattles as if it's blown.  I am so sad!  :-( I don't even listen to it anymore I'm so embarrassed and surprised! It wasn't inexpensive either.  But apparently cheap.  I've had a couple different bose systems before.  Never a problem. Very enjoyable! Sound I craved!!! :-(

I use this speaker almost daily. The music sounds great, and my podcasts have a nice clean sound too. This is super easy to use - my phone synced almost instantly on setup. I will say that once the battery warning says it's on medium, it isn't very long before it runs out altogether. I'd say I easily get the reported hours of battery life promised, but it does seem odd that medium doesn't truly seem to indicate it's in the middle of its battery life. I just know now to start charging it as soon as I hear that little alert. No biggie.

This is a nice speaker when it works. Unfortunately, if the battery drains getting it to work again can be an extremely frustrating, time consuming challenge.  None of the quickly viewed results to fix the issue worked for me. Eventually I found the answer buried in a YouTube video comment.  Seems like there are several different 'fixes' out there, so finding the one that works for you is very frustrating.  To fix mine, I had to plug the speaker into my computer, open the BOSE updater app on my computer, press and hold the 'a,s,d, up-arrow, down-arrow keys' at the same time until the power light on the speaker started blinking. I left the speaker plugged into my computer to charge. Once charged, I had to pair and reboot my computer.Bose calls this bug a 'feature'. Supposedly  when the speaker won't turn on it's because it's in sleep mode to protect the battery and extend it's life. This isn't a "feature"; it's a bug.  You should be able to plug the speaker in and it charges - period.  Other videos say the problem is caused by not having the software updated or not using the BOSE charger that comes with the speaker. My problem wasn't cause by either of these. I hadn't used the speaker in a while, the battery drained and I couldn't get it out of sleep mode. Will not buy another BOSE product based on this experience.

Bose has always been a great name in small speakers. I am sorry to say this but Bose really missed the mark on the soundlink speaker II. First, the speakers are designed to travel but they have no handel to carry them with or hang them with wherever you decide to use them. Second, good chance you will use these speakers at night. The buttons on the top used to control the speakers cannot be felt to tell what they are in the dark. I have a Fugoo speaker and you can run it without light just by feel. Third, sitting up to pair 2 speakers together in stereo was not well explained. I am not sure but once the speakers are paired they don’t stay that way and have to be messed with every time you use them. What a hassle! The Fugoo I have is better but doesn’t pair to do stereo. Bummer!

After going into a Bose store while on vacation, I came across this portable bluetooth speaker. It has amazing sound quality for its size and is very durable. I bring this to the pool, on my patio, in the driveway, literally anywhere I go. It's made of a rubberized material and very compact and travel-sized. This is a water resistant speaker, NOT water proof so make sure you don't submerge it under water or in anything else. The sound quality is loud, crisp, and clear. Connects very easily to not only my bluetooth phone but also my laptop. The battery lasts around 6-8 hours and charges pretty quickly.
Had this since September 14th and it has already gone bad will not power up.  I thought Bose was one of the best.  Guess not.

The sound is amazing! It gets pretty loud with out being distorted. The only thing that bothered me was the batter life. I charge it from dead to fully charged and I can hardly use it for 3 hours before it dies again. I am only using it to listen to my books on cd while cleaning so its not like I am asking to much from it. Ended up selling this speaker to get a JBL charge 3 as my husband has one and I tend to use his more than the Bose speaker.

I’m not an audiophile by any means. This is just my opinion as a music lover. The sound quality of the music itself on this is great as is expected with Bose. The volume capability is pathetic. Especially for a Bose. Max volume is disappointing. And the battery life is not great either; it states that it’ll run for 8 hours at HALF VOLUME... however, half volume is so quiet that it isn’t even an acceptable listening volume. I was super stoked to get it on Prime Day for a good deal... I ended up returning it within 2 weeks and 3 different listening experiences. I’ll keep searching for something better that is portable with great sound quality, volume capability, and battery life.

The intended use of this seems to be to easily play music at parties, throw it out on your deck and listen to some tunes. It's probably very good at that, perhaps one day post COVID I'll find out. I wanted a speaker for my computer, that would let me take it into the kitchen or wherever if I chose to.However as a regular speaker (hooked into say AUX and AC power), it's a bit questionable. Even when plugged into power, it turns itself off after not receiving audio for a bit. So you'll find yourself turning it back on. A lot.

I am really happy with this bluetooth speaker.  The sound quality is excellent, and the speaker can be turned up quite loud.  I used it at a jog-a-thon-type event at the school at which I work, and even with over 100 students cheering and participating, you could still hear the music.  I imagine it would be more than adequate for a smaller gathering like a pool or house party, or camping.  The free Bose app that is optional to use is very handy.  I never have trouble connecting the speaker to my phone via Bluetooth.  My only complaint is that the battery life seems to be only about 3-4 hours, and I wish it were a little longer.  But otherwise, I LOVE this little speaker.  It's so tough, too.  I carry it back and forth to work every day, and it's even taken a tumble off the shelf in my classroom and kept right on playing.

There are many forum threads about Bose speakers dying and never coming back to life. However, I am not permitted to cite any of them according to Amazon's guidelines that prevent external links. (I had to resubmit this review because I tried citing my complaints about this product!)This is what happened to me. I bought this in 2018 and let it sit without use for a while (I moved). Now, it doesn't turn on at all. They say to try factory resetting it, but nope, it's dead. Completely dead. And supposedly, Bose will replace it. I've heard some nightmares about their customer service, so I don't feel like I have the time or energy to bark up that tree.

I cannot sufficiently express how poorly designed this POS is. There is no way of knowing if it is charging or not, no light or sound to indicate connection to a power source. I had it plugged in for two days only to find out there was zero charge. When it has been actually charging for some time, the voice says something unintelligible that sounds like "battery pie". It has never said "battery full" at any point. There is no row of illuminated dots or digital screen showing the amount of charge like on pretty much every other wireless device ever made. But I could just run it while it's plugged in, right? Nope. If it is not charged, it won't run even when plugged in. What a joke.Even if the sound quality were excellent and not strictly average, it would not be worth the money this pile of junk costs. Huge waste of money. Stay far away.

We received this speaker as a gift from our wedding registry, the whole reason we registered for it was because we wanted a speaker that was long lasting and quality which to us previously meant BOSE branded items. I will never buy a BOSE product after this. I have tried all the factory and suggested resets and nothing, it wont turn on and wont charge after 1.5 years of moderate use. Now we need it to leave on at night for our puppy who wont sleep and I am left buying something new. I will not be accepting the $75 product replacement offered by BOSE for something that will likely stop working again, I will take my money elsewhere.

I thought it would have more power and volume than the $20 tinker toy 4 year old Bluetooth speaker it replaced.  Nope.  Pretty much the same.  The cheap old speaker had its own volume control that allowed it to be turned up on its own and outside of the smartphone volume control.  The bose speaker is limited to the volume output of the SmartPhone.A real disappointment for a Bose product.

2 features are most important to me: good sound and durability (water resistance etc.). Price is of course a factor and assuming bt connectivity and other basic stuff is working as expected.I got this speaker during Prime Day which was a great deal - around 30% discount!

Siempre me gustaron los productos de esta marca, pero este resultó razonable de precio. Se asocia con el teléfono bien fácil. La única crítica es que hay que comprar el cargador aparte, viene con un cable para cargar con la computadora o se agrega a otro cargador. Funciona pero el cable no es muy efectivo. Para un producto de esta calidad, podrían agregarlo.El sonido es impresionante, excelente. Es compacto y discreto pero llena una habitacion de música. Excelente compra.

this bose has the greatest sound ever. i read some reviews that is stopped working after a few times. well, so far so good . i play music all day for residents in a nursing home. loud enough for them to hear and enjoy. i wanted a red and got the white color. but the white works. didnt want my residents to not have music. . music is everything and this speaker does its job. for the price. .......cant beat it.

It's now 6 days after Amazon's return window and this sucker is dead. Kaput. Lifeless. Ceased to be. Yes, while it was alive it provided nice sound quality but now it won't charge. I went through the Bose forums to find answers and the reboot function did diddlysquat in reviving it. I tried many times and with different wires. Nada.Bose, seriously what were you thinking of producing such a pricey paperweight?  Were the engineers asleep designing this thing? There should be the ability to select a single point of the star. One star is giving it too many accolades.

I'm about ready to use another device. Although the speaker has solid sound quality, it's bluetooth connection is incredibly spotty. Sometimes it connects to my Apple devices, other times it doesn't. Lately it's been more non-connection mode. I know there's not a problem with my iPhone because my Fitbit and other bluetooth devices connect to it just fine. It's just the Bose.Daily I have to trouble-shoot for it to get to connect to Bluetooth. For example, toggling bluetooth off/on on my phone. I wish there were a cord I could use as a backup for when Bluetooth fails (which is daily).

Too much bass!  Can't adjust.  Have to put the main side of the speaker against a cushion to lessen the boom that vibrates the apartment, and probably is felt with other tenants.  Have to keep the volume much lower than I would like, which is quite low, to tolerate.  Often can't even hear the treble sounds in a normal way. I've had this for over a year, and only recently have been using it a lot.  Quite annoying not to have a way to adjust.  Listening to Pandora and YouTube with it. Otherwise the speaker is great.  It lasts a long time on it's battery.  it's highly portable, whatever room you are in.  Weight is tolerable for traveling.

1) This speaker will not control the volume as you would expect it to do. When linked to a stereo sound system (a new Yamaha RX-V383)  using Bluetooth, the volume controls on speaker do not work, and the volume is low. Using an iPhone, it controls the volume by controlling the volume slider on the phone, not changing the volume of the speaker itself. We were told by Bose that the unit was only meant to be used with a phone and was not compatible with our home sound system. There is no indication of this behavior anywhere on-line, so we are returning it.2) The sound quality was not what we expected. It distorts at a relatively low volume, so would never do for a party.

This little speaker sounds great! Exactly what you would expect from Bose. However, if you are using it on battery and you turn off your music source, it goes to sleep. This is great! Saves the battery from going dead when you forget to turn it off. However it will not turn back on unless you connect it to the power cord for even half a second. Then it will work fine on battery again. I called the Bose technical support, they are aware of this issue. Their fix is to turn off the automatic shut-off or always keep a power cord handy. This is not what I expect from Bose! I would have given it one star but it does sound great! If you're not transporting it around and not going to be using it on battery a lot, it is still a great little speaker....

I won't buy a Bose bluetooth speaker again. After a month, it stopped being able to hold a charge. I didn't keep packaging and my time is worth more than it would take to contact their support over a $100 speaker.In general, it doesn't surprise me. The speaker seemed over-engineered (thus, overly complicated and prone to problems and frustration). For example, it tries to speak in many languages. But not only can you not understand what it's saying, it's just annoying and more complicated than it should be. I guess that approach of too much complexity with associated problems went into all aspects of the speaker, as reading reviews now shows that this problem of not charging after a short period of time is affecting other people, too.

I bought one of these for my personal use and I'm very happy with it, so much so that I decided to give one to a friend. When he made the connections and tried playing music from his computer the volume on the speaker was very low and it could not be controlled from the computer or from the speaker itself. We thought it could be a problem with the speaker or with his computer, but after some research on the net we found out that many people had the same problem and Bose did not offer a solution to it. Luckily, we returned it  to Amazon and I received a full refund. If you are buying this, I suggest you make sure beforehand that it is going to work properly with your computer.

Initially I was satisfied with this product. It is a small portable speaker, so I wasn't expecting it to be too loud or crisp.  It sounds pretty similar to other speaker of the same price and size, it just happens that Bose is a company that I trust because I have happily used their headphones for years. I am a bit disappointed that I can't say the same about this device since I won't be able to use it anymore (it just won't charge) and it hasn't even been a year.

I purchased this to use exclusively on conference calls. The call audio was so bad I switched to my iPhone X speaker rather than continue on the Bose. I tried many different ways and adjusted the volumes as well, but the iPhone X speaker was always superior to using the Bose for a conference call.I did not use it as a speaker, so I cannot speak to its use as a speaker. I have had Bose speakers in the past (I still have a Bose Bluetooth speaker) and they have been great for listening to music. However, this item does a terrible job as a conference call speaker.

I have to update my review of this: I loved it when I first got it, and the sound quality is still great, but after a couple months it began randomly shutting off and it wouldn't turn back on until it was plugged into a power supply again. This wasn't an issue of needing to be charged - most of the time I would plug it in, and it would have full or medium battery charge and it would just randomly shut off in the middle of being used. I've had it less than a year, and it won't charge. I tried several different cables to charge it, and then tested those cables with other devices and the cables are able to charge other things, but the speaker itself won't charge. This speaker has never been dropped or been around water, it just sits on my kitchen counter or my TV stand, so it's not a matter of damage either.I'll be contacting Bose to see if they can replace it.

Return window closed on 8/16/19 and on 8/18/19, the speaker completely stopped playing any sound out of it except it's own voice.  I tried to connect multiple devices which had no issue with the speaker before and they too would not play any sound from the speaker.  I tried different music services and still no sound.  This is a BAD PRODUCT.  Example:  I tried to connect to the unit from my bedroom this morning and it would not play the music - it said it was connected and turned on but the music kept coming out of the music device and not the new Bose speaker so since it said the charge was low, I plugged it into the charger.  Still it would connect and NOT play music.  I unpaired it, tried it with another device and through at least 7 attempts of all of those options the music never once played out of the speaker.  I turned it off.  Then decided to try something else 20 minutes later and when I turned on the device, which was completely charged when I turned it on, it said it had a medium charge.  So, it was turned off with a full charge and 20 minutes later the charge went to medium with no explanation at all.  DO NOT BUY THIS DEVICE it is defective.

The battery does not last long at all!  I'm constantly having to charge, very annoying.  It will connect with my phone and my husband's phone automatically, unless one of us turns off our Bluetooth completely.  If we are both connected, and I'm listening to music, anything he does on his phone interferes and makes the Bose cut out.  Every single day I have to text him to turn off his Bluetooth.  It's really quite annoying also.  If I were to purchase another portable, Bluetooth speaker, it wouldn't be this one.  I want to love it, these two issues are just irritating.

I like the speaker, it is very nice. The interface and bluetooth. they are from another planet. This device will sync with 2 devices, so I connected it to my laptop and my cell. Here is where it gets annoying. The speaker is in my laptop bag, i power up my laptop, and shortly after i hear the speaker turn on, state its battery life and that it is now connected to my laptop.  I open my bag, press the power switch and it turns off. 10 seconds later, it powers on again, states its battery life and that it is connected to my laptop. This will continue forever. I expect much better from Bose.In the video, I have just powered the speaker down, and started the video, you will not less than 10 seconds it will power up and connect.

When it arrived it wouldn’t take a charge. I sent it back to Bose. When I got it back it took a charge, but battery life was never longer than 3 hours. I have had it for about a year and a half now. The battery life is down to around an hour.The sound quality is decent. Not any better than the $50 speakers out there. Certainly not what I expected from Bose.

We have 3 of the original ones: Bose SoundLink Color Bluetooth Speaker and when our daughter headed to college she took her little brother's with her so we ordered a replacement for him not realizing that this was an upgraded (and even better model). The bass sound is really impressive and the overall sound is very clear. Never choppy or statically despite it being a bluetooth connect. Device has a wired connection too which is great to connect to a laptop for videos / video games.  Didn't add a picture this time since it looks exactly as advertised.

I own a lot of Bose stuff, and I was excited about these speakers.  The sound quality is excellent, but after playing for a while the music starts to break up and skip.  I contacted Bose support and they said to download a newer software revision.  I did that and the problem might have even been worse, but maybe the same.  My phone works fine with other blue tooth systems, including another Bose wireless speaker.  I also tried with my IPOD w/ blue tooth, and had similar problems.  I would like to own these speakers, but they are very frustrating.  I am sending them back.

Edit: 11/18/19 - so, this speaker only lasted a year and 7 months. This means it's out of warranty and I feel like I wasted my money.  I thought Bose is quality product but I guess they don't last.Also, I noticed that the battery life is pretty bad on these speakers. After about 3 months into using it and it progressively gets worse. Before it won't charge completely, it stopped playing sound. Dont buy it if you want something that last.

Listen the pictures show it clearly soaked in water droplets. So I bought this for a float trip. I did not submerge it under water but it did get a LITTLE water on it. Well after my float trip it stopped working. Yeah the $129 that I spent on speakers that I thought would be well worth it? Not so much. This is a garbage product. I liked Bose because they are so well known for their sound. My brother has a JBL and that actually is water resistant. That too was brought on our float trip, became a little wet and look it still works to this day. That float trip was over two years ago! I'd go with JBL. Bose doesn't seem to know how to make a water resistant Bluetooth speaker.

The device arrived as promised and the Bluetooth connectivity was easy. The enclosed instructions are sparse, so be prepared to search the Internet to learn more about speaker functions. Look for Bose SoundLink Color, not the older mini product.The speaker is much heavier than I expected. Construction is solid.

bought this Bluetooth sound system for my husband because he is a long haul truck driver out 18 days at a time and watches shows and movies on his tablet while in his truck. After 11 years of trying many different sound systems they were always too soft. I tried this and he is in love with it, it is as though he is in the movie theater. It is so awsome that I went out and got one for the house, and yes I love to crank up the sound to the fullest so I drown out any other noises. It is portable so I can take it anywhere I want, including the yard, my car, the beach. I can also play it in one room and have it loud and clear in another room. It might not be a surround sound but it is just as great and is worth every penny! It would be a great present for anyone any age.

I've had this product for less than 2 years and it will no longer turn on. The last time I put it away I made sure to fully charge it and I really only use it occasionally.I've gone through all the troubleshooting steps that I've found online and even contacted Bose support. The only option is to pay $75 bucks for a replacement and I'm not going to pay again to replace a defective product. There are many many posts online with similar complaints if you look up "Bose Soundlink won't turn on".

GF bought me one of these for a gift. I used in in the tub connected to my phone. I was surprised at the overall sound quality at reasonable "bath time" volume levels. After a few soaks, I decided I liked it enough to get another one and thus be able to listen to the pair in stereo.That's where most of the trouble begins.  There is a specific way that you have to connect the speakers to achieve a stereo pair.  And about 1/4 to 1/3 of the time.. it simply doesn't work. It will look for the other speaker, a mere 3 feet from the first one, and never find it forcing you to begin the routine again and again and hope that it eventually works.  Or worse, it will find the other speaker and lose connection with the first one. In these times the first speaker actually appears to be completely dead and non-responsive and you are forced to go plug it into it's USB charging cable in order to wake it up again.

I purchased this speaker in March of 2017.  When I received it, I was so impressed with it and loved it.  The speaker has great sound for a small speaker.  About six months later it stopped working.  I called Bose and they sent me another speaker.  Good customer service. Fast forward to June of 2019 and the speaker stopped working AGAIN.  I called Bose expecting that great customer service they gave me last time and was told it was no longer under warranty.  Bad warranty! They offered me a discount to BUY another speaker.  Why would I buy another speaker when I know it won't last??  Don't buy this speaker unless you believe that $129 ever year is a good deal. They obviously have had lots of trouble with this speaker because my friend had the same problem.

This was a great product when it was new. Exceptional sound. Very good Bluetooth connectivity and range. Acceptable battery life.At almost exactly four months it is simply stopped working no lights no sound no nothing.

This is my first portable speaker and I'm not a sound/speaker expert.  I can use the speaker while charging it, which is great because sometimes I need it to last more than 8 hours.  Works well with with auxiliary input and Bluetooth.  I did not download the Bose Connect app and not planning on downloading it unless the app has equalizer.  The only thing that I'm not too crazy about is that it has a bit too much base.  Normally, in my car, I usually adjust my speakers to get more base but somehow this speaker just has a bit too much base for my taste.It's light enough, 1.5 lbs.  So far, dust doesn't clink to the speaker as I fear because of the silicone cover, but the base of the speaker traps dirt/hair that I can't seem to get it off using just my fingers.  I'm not too worry, probably a wet towel would clean that up.

We absolutely love Bose sound and have had our Bose radio, which we have other devices jacked into, since 1997 and it still looks and sounds fantastic. We've purchased other portable speakers/docks for outside use but never with the same results Bose provides, so we decided to grab this one to use by the pool.Hallelujah! What a spectacular purchase! Everyone in the family has sinced to it easily, the sound is crystal clear inside and out, charge lasts and lasts, and I even use it at school events as a teacher to play sound effects or mood music  It's compact size is just perfect for traveling but don't let the size fool you. It's a powerhouse.

I use my Soundlink in the kitchen.  Face it out of a corner for the best bass response.  I have learned a few things about this speaker the past 12 months.  It is very sensitive to the number of Amps your power block and cable can provide.  I used to just grab a charger that was close by, but I learned quickly not all power blocks and cables are the same.  Use a 2.1 Amp or 2.4 Amp block and be sure to use a USB 2.0 Fast Charge cable to get the best results.  A lower Amp block or cheap cable and you may not get the assuring "beep" when you plug it in to charge.  The lower amps will also cause it to charge a lot longer.  Fire TV stick or Roku power blocks do not provide enough juice.  Phone chargers will not either unless they are "Fast Chargers".  Kind of sad that for the price Bose does not include a proper set up like the JBL speakers so that customers do not have issues.  This is my reason for dropping a star.

I've been using this little speaker intermittently for the last 3.5 years.  I was pretty happy with it.  not a care in the world.  Then, the day after exhausting the battery, it won't charge.  At all.  As though it's not plugged in. Of course, first I blame myself; I tried a different outlet, a different charger. I ran through all the troubleshooting nonsense.  nopey nope. dead. got on the bose site and was told I was out of luck, they'd be happy to give me a discount on another one.  And why would I do that?  I'm holding a perfectly functioning UE Boom in my hand that's survived happily for the last 5 years.  And it was/is cheaper than the "discount" price Bose offered.  so that's a hard pass, Bose.  I've learned my lesson.

I have the the original Bose Soundtouch Bluetooth Speaker, the Soundtouch II only works with smart devices with volume controls. If used with a device like an XM radio (dumb device) with an external Bluetooth transmitted it will connect but only at full volume. The volume buttons on the speaker do not function and expect smart device to control the volume. Bose engineering admits feature dropped and said to return it. Support was very poor took two weeks, three phone calls and two emails to identify design fault.

Great sound, battery, connects to damn near everything-- All of that is great.The issue is that it's *thirsty* for attention. The moment my laptop opens it starts prattling on about what its connected to, REGARDLESS IF IT WAS OFF. Hitting the power button is just a suggestion to this speaker.

This speaker has an annoying "feature" that caused me to rate this two stars. When connected to a power source, and, with the Auto-Off feature disabled, the speaker still shuts off at low volume levels. You can't listen to classical music or jazz at low volumes without it shutting down. When this happens, raising the volume level on the source causes it to come back on at blaring volume levels. I contacted Bose about this but they sent me an unhelpful pro-forma email describing how to turn the Auto-Off feature on and off. They ignore the fact the speaker shouldn't be shutting off at all when connected to a power source. I found this behavior so annoying that I sold it on eBay at a loss. I give it two stars because it's a quality product albeit one with too much bass.

I ordered the Bose sound link 2 speaker. After about eight months of use, it started having issues with pairing. The battery would also frequently die even though it had hardly been used and was just charged.  I tried numerous times to connect with Bose, this was an expensive product. There is no customer service or opportunity for repair. Just an offer to buy another one at $75!  Bose, tell me why I would do that when the first one did not work and I cannot connect with someone to help fix it?

This thing was nice when it worked. There were times when the bluetooth would freak out and give me a hard time. Battery life was meh. I only ever used this at night for about 30 min, to an hour and never seemed like it held a charge all that great. But i was willing to overlook those things so long as it did it's job. Which it did...for 4 months. Well almost 4 months. The battery just died and never charged ever again. too bad really. This was a nice speaker. As of right now though if you're looking at this i suggest you look elsewhere.

Bought this speaker as a gift for my girlfriend.  The speaker was working great until we let the battery completely die at her house this weekend. Now the speaker will not charge.  The return window ended for the speaker 2 days before this issue so now we are stuck with a $100 Bose paperweight.  Disappointed that Bose's quality has become this poor and Amazon is selling this speaker even though this issue apparently is common if you search online.

Was a good speaker but died just outside of the warranty.  Had the same thing happen to Bose soundlink mini.  Will never buy another Bose product.  Good sound but just doesn’t last long.  I’ve gotten more life out of Bluetooth speakers I got for free at trade shows.

While it lasted the Bose SoundLink Color Bluetooth Speaker II was an awesome speaker.  However over time after plugging and unplugging after so many times the port that you actually plug into goes bad and you can't charge or even plug and play anymore.  This is now a known issue on these and also the Bose SoundLink Micro which I have also ordered.  Although at this time the Bose SoundLink Micro haven't had the issue yet.  Perhaps because I haven't used it as much. Everything is perfect with this except for the issue I mentioned.

I'm sending it back because it's not my taste, but it's actually a pretty good speaker.  It doesn't distort, it can go very loud, it's easy to move around.  The reasons I'm sending it back are:1) It has that "one speaker" sound, the sound comes from a very isolated area.  This may be because it's a more vertical orientation.  The replacement speaker i got has a horizontal orientation and produces sound that, even though the volume is about the same as the Bose, it's a broader sound, more like you would get from a boom box. It sounds more natural to me than the Bose.

This is my third Bose Bluetooth speaker.  Still have the Soundlink Mini which still works although replacement batteries are not made any longer.  For the Soundlink Color, I like the size and shape of the product.  The sound is very good, however the battery is a hindrance.  I’ve only had a few hours of sound before it gives an audible “battery is low” and shuts off.  The Soundlink Mini had much better battery life.  The other thing I don’t like is that they added voice connection info which plays every time you turn it on.  So, when I’m ready to switch from phone to speaker, the music stops while the speaker says  “Battery is medium, connected to Dad’s iPhone...” and then the music starts.  I liked the Mini which just played a distinct beep when it connected and there was less of a break in the music.  There are a couple symbols on top that are not easily identified as to their purpose.  I’d prefer some text in English instead.  In the effort to make a global product, you lose clear communication.  I included photos of the top of the Color speaker and the older Mini.

Overall, I love these speakers. Sound is great. My biggest issue is with the set-up instructions.  Took the instructions out of the box, followed the following instructions:1. Connect to power using a wall charger (not provided). Luckily, I read the reviews and purchased one before I ordered the speakers.

Love this speaker! I've had it for a couple years now and it's the best speaker I've ever owned. I was hesitant to spend so much on a speaker since I never really owned one but this was a great choice! I love how portable it is. Battery lasts a long time (I use it heavily on a daily basis) and the durability over all is great. I've dropped it, spilled water on it, it fell into a chlorinated pool (TWICE!!!!) and it still works like new and I haven't had any problems with it. Always connects to whatever device I am using and setup is easy. Highly recommend this speaker

I couldn’t be more dissatisfied with this purchase. It turns on randomly, beeps uncontrollably, turns off randomly when the battery is medium or even high. Sometimes it gets staticky and other times It’s fine, even at the exact same distance from the computer it’s connected to. The worst part is the beeping. All the time while it charges. I’ve done a factory reset a bunch of times. The thing is just garbage.

The first one I bought  was defective would not play. I contacted Amazon, they sent out the same color replacement and I received it within 24 hours...  This new one was a breeze to set up...  I would highly recommend..I am listening to sirius radio from my iphone 11pro,,, through the boze soundlink speaker... love this.. I especially like when my daughter and I are together and wanting to listen to the same thing, we can dock each of our bose soundlink stereos together...

This device sounds and works good until its ignored for one month.It is very important that the Bose SoundLink Color's charge isn't allowed to drop below a certain level or it will not charge at all, until a special "reset" procedure is performed. What's even more troubling is that the special reset procedure isn't found in the owners manual supplied by Bose, but on online websites, and youtube videos.
