I use Bluetooth speakers a lot, almost exclusively to either listen to music in the shower or while cooking or doing dishes, so pretty often. I've been wanting a high-quality speaker for years, and finally caved and dropped the money on this one. I've only owned it for the day, but it functions perfectly so far and is much louder than the ones I'm used to, and the sound quality is insanely better as well, which is exactly what I was after when I decided to drop over a hundred dollars on a portable speaker lol. I definitely recommend this if you're looking for a solid portable Bluetooth speaker with big and quality sound. I'm also really impressed with the bass. I don't have a ton of experience with high-end audio devices like this, but I feel like it was worth what I paid.

...however, for only $100, this particular Bose product isn't overpriced, like most of this other stuff.  I own the previous generation of this unit, and I can tell you this new model is quite a cut above.  The only nit I have is that Bose still uses these unresponsive, squishy buttons that leave the user wondering if anything has happened when they are pressed.The unit could also use a small LED display to let Bluetooth users know how much volume is resident when engaged.  Why?  Well, the vast majority of devices that connect to a powered Bluetooth speaker are Bluetooth *themselves*, so when the volume isn't what you expect it to be, users need to be able to set levels on *both* connected devices to set desired sound levels.  On the Bose, however, users have to keep pushing squishy buttons up and down and guess if they're having any effect.

I never write reviews but now with time on my hands and knowing people are at home possibly upgrading their home entertainment systems, the short version is: DO NOT ORDER THIS.It constantly cuts out and I know this is not due to an internet issue. These issues occur whether I'm streaming Spotify, iTunes, or my favorite radio station (s/o to KEXP.ORG).  I also have to disconnect and reconnect it because when it's on and I'm on a Zoom call (like we all are lately), the sound is terrible and echo-y according to others on the Zoom. When I reconnect, it stutters for awhile before finally deciding to connect. But sometimes it decides not to! So I push buttons on the device itself, choose connect on my laptop, etc.

I have one of these speakers and I absolutely love it.  So while we were at our Father's Day celebration this year, my dad mentioned that he takes the old old radio we had in our bathroom from the house I grew up in outside to listen to his talk radio (I'm not lying to say the radio he uses is 30-35 years old).  He also mentioned he loves using his iPad to play easy listening music on his other speaker but using that speaker means he needs to stay inside because it's not portable.  Hearing this, my wife and I looked at each other and said we need to get him this Bose speaker.  He can ditch the radio and listen to his easy listening music on his back porch and enjoy the weather.  I took it up to him, showed him how to use it.  I had to explain a few times how he can select an app on his iPad and listen to it on the speaker but he got it.  The next day I got a text saying how it was so peaceful and nice to sit on his back porch and listen to Elvis on his speaker.  My parents have a lot going on health wise and to hear my dad say how happy and relaxed he was listening to Elvis while sitting outside made my heart full.

I ordered this Bose speaker to replace the Bose mini 2 I had. The Battery died and would no longer charge. I use it when I sit outside on the patio so connecting with a cable is not an option. I had no problem connecting to my iPhone, iPad and tv however, I am unable to control the volume when it is connected to the tv. Apparently there is an issue using the speaker with the newer Samsung smart tv’s. I tried doing the updates and reset the speaker as was suggested by Bose but it did not work still not able to raise or lower the volume either on the speaker or the tv. The volume stayed at very low.My husband also had a Bose Mini 2 for his tv in the garage. I was able to connect the speaker to his tv and volume control was fine. I let him keep this one and took his mini and connected it to my tv. All is well now. Just be aware this speaker may not be compatible with certain tv’s

Proved more difficult to set up with my computer than I had imagined and has a really annoying habit of telling you it has been disconnected for ten minutes after the computer goes to sleep, which is a pain in the neck if you forget to turn off before you go to bed.  Hard to set up individual names for the multiple speakers and only one remembers its name, the other cannot despite many attempts.Sound is good and portability is great.

I'm not a sound expert, but standing in a retail store trying several speakers demonstrated this was indeed the best. I picked this up when this color was on sale. Couldn't beat $80 for this sound gem!  i can hear everything clearly throughout my 2,100 sq ft house with this thing!!!!! I also have a comparable JBL speaker. It's good, but honestly, nothing beats a BOSE.

I would have given it 4 stars if it were half the price that it is. The sound quality is not what I would expect from Bose. Since you cannot adjust treble/mids/bass, you are stuck with the standard sound and can only adjust via whatever music source you are using. The battery life has dwindled down to about 45 minutes at this point. It is not very loud but it can get the job done for a few rooms indoors. Outdoors, it gets easily drowned out by my neighbors' music in the yard next door. (I have been trying to see which portable speaker they are using, so I can purchase that one next.)It is just too pricey. I would value it, brand-new, at about $50.

This is my second Bose Soundlink Color Bluetooth speaker. I needed another 1 so I could keep 1 at school in my classroom and 1 at home. You won’t find a small Bluetooth speaker with better quality. These have Bose quality sound.  I’ve had my first red one for 5 years and purchased a navy blue (SoundLink Color Bluetooth Speaker II) one this year.DEFINITELY GET A PROTECTIVE CASE. Because this portable, you’ll take it everywhere and are more likely to drop it every now & then.

To say it has been a disaster in buying this product is an understatement! I have Bose equipment they all work flawlessly. NOT this speaker! Worked twice then stopped working. Went to the internet to find problem issues I tried all the reset procedures to no avail.I called Amazon to exchange the speaker and things have gotten worse. After staying on the phone for over an hour trying to resolve the issue my contact said she had to try to call Bose. She would call me the next day but not to call back and speak to anyone else. Didn’t hear back from her, so I sent an email. Got a response from someone different. Someone was going to call me back today. Crickets!!!!

This is a terrific unit. I use it to play music in a large classroom with good acoustics. I was hesitant to purchase because I thought such a little speaker would not be loud enough. It certainly proved me wrong. Bose is a great company with reliable products, and well worth the extra money compared to other, cheaper units. It's compact enough to pack in my music bag, charges quickly, and connects to bluetooth promptly without issues.

I wanted something I could use to play music in my apartment while working - during lockdown. This speaker in white is very stylish and easy to tuck on a desk or a bookshelf. The sound quality is amazing and the battery lasts really well. I  bough this one because it has an AUX port and I wanted that option to plug in a laptop or cell phone rather than use bluetooth, if needed. Highly recommend.
Worst experience : Ordered a replacement , let’s see how that goes.I received the product on 07/11 and when I connected with my phone it was working great and charging was fine too..

Had the original soundlink for about 5 years and loved it until the charging port finally gave out. Unfortunately this model has the same problems with the port after just over a month of use plus the overall sound quality is not as good. Why are we using mini usb chargers again?? Really just one of the worst chargers...never makes contact right, bends, breaks, and warps the port. Don’t let it completely die because it’ll take forever to know if the charger is making contact...it’s like dealing with a 5+ year old iPhone except only 3 weeks into owning it. Doesn’t have the bass quality of the original soundlink either

A friend had this in FL and I was really impressed it sounded so well outside. I took my delivery today and it paired instantly, using the Bose app, to my Moto G Play. The sound is a little too bassie for me but the sound quality is still good. I have not tried battery life yet (I'm plugged in) but will update later. I was hesitant because of so many poor reviews that were from 2016-2018. The recent reviews were much more positive so I took a chance. I just can't believe a Brand as iconic as BOSE would mess with their rep selling trashy cheap speaker ( price is relative , my other cheap apt Bose system was like $700). Anyway I will update. If this works well for only 2 years I would still consider it a worthwhile item. Of course we spend a lot of time camping so it will see some heavy use.

I give this somewhere between 3/3.5 Stars.I love the portability of it. There are some nice features, like the remaining battery level announced when turning it on. The sound is good, though not as great as I expected (the quality is fine, it just seems as though I have to turn it up very high in order to really hear it if I'm not right on top of the speaker).

I have an older soundlink, loved it but the battery life degraded after years of use. I ordered a Soundlink Revolve as a replacement. Volume control buttons don't work in Bluetooth mode! Spent hours in chat and on the phone to both Amazon and Bose, they all acted like they never heard of the problem before and recommended I send it back and get a replacement, Amazon replaced it in one day " Great Service"! Same problem!! I returned it. I've been happy with Bose products over the years, so I decide to order a copy of the original Soundlink that I like, Bose SoundLink Color Bluetooth Speaker II - Soft black. Same problem, %$^7*&*^&%^$! I returned it and ordered JBL, should have it tomorrow.

It didn't work when I got it. I had to drive over an hour to a Bose store to get it fixed. At the store I found out that the speaker was sent to me with out of date firmware. The person at the store fixed the speaker and it worked for a few months, although people complained about the sound quality when I used it as a microphone on Zoom. However, it suddenly stopped working a couple of months ago whenever I connected it with my Mac laptop. It connects for about 10 seconds and then disconnects. I called Bose customer service and was told it wasn't their fault, it was Apple's. This despite quite a few customer complaints about this problem on the web  and the fact that I have never had a problem with any other bluetooth device that I have used with my laptop. Their Mac firmware update program also does not work. It won't even open.

Otherwise nice speaker has an unacceptable glitch that caused me to return it. The speaker will detect a previously paired bluetooth source and turn itself on, whether you want it on or not (i.e. the on/off switch will not turn it off more than a few seconds until it detects the signal and turns itself back on). Per Bose support, this is a normal feature that can't be turned off. This issue is discussed in the Bose community blog, but for some reason, Bose is ignoring it.  To work around this "feature", each time you use it , you must either a) go to the bluetooth source device and turn off bluetooth (making it impossble to use the source for another device, e.g. headphones), or b) erase the speaker's memory of previous pairing, adding a step to turn it off, and then it must be paired again when you turn it on, requiring the additional re-pairing step. Maybe in some cases this feature is good, but in my case, the speaker is in my shower and the source is in another room, so each time I want to use the speaker, I have to retrieve it, take it to the other room, then re-pair it and return to the shower, instead of being able to just "power on".

I bought my first one a year ago to play on our patio. It worked great for the summer season. When I pulled it out to play this spring, it would not charge. I tried to update the unit per recommendations online. No help.We really liked the speaker, so I bought a second one.  We used it for about a month and again the ability to charge has failed.
I love the color!And it is fine to take with you in the shower.

This portable speaker is cosmetically well made. The sound is very good. There seems to be problems with the controls. After fully charging the unit, it would not come on by pressing the control buttons. After fully charged, I would need to plug in the cable to make it operate as it normally should......This is after a full charge. I never left it plugged in continually, but only till the indicator light was green. I have seen postings of the like as my post. There may be some control button issues or internal issues. I have read a post, identical to my post when even after charging, you need to plug in the cable to get it to perform. I have always used the original cable.

Again, for the reviewers saying these are failing or "bricking" on the firmware update (they always do.  I'm now three for three seeing this).  Yes its' a bug and they all do it.  Connect them to the USB port on a computer instead of just a power supply.  They may need to sit for some time.  Hold down the button with three dots for 10-15 seconds.  Try doing so leaving the USB connected or disconnect while holding the button.  Part of the problem seems to be if the battery gets run down too far.  Or the power supply used provides too little power.  It sucks but the point is, it hasn't failed and will wake.Original Review:

This speaker did not live up to the reputation associated with the Bose brand.  First off, it would not charge quickly- and would lose charge extremely quickly.  In fact, there were problems charging this speaker despite every single trouble-shooting procedure outlined online and in videos.  After 2 days of futile attempts, it was time to send it back.  I have since bought a JVC Bluetooth speaker which is terrific in every regard - and even cost a bit less.

For a portable speaker sound is strong and clear true to the Bose name. Material is a plastic covering that helps it from not slipping off the hands or countertop...however mine quit streaming music although connected and after trouble shooting with Bose customer service a second time, Bose themselves determined it defective. Bummed out and scared the replacement will fail me too. Will update review once it arrives.UPDATE!! The replacement came quick and the speaker has been working  PERFECTLY since!!! Love it so much!!

I bought several Bose speakers and headphones as gifts in the past. I did buy Bose headphones for me and very happy with them. But as speakers I felt they were a little overpriced and over rated. Then I decided to get these to be used while traveling. In summary I am very impressed with the sound (amazing). They added a rubber texture to these new models and they improved the handling of them. I have professional speaker monitors at home for listening but these sound natural, flat response (no artificial bass or treble boost) and room fulling perfect for travel companion. I do not know how Bose does it but I cannot believe the sound you get from such a small unit. They are well worth every penny.

I bought this speaker to use for calls while working remotely, and for the sound quality.  I know of their reputation for good sound quality, and in that regard, it did not disappoint.  The Bluetooth connection, however, is not always consistent, and I have to keep on selecting it as an option whenever I make a call, even though it acknowledges that it is connected to my iPhone.  I am a little disappointed that i have to do this since I have an off-brand, small speaker that though it lacks in sound quality, at least consistently kept the Bluetooth connection.I would recommend it primarily for the rich, sound quality, but not so much if you are bothered by having to remind it that is needs to maintain Bluetooth connectivity.

The speaker sounds great, but the battery was low the other day and I charged it for some hours now.  The battery isn't charging or showing a light indicating that it is charging. I'm highly disappointed that now I can't use this speaker that I've grown to love. It no longer chargers and is completely dead.*EDIT*

I got this speaker for a few reasons.First, the voice prompts because I’m blind. They could still use a bit of work, but Bose is definitely what the visually impaired should use.  I know that they bother some people, but they can easily be disabled via the Bose Connect app.

Speaker sounds great and looks great. The volume adjustment (on the speaker) stopped working. I must use the device from which I am streaming in order to adjust the volume. My phone, for example, is not always beside me, especially when I'm in the pool. So, adjusting the volume become a task... get out of the pool, find my phone, turn the volume up/down. The speaker is great otherwise. Great sound, loud volume when needed and looks great.Wish I could figure out how to fix the volume issue. I have googled the issue and none of the suggestions have helped yet.

The speaker has stopped working after 2 months of less than daily use. My husband plays a song or two in the evening. Now we are stuck with this speaker that doesn't work and at $100. I expected it to last longer than that. And you were suppose to be able to connect it to another Bose speaker for the "party mode", that NEVER worked. These companies that have the name recognition should also stand by their products and not put this crappy stuff on the market. Never again.

I teach yoga and use this for my restorative class. The first time I used it and the song with the water dripping and flowing had my students wondering if I brought in some water feature because it sounded so authentic!!! It made me have to use the bathroom, so I agree it sounds like you are right next to the stream! I get comments all the time about how great the sound is. The battery can only go about 2 hours which is a bummer but now that I know that I find a place with a plug. It does charge fast. I bought a case and I think that is key to keeping it nice.

Poor results using with app and multiple devices. After using device for months we regret buying this product.Not sure if Bose is struggling with the app or if the physical device is causing connection and syncing problems.

Awesome product!  I love how easy it is to connect to my phone, how portable it is, and how good the sound is.  Perfect for a small house or apartment where you don't want to overpower your neighbors with sound, but still want to enjoy high quality sound for your music.  I also like the party mode where you can pair two together, although you will need the app for that.  I strongly prefer the bluetooth connection to other brand speakers that require wi-fi.  Battery life is as advertised, and it charges pretty quickly and can play while plugged in which is nice.

I love Bose. I've owned speakers, my vehicle is a Bose system... but this speaker sounded no different than my Oontz Angle for a 1/4 of the price. It even distorted at higher volumes and I'm not talking about cranking it. The first bad product I've ever had from Bose. I returned it immediately.

Bluetooth issue, I spoke with Bose 2x and my computer manufacture (HP)  three times.  When ever play anything through my brand new 2017 HP ENVY laptop, music/radio sound  would stop for about 1/2 second and then resume. Downloaded all new and correct drivers and still had same issue.  If played through iPhone, no issue, worked great but wanted to play music through laptop at work.  If I played through AUX in, no issues.  Tech at HP told me had similar issue with similar product, (not Bose) and just kept moving Bluetooth device around room until it stopped.  I'm not going to do that.  Stated it is just an issue with Bluetooth connectivity, just drops periodically.  Disappointed because sound was great.

Well I read the reviews about the poor battery conditions on this product. So I called Bose prior to purchasing it. Of course, I was told the battery issue had been corrected. So I bought it. One month later, it doesn’t work at all. Amazon was great and is going to send me a replacement. We’ll see what happens. Bose, whom I always thought was a quality company (when the speaker worked, it was great) should be more upfront about the battery, including a recall of older product.

Great speaker when it is playing music, but there are a couple quirks that make it infuriating to own. First and foremost, it just turns off sometimes. It doesn't matter what the battery level is or what I'm doing with it, it will just turn off and not turn back on unless I plug it in. I always assume problems like this are just bad luck on my part and that I got a faulty item, but one of friends purchased the same speaker and his turns off and becomes unresponsive as well. The other issue I have, although not on the same scale as the last issue, is the built in voice speaking during use. If you are listening to music and another device connects, it stops the music to let you know another device that was once paired has connected, or disconnected, every time. Again, the sound quality is great, but the product does not live up to the standards I expect from Bose.

I have several bluetooth speakers and bought this one to be able to take it with me to rehearsals.  It never worked, not from the day it arrived.  It powered up, but would not connect to ANY device I tried.  In the middle of the night, one night, my Alexa suddenyl connected to it and it BLARED throughout the apt.  The volume wouldn't turn down.  I turned it off.  Turned it back on, it wouldn't connect to Alexa.  Sigh.  What a piece of crap.  And it ISN'T RETURNABLE.  DO NOT BUY THIS.

I bought the Bose SoundLink Color Bluetooth speaker from Amazon. It sounded fantastic.  The feel and size are great.  But in less than a month of light use it would not charge.  I called Bose.  They spent a long time with me on the phone.  I mailed the speaker to them.  I received a replacement.  Same problem, no charge shortly thereafter.  I would not recommend buying this speaker.I want a speaker that works and while the people at Bose were polite, I don't want to spend an hour and a half (hold time, talk time, go to the mail time) fixing this purchase.

After just over a month of having this speaker is just started playing very loud static... had to send it back. I had bought the older version about 3 years ago that lasted much longer but the blue tooth stopped working and eventually completely stopped
Love this little speaker.Some things that could bother some people:

Looks good, sounds pretty good - lots of bass, at times too much bass. Most importantly, the battery life on mine is so terrible that I will return it. It plays for only 2-4 hours before totally losing charge, and if you want to let it sit idle for a day or two between plays, forget about there being any battery left. Also, when the battery is low it won't play even when plugged in. It seems that my item is defective but I highly recommend checking reviews on this site and others before purchasing.

I still have the first generation and it works great. I’ve had it for 3 years and It’s gone through bumps, falls, on boats, etc. still working.I bought this one four-five months ago and it just flat out stopped working. I’ve tried multiple times to turn it on, different outlets, letting it charge for hours.. nothing. Its never gone anywhere. It’s been sitting on my mantle since I opened it. I’m pretty bummed.

When this arrived I actually lamented to my husband, we don't need "another" bluetooth speaker. We have some they are fine.However, this is far and away the best blue tooth speaker we've ever had. We've used it all weekend out by the fire pit. It's perfect. it gets LOUD and has a nice deep bass. It's perfect for outdoors. We compared it to a couple of other speakers we had and this one was far and away a superior product. It's a slim sleek design so it's easy to "hide" if you want to keep it out of sight. I wouldn't go so far to say my husband was right...but it's a great buy.

I am someone that appreciates sound quality and prioritizes it with any speaker/system I am playing music on. I wanted to find a waterproof/splashproof bluetooth speaker in the $100 range, and chose Bose as I always had good experiences with the name. This speaker’s sound quality is terrible. I dont expect too much from a portable speaker this size, but I have a sony speaker that is years old and half the price and it sounds much better in comparison. I generally do not go out of my way to write reviews, but as someone that needed good sound quality this did not come close to satisfying.The JBL Charge 4 is the same price, I would recommend that.

I may be a little biased by my past Bose experiences. I have a home theater with all Bose speakers (except the sub) and I have another Bose bluetooth speaker. That being said, I like this speaker. I got it on Prime day for a nice discount and had no trouble pairing it to my phone. The sound is of course great for the size of the speaker and connectivity is up to Bose quality. The only downsides are battery related. My other Bose speaker gives me a percentage where as this one is just a “high,medium,low”. I have no idea what to do with that. Also the battery doesn’t seem to last when not in use. Over a month with only about once a week use for an hour at a time, the battery went from “high” to “low”. So if you want to jam all day, this may not get you there on battery.

I bought this hoping it would live up to the product’s name. However, even from the first time I’ve started playing it, the music will play fine for awhile and then just start garbling/skipping. I have to power the system off and back on to get it to reset. I’ve tried this on multiple Bluetooth devices. I’ve even tried the reset’s that are on the support pages. Amazon unfortunately won’t take a return for it, so now I have to fight my way through support. I’ve been trying to contact support to no avail.

This is the second Bose Bluetooth speaker I have purchased from Amazon. Same problem again. The sound is amazing but they have this tiny tiny connector on the side of the speaker to charge it. That’s why I returned the first speaker. I bought another one thinking well “ maybe it’s. Me”. Well I don’t use it a lot but I had 4 of my friends try to plug the charger in and NONE of them could do it.Just a shame because I always thought Bose speakers were the best quality. So now it’s past the return date so I guess I have to throw it in the garbage. It’s a shame. Now I lost out on the money and don’t know what brand to get.

Overall a good speaker, connecting to the app on my phone does not accurately show the battery percentage like I thought it would it stays stuck at one level and then quickly shows it low. Battery does not last quite as long as I was hoping.Good sound and it is loud but starts to distort after a certain point. It is usually louder than I care to listen to it but still it distorts which I would not expect from this brand of speaker

Bought my second one cuz I like my first one so much, so now my son in law has one too.  I bought it with a case for an extra $8, worth it to carry it around.  Great Bose sound, plenty of bass for me, and gets pretty loud.  Battery lasts about 7-8 hours and you can still use it while it is plugged in the wall charging.

I've had this speaker for under two years... the sound is great and I love the portability. Even the amount of time it holds a charge is pretty good. BUT THREE times I haven't been able to get it to charge. Twice I've been able to do a factory reset and it has powered up and charged. This last time... nothing has worked. My recommendation... stay away and go to JBL. I also have a JBL Charge 3. Yes, it is bigger and heavier, but the sound is great and there are NO issues charging. So Bose... I'm very disappointed. Nothing else matters if the speaker can't be charged.

Love Bose..but have to say this little unit could be louder for the price. I am a little disappointed with the volume limits on this unit. great sound quality as Bose is known for but it just does not go loud enough. I purchased to replace my Harmon Kardon for portability reasons but it doesn't quite make it's match.  Overall it is good for small areas and serves it's purpose, but not exactly a party radio with big crowds. the sound will be drowned out.  Battery is pretty good on longevity, and blue tooth connection is simple.  Great seller delivery though, super fast! would purchase from seller again.

We are very much a BOSE household, because we love their products. The Bose SoundLink Color Bluetooth Speaker II - Limited Edition, Midnight Blue (Amazon Exclusive) is a portable speaker which can be taken with you, pretty much wherever you want to go. It's small enough to fit in a small bag or backpack, easy to connect, and the sound quality is pretty darn good.While this speaker is not meant to replace a home sound system, for a portable Bluetooth-connected speaker, you cannot go wrong.

This thing is fantastic!  Superb sound from a little BOSE speaker.  Battery life isn’t super long but I never timed it.  It lasts at least 2 hours.  It’s perfect for around the house.  Perfect for the deck or tinkering in the garage.  I bring it room to room if I’m listing to Audible and cleaning.  Music sounds decent, way better than similar sized speakers for $20-$75.  I bought it on Prime Day and I wish I had bought a couple more.  I think I only paid $80.  I have had it for a few months and no issues.  Sound is crisp and clear and even he’s decent base (not hardcore thumping but solid) when playing music.  I was actually watching football (Bears won!) on my phone the other day and used the speaker and it sounded like I had a home theater on (just set it up across the room facing you).  It really is one of those purchases that I’m just happy with, no let downs.

As much as I like this speaker, after a few weeks of use it started having trouble powering on. Even when fully charged, the power button would not always work. I found that the way to fix this was to plug it in for a second to "wake it up" and then press the power button. It's not a huge deal, but it's kind of a downer considering the price.UPDATE:

My first Bose speaker,  but not my first Bose item.  Bought to replace a cheaper speaker that just didn't have much sound, this one definitely does the job. Quick connection and you are ready to go.  It's not going to shake the windows, but the quality of sound is beautiful,  and it does have enough power for great listening.  I also was able to connect with my Alexa, so when we ask her to play music it sounds so much better than her built in speaker. I may buy a second one and hook them together in stereo mode for another added touch.

I am a Bose fan and the Bose SoundLink Color Bluetooth Speaker II did not disappoint. I purchased it primarily for work because I am a professional Facilitator and sometimes the audiovisual equipment I have to connect to only supports a VGA connector which means I have to use external speakers for sound. This little speaker delivers a lot of sound for its size. I can easily cover a room with 50 bodies in it. The speaker travels well because of it's size but because of it's quality construction it is heavier than less expensive options out there. I purchased this speaker during Amazon Prime Days  while it was on sale for $89.99  which makes me twice as happy with my purchase. I didn't rate the battery life because I rarely use it for more than two hours and I always make sure I recharge it before I use it again to insure that I always start off with a full charge.

Good source of sound for my morning shower and the time I need to get ready for the day. The bathroom is the perfect place for listening to music with this kind of speaker, the sound quality is great as long as the sound is contained to an amount of space that is not much larger than about 10'x10'. I've seen quite a few posts about issues with this Bose product but for me I'm really satisfied and happy with the performance and quality of this little guy!

Wrong decision this item. I bought it last January and it works for a couple of hours then it stops funtioning. The lights on top continue on but showing a confusing array. I have taken this item to the HOSE franchise holder, they update the software but the configuration is lost after a couple of hours of using the item. I returned the item to BOSE in Illinois, they refused to give me a refund, instead they sent me back the same speaker and it lost configuration, again, after two hours of use. Money lost. Don't buy anything from these people.

It worked perfectly when I connected it the first time. Two days later, it no longer worked.  The phone connected to the speaker but no sound came out. I tried trouble shooting, made sure it was charged, turned the unit on and off, made sure that no other devices were connected to the speaker, tried connecting again, made sure the volume on the speaker and on my phone were turned up. Did a hard reset (held the power button down for 10 seconds, then followed the set up procedure from the start and paired the phone). It connected agin but still no sound would come out. Note that the directions in the box are for a unit that is slightly different from the one delivered; the controls are not the same. Called Amazon support, no help. I returned the device. I have an earlier version of this device (Soundlink II) that I bought two years ago, and it worked perfectly every time. This one doesn't work.

When I first connected my phone to this product, I loved it. It took only a couple of minutes to set up and start listening to music. The next day, with a 100% charge, it quite playing sound from any device. The onboard voice told me I was connected, but no sound. I reset the speaker, worked with my phone, another phone, and a PC (all of which worked only hours earlier). It was incredibly frustrating. After reading online reviews, I found out this is a common problem. I am incredibly disappointed in the product as well as Bose. I only go through this sort of negative experience with a company ONCE. I returned the speaker and will not purchase another Bose product. The number of times this issue show up on internet reviews tells me all I need to know about today's Bose.
I only used this speaker a few times now it doesn’t want to pick up charge anymore it just keeps blinking and then charging  stops.Window for return is already done. That’s wasted money for me.

I need to add to the reports of the poor quality of this speaker. It sounds wonderful but has a critical flaw. It does not last. This is a very well known and documented issue with this speaker. Trust these reviews. Ask around online. Don’t let the sale price trick you into a disappointing purchase.Purchased in December,

Have had this product for less than a year and it won't charge.  Tried everything that Bose suggested and ideas from the on-line community but it doesn't charge up anymore.  Loved it while it worked but very frustrating to spend a decent amount on what should have been a good speaker to have not work.  Heard that there's been issues with this from other people as well.  Hopefully Amazon can step in and help with this one.
Pulled the trigger as a Father's Day gift.  Dad loved it - looks beautiful in the kitchen and sound is great.  Plug and play with Bluetooth and works well with multiple devices

After about a year, my Bose speaker is no longer charging.  Anyone else having this issue?  I'm quite disappointed as Bose comes with such a solid reputation.  I am not happy and will not replace, for the cost, there are much cheaper alternatives considering the shelf life of this.

Unfortunately, one of these speakers is faulty and won’t charge when plugged in - and I’ve purchased these as gifts for several family members - but if there’s no warranty, it’s a useless speaker after 6 months of minimal use.  How do I return this please - thank you!

Update: I’ve owned these for several years and I still love them, there’s an audio voice that tells you how much charge is left when you first turn it on plus which devices it’s connected to with Bluetooth.  Through the app (if you choose to use it) there’s several settings to adjust things like how long to wait in standby mode before it auto turns off... it’s a nice feature to save the battery. It easily recharges with most micro-USB cords (as long as it doesn’t have a super short tip; all my generic cords work fine but my Panasonic earpiece charging cord is too short).  When it starts charging there’s a single audible beep plus a continuously blinking red colored dot- so you know it’s working, which changes color again when it’s done charging.FYI: you can play music etc while it’s charging.

When I first got this unit about a year ago it was perfect. It filled up small rooms with sound, it had a plug in for an aux cord so I could use it to enhance sound from my TV and it had the battery power to go portable for a few hours.Fast forward about 6 months, this unit became plagued with issues. It will stop charging and randomly just not play sound despite being connected to a bluetooth. These complaints are well-documented online as well. Specifically for the "doesn't charge" issue - there are several work arounds you have to use including plugging it into your computer and updating firmware - constantly. Spending over $100 on a speaker, you don't want something that you have to worry isn't going to charge or requires you to fuss around with every. single. time. you want it to play.

I like the look and have used the older model as a travel speaker for a few years. Got these so I could have a mostly wireless solution for my desktop. Troubleshot for a few hours and found that Party/Stereo mode just don't seem to work with Windows. Syncs fine to my phone, but when connected to a bluetooth adapter on PC (tried two dongles on two PCs, both working fine with another pair of headphones), delay jumps up by about half a second, and constantly cuts out back and forth on the paired speakers, as if it doesn't know how to process stereo output from a PC. Happens in both modes and doesn't matter which is the master.Again, this ONLY happens when connected to windows, it has no problem with my android device.

If the speaker runs out of charge, you have to do a ridiculous hard reset (found that out only after searching the internet), and even then, my unit is dead only after 9 months. Tried updating the software at btu.bose.com, but that failed as well. NOT RECOMMENDED unless you want to waste your money. I contacted Bose, and they offered a new unit at a reduced price, but why would I spend more money to replace a faulty speaker with another one?!? Horrible, flawed speaker.

I had 2 JBL speakers break in one year and I have had this Bose speaker over a year now.I wouldnt mind it being a little louder. Its mic function is poor. Its reliable. I trust this brand now and will buy them again.

This was a gift for my son, and I know nothing about it (except that his wife suggested it) .  But since he rarely thanks me over and over for something I give him, I'm guessing that it really was the perfect gift.  He says the sound is great and I know he's happy with the Bluetooth connection.  He uses it in every room in their house - and outside as well.

⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ Sounds great, very portable!  Easy connectivity to Bluetooth. July 16, 2019REVISED:  ⭐️ That was my review until 13 days after the warranty ran out and it totally stopped charging. When the battery went dead, it died, too. I loved this but hate products that only last through a one year warranty. I contacted Bose customer service and after troubleshooting to no avail, they said if I return it they’ll send me a replacement for $75!!! What nerve! This is an expensive speaker! I complained and they said they’d take 50% off the $75. I have always been pleased by Bose products but selling something that only lasts a year and 13 days is unconscionable. August 3, 2020
Battery only last 2 hours Max (while cranked) What happened to the 8 hours?Returning it ASAP.

This is my second speaker like this. The first one sounded amazing, like this one. But it stopped working in just over a year. I read so many reviews and it’s a mixed bag with these, but nothing beats the sound quality of Bose in my opinion. So I bought the protection plan. This one seems to connect a little easier than the previous one I had. The black sort of gets dirty easily. I had blue before and it looked like you could throw it around like a toy. I thought the black might look a bit more serious and get more respect.

Bought this speaker back in 2017 and have only used it <12 times. The sound is fantastic and it's very easy to pair and use with multiple devices. One day I was listening and it just quit. The battery was fully charged. It would not, and still has not, powered back on. I followed all the "troubleshooting" advice a person could Google, but nada, nothing. When plugging it into my PC, I get an error saying that my laptop can't connect with the device. Chased that down for over two hours, followed all those fixes and again, nothing. So disappointed that I spent (at the time) over $130 and could only use it less than a dozen times before getting so frustrated trying to "fix" it, would be just as happy to never see it again. Bose has some of the best sounding devices out there, but I will think twice before I buy another Bose product.

Probably one of the worst speakers on the market.Sound quality- for the price, it should be illegal. The sound is distorted from a distance and from the back. You can only hear decent sound when directly in front of it. There are cheaper speakers that are way better. JBL flip 4, Tribit and Anker to name a few.

This is a very nice little bluetooth speaker. The sound quality is quite good, and the battery life is decent. It connects very easily One thing I really like about the speaker is that it puts out plenty of volume. It also seems very rugged (I already have knocked it off a table without incident). I'm not 100% thrilled with the soft, sticky coating, but I suppose that is protective. Very pleased with the purchase.

It's impossible to turn off  for more than 15 seconds if I leave bluetooth on on any paired device. It will automatically turn back on and reconnect. This is infuriating.If it's automatically disconnected from a device (say, after a computer falls asleep) then it will say "ready to connect" every minute or so until the end of time. It has woken me up on multiple occasions because my laptop fell asleep and it started shouting "ready to connect" continually. This is even more infuriating.

I have had 2 of these for a couple of years. Battery life is great! On lower settings they will last 8 hours. The option for stereo setting in the app with Bluetooth with left and right really brings music together.The bad.. the app doesn't always work. I'm left at times to plug a speaker into the USB to get them to connect. Sometimes just have to close the Bose app out and restart. Usually after 5 minutes of this I can get the speakers to connect. The Bose software definately needs help. After every update I'm in hopes that it was fixed but its not

The speakers are great when they work. The first one I had stopped working for no apparent reason soon after I purchased it. Luckily Amazon replaced the speaker for a new working one. In less than a year the second one stopped working too. I take very good care of my things so there is nothing I did wrong with the speakers. I've had a similar experiences with other Bose products. I love Bose but there products never last very long. I think I will call it quits now.

I use it with my Echo Dot in the bedroom/bath.  I cannot hear the Echo Dot when in the bath with fan running so find the bluetooth speaker is perfect.  It pairs automatically even if I've unplugged it to move another room.  I wish the battery life was longer but learned to keep it plugged in.

had three of these, the first one served for over a year until it suddenly died. the second one was turning on by itself in the middle of the day and night, looking "to connect"... returned it within a couple of weeks. the last one that was purchased in late August stopped charging in October... but unfortunately, it's too late to return now...although the sound is good, the recent glitches have cause too much frustration. not sure that will purchase Bose anytime soon again...

DO NOT BUY! Update - returned original for product replacement, new item said to arrive in 7-10 days. No emails, no tracking numbers. NO replacement! Bought on September 16th, charger port was slightly covered by the outer layer of silicone (or whatever material), figured it would be okay. Fast forward to October 7th - not charging at all. Charging Port is completely broken. I bought $30 speakers that lived at least a year. Feeling scammed. Going to contact customer support so we’ll see what happens.

At first I was surprised with slightly bigger size over the mini some.  But playing my iPhone music list on this using Blue Tooth music sounded like the bigger Famous Bose Wave Radio. Now we have our favorite music available anywhere in the house. Terrific Hi-Fi sound,  rich not tinny or cheap sounding. And the nice color helps me find where it is when not in use ! Battery life five hours plus ! Any charger with usb slot works in Wall or Car.

I reluctantly purchased this Bose product even though I have 3 Bose Wave radios and a set of Bose computer speakers in my home! My home products are fantastic! But my reluctance was caused by some of the negative reviews of this product. Anyway it arrived yesterday, took less than 5 minutes to set up, and sounds phenomenal! Just finished listening to the Bose during my morning workout after pairing it with the Iheartradio app. So while I've only had it one day I'm quite pleased. Will it develop issues like were reviewed...who knows, but for now I'm happy!!

Bought one from a store for my work computer.  I liked it so much I got it again, except in this off white color.  Sound quality is great, especially for watching videos.  Better than a previous version of another Bose Bluetooth speaker I have.  They work great and take up a small footprint.  The only thing I don’t love is the weird off white color.  Online, it looks white but in reality it looks like it was white but a lot of dust got on it and looks dirty.  I recommend getting the dark gray color.  This is the one that I got for my office and it looks great.

First thing I noticed when I took it out of the packaging was that it was gray, not white.  I thought there was some mistake but as I did some more checking in Amazon reviews I saw other reviewers also said it was gray.  The sound was better than some sound systems and not as good as some others but, in the price range, it's quite competitive with other brands and models.  I returned it because of the color.  I liked that it left a small footprint compared to older Bose speakers.  Finally, I decided I would like to have something with remote control so I'm still shopping for a bluetooth speaker.

4 stars because I had to return the first one as it did not take a charge. Second one only accepted a charge when i connected to my laptop. Linking to 3 devices was easy. And toggling between them easy. This is first day using it. Played all afternoon  only issue is when my internet signal dropped for steaming streaming service I was using,  however it continued  on it's own when signal restored. Sound is good, only very very slightly muffled, probably related to water resistant case. Great to have poolside.  Will repost if something changes. So far good investment

Good portable speaker as expected from Bose.  It looks good, has pretty decent battery life and overall quality is very good.  I have used it for both music and sound for a MacBook (for TV and movies on the go) and it actually performs much better in this capacity.  The original Mini II has better base, and for really full sound I'd go for the Harmon-Kardon Onyx (at 2X the price) but overall a good unit and expect it to last as most Bose speakers never die (I have 30 year old Bose 3.1 shelf speakers that still get it done in the garage!).

I purchased this so when we are grilling outside we can listen to music, the sound is great and connected with my Alexa very easily,  would have been nice if I could ask Alexa via this speaker but does not work like that. It's not a problem for me but it may be a problem for someone else looking for one... its water proof, the material surrounding it is so soft.... if bluetooth is on, all you have to do is touch your phone on top of the speaker and it will connect automatically to your phone! Very easy to use compact and cute looking!

So, i bought this for a company event. I tested it before the event, thank god!, and it HORRIBLE! you literally have to hold it to your mouth to hear anything through the speaker. This is a pin on microphone and you can't even pin it on because if you do, you will not hear anything. Also, I bought "new" this was definitely used. Returning!

This is the first Bluetooth speaker I’ve purchased so I’m not in a position of expertise. The connectivity is simple and without any hassle. For such a small device the sound is excellent. Haven’t used it enough to assess battery life. The unit is well built, controls are simple, and the material is soft and durable. The only downside is the expected color was Red and it is actually a washed out hue between Pink and Orange. There’s no way I’m returning it and would recommend it highly to anyone that asks.

I like this Bluetooth speaker. It has good sound, especially at upper loudness levels, and it also has a microphone, so you can use it with Android or Windows devices' respective assistants.The experience of using this in my office with my PC, then grabbing the speaker and going outside with my phone, or into the kitchen, is really quite seamless.

I bought this and it was delivered May 13. I have only charged it with the usb. Never into an outlet. I read many complaints about people’s speakers dying years ago and even some recent ones. I’ve had it for 2 months almost 3 and it has been one of the best purchases I’ve ever made. Pretty awesome. Not so good for the car if you have poopy car speakers. But indoors. Put this bad boy in a corner a lil high up and it THUMPS. No matter where it fills the room with thumping music. Amazing sound quality. And only at around half or a little above half volume. Personally I’d recommend to never play on full volume. I don’t just to avoid any possibility of the speaker “dying” as the reviews have stated. No problems so far! Worth the buy completely. Battery life is about 4-5hours on medium volume. Higher you go the more battery it uses. Love it though.

Started out as an excellent purchase, then three weeks after giving it to my son as a HS grad gift, it completely died. Would not charge, turn on, etc.  Bose makes great stuff, but will have to assume we got a lemon. Time for an exchange.

Updated 9/29/20: I will NEVER buy these again. I have had 3 of these speakers and each one had died just after a year of regular use. The sound is great, but they are way too expensive to be this bad in quality. The company will let you BUY a replacement at a discounted price, but that is still ridiculous. A $130 speaker should last longer than a year.I love these but I have had 2 die and need to be replaced. One lasted a few months and another one lasted about a year and a half. They are too expensive to have this happen!!
Excelente producto que puedo decir una marca reconocida hace mucho años , se oye muy bien en estereo..🤗 me encanta ♥️ compramos 2 por su buena calidad.. Gracias 👍 Amazon 💕

I really love this little Bose. Has amazing sound. Similar to the big ones, but for a fraction of the price. Hooks up wirelessly, through Bluetooth to my iPhone and my Kindle Fire tablet. Only complaint is that when it's actually on, there's a computer voice that says "connected to (my name)'s iPhone, and (my name)'s Fire" every couple minutes. I could do without the frequency of that. But I am keeping it 5 stars b/c honestly, just turn it off if it's bothersome and you aren't using it at the moment. The sound and price can't be beat.

Sound was fine. I liked how portable it was.After I failed to use it for a month or two, the battery wouldn't charge. I updated the firmware, tried the hold-the-multifunction-button trick, but it still would not charge. Because I waited too long to contact Bose support, it was out of warranty, and they only offered a discount on purchasing a replacement. I'm switching to a different brand. A battery shouldn't require this much babying. I have wireless headphones from a different company I didn't use for over 6 months, and they charged just fine.

I'm not totally complaining about this BASS issue, to me it is muddled sounding at high volume. The sound is acceptable at lower speaking volume but as volume goes up to the upper high end it tends to clip, sounding distorted.  As a plus, it syncs quickly to my iphone, which was nice. I downloaded the BOSE app. That's a waste. It only has a volume control. Would have been nice to have some equalizer control (bass, mid, treble).  I do recommend it for those who would be using it in a small bedroom or dorm and don't need a party boom box.

You would think calling an item Polar White that it would be bright white. well it is not.  So don't get this one if you want to match a White Room.  It is more of a Greyish Hue with even a bit of blue.... The speaker itself is amazing sound quality.. connected to my phone in 10 seconds.  as for battery life, I will post another comment back after about a week or two to confirm how the battery is.  But I wanted to get a review up for the color name.

I just received my speaker. I have it connected to my phone with a great signal but the music keeps stopping and starting for a few seconds. I am not sure why it's doing that. If I can't find the solution I am going to send it back. Can anyone help me figure out what's wrong?

Great sound quality and good volume from a small speaker. First time turning it on, it wasn’t very loud at all and I thought I would wind up returning it. After charging all night, I tried again and the max volume was way higher. Battery life is shorter than listed, but takes a charge pretty quickly. Haven’t pushed testing the water resistance, but works well in the bathroom during showers and no concerns touching it with wet hands. Easily pairs with everything and I love that it automatically pairs with my iPhone when I turn the speaker on. More expensive than other small, waterproof speakers I’ve tried but much better quality. Worth the money

I believe that the instructions could be a little better if there was more information,  i.e., my speaker was beeping for no apparent reason that I could find in the user instructions. I then unplugged it from the wall charger into a different wall charger and it stopped beeping and charged.  The company might resolve this issue by sending a wall charger with the product.
The “Polar White” is actually dull grey. Cannot believe this does not come with a wall charger. Between that and the very recent terrible reviews, this just isn’t worth the money.  Returned.

I ordered despite reading a few problem reviews thinking it's normal but wish I hadn't. It worked fine for 2 weeks then suddenly gave constant buzz!  Totally unresponsive. Found a forum where others had this problem so found out how to stop it but now sound is horrible. Returning for refund.

The speaker sounded great, paired easily, full sound. Though it is annoying to hear it say every letter of every device paired with it, spells out "S-a-m-s-u-n-g-7-5-2-1-etc." and if computer is still paired it will mention that too. No biggie if it works. But one morning it suddenly lost all charge, would not recharge or respond to on/off anything. I wonder if it is because they do not provide a charger and depend on you to provide your own, which may or may not be fully compatible. I went ahead and ordered the fancier soundlink II that comes with charging cradle. I also made sure to get a 4 year protection plan. I don't expect the lithium ion battery to last forever. The packaging it came in offered scant protection, which may have killed it.

Sound quality is excellent and it’s easy to use. Unlike the earlier model, this version automatically powers on any time a previously paired device powers on nearby. It’s extremely annoying, especially because the speaker talks to you to tell you what it’s connecting to. Also the battery will run itself out if you were not aware that it automatically turned itself on and paired.

I like this product in and of itself, but the fact that it just went dead on me after two months is a real bummer. I went through all troubleshooting suggestions online, none of them worked. Now I'm left with the choice of just moving on or wasting time with Bose support/customer service.

The sound is incredible!  I had wireless speakers before and this one blows them away. Indoors it make great cleaning music, outside the whole neighborhood gets to listen. Super simple 15 second start up.  The Bose connect app has radio stations, police stations, podcasts and more.  Something called Tune-in, and of course you can connect your Apple Music or Amazon music.  Love it, wish I had snagged 2 on the lightning deal.

Okay, product. Found the sound was too low for my liking. I live in an apartment if I have the speaker in the living room I expect to hear it in the bedroom. I found another product that did just that. All the other features were good. Good battery.  For some reason, the device would not completely power off, it seems that it just goes on sleep mode.  Every time it was in range with a Bluetooth device it would turn on. Devices that did not go through pairing would just ring through the speaker?!? Weird.

I have to Bose speakers purchased at the store and they are FANTASTIC! The sound is absolutely amazing! There is no way this is an authentic product! The sound is muffled and low! HORRIBLE product and I am very annoyed that I have to go to the inconvenient process of returning this product.  Waste of my time and energy!

Horrible, don’t waste your time or money. After the 1st use I was disappointed. The battery life is horrible only lasting less than an hour and it’s constantly  asking for updates. I will be returning this items.

VERY simple to set up and operate.  It has great sound quality and the battery has lasted me all day.  I sit it on a shelf and the output can be heard all through the house.  I like it SO much, I'm going to buy 3 more: 1 more for indoors, and a set for outdoors.  The connectivity finds whichever device I'm using and connects quick, even announces "Connected to <device name>" so you know which one is being used

We have bought BOSE products for years.  After the warranty was barely over it died and would not recharge.  We tried all the "fixes" on-line.  We then called customer service.  Their answer was they would ship us a new one for $75.00.  No reason for why it broke- we have used it infrequently and it is in perfect condition.  That is what i call "care less about good customer" service.

Bought two of these at Christmastime. They have good sound, but one of the died and had to get a replacement at Bose. The customer service was good but I am disappointed because I have read this has happened to several customers who purchased this prouct. It's a risky purchase.

I know Bose has a reputation for great sound, so when this jewel went on sale for Prime Day, I bought it. It came the next day and the sound is incredible! It nearly paired itself; all I had to do was hit the power button and confirm English as my language, then choose it from my list of blue tooth devices on my phone. The sound quality is great and I am so thrilled that I bought 3 more for gifts.

I had another identical speaker that I bought directly from Bose, and while the sound quality and battery life, etc are all the same, I only give this one 4 stars because the feel of the buttons is of lesser quality. It was a prime day exclusive, so maybe they just produced a slightly cheaper version, but so far it hasn’t been an issue.One really cool benefit is that, through the Bose app, you can link 2 speakers together to make a mini portable surround sound system. Since these small speakers have great volume, low bass and crisp mids for their size, it makes for a pretty awesome to-go experience.

We've used this product off an on for seven months. It's been gently used, never dropped, etc. It not longer charges at all. We did a lot of research before buying this product, and committed because we like Bose speakers typically. This was definitely not worth the price.

This speaker is small but loud and crystal clear.  Very amazed at how clear the sound is and how the sound travels and fills the entire room.  Some speakers no matter how loud they get you can’t understand what’s being said.  This speaker will get loud and stay clear.  You’d think you have a surround sound system the way this little Bluetooth speaker projects the sound!

I first heard the sound from a Bose SoundLink Bluetooth Speaker on a family member's device. I wanted the speaker for my kitchen, so I could enjoy music while cooking but hesitated to buy it because I'm not a techie and thought it would be complicated to set it up. Not true! I followed the written instructions and within minutes was connected to my iPhone. Minutes later I was enjoying my favorite music. The speaker sits on a shelf in the kitchen. I'm impressed with the this small speaker's quality, rich sound.

I was expecting more of a punch from this after reading the reviews. I’m pretty disappointed. I use this when I’m working out and it’s not loud enough at all. I have cheaper Bluetooth speakers that are basically no name brands that are louder and have better bass than this. I’m open to suggestions as to what to get next. 🤷‍♀️ I may go with what everyone has said and get a JBL.

A family member brought this speaker camping and my father fell in love with it. He owns 2 other Bose products and HAD to have this. I ordered while camping and had it waiting at home when he got there. Every time I see him he has to turn it on and show it off to everyone. Disclaimer: My father is over 65 years old and he has learned how to pair it, charge, and use this speaker. That shows me that this is very user friendly!

I have two Bluetooth Bose And the bass is so distracting, you can’t hear anything else, I’ve tried moving it away from the wall etc., outdoors it’s not so bad but inside it’s terrible, very disappointed, can’t find a fix on their website either, and there’s no way to control bass with your phone Or Pandora or Amazon music or Apple Music apparently you can with Spotify

This little speaker does just the job for my open, echoing downstairs space. I wanted something small and unobtrusive, but with power enough to fill the downstairs with sound when required. We have hardwood flooring and an open space, so this speaker does a great job. I first tested it out at an Apple store. (You know how big those places are) We were all the way in the store and at least 1/2 the store could hear the song I was playing. (At least I'm assuming so since they were turning around.

This is a great speaker with amazing sound quality, however after a year or two the built in battery starts to lose strength and there is no way to swap it out for a new one. This is a huge problem given the price of this product!

Overall, great little speaker with great Bose sound quality. We bought ours on sale. The only problem I have with it is that sometimes the power button does not work. It won't turn on even though the battery may be fully charged. If I plug it in to the wall, then it will turn on. It only does this occasionally. Not a huge deal, but if I'd paid more for it I would probably have returned it or requested a new device. Anyway, over all a good little speaker.

Father's Day gift and he loves it. So much better than what he had. We all look for it when the need arises. Sounds is fantastic and its so easy to use. One thing we learned is that if another phone in range is already connected, they have to disconnect their bluetooth in order for your phone to connect. Rookie learning curve but it was easy.
Got the plain white one so I can personalize it with decorative tape. Have this in the office to play music and make the boring days go by quicker :)

Just like with Apple products, you are paying above the actual value of the item.  Everything works very well and smoothly, and puts out quite a bit of sound for its size!  Loses Bass power around 75-80% volume.  About 85-90% total product value, even when discounted to $100.

I am a die hard BOSE customer.  I have been brand loyal to them since college over 35 years now.  Home speakers three different times, surround sound in two homes, and the Bose external speakers I use for my DJ Business.

I love this little speaker. It sounds great and is easy for me to carry around (upstairs, outside, in my purse!) I left my first one in a hotel room so I bought another one. And thanks to the manager at the Hampton Inn in Kernersville, NC, I now have two of these pretty little blue speakers! Now, I can move around my house with my phone and the speakers find me! These are SO FUN! I can dance everywhere now. Laissez les bon temps rouler!

I like that is a mic for voice prompts. I can even use my "okay Google" with it.Sound quality is great for a small speaker. I haven't really tested how long the battery lasts but i've plugged in twice since i got it 24 hours ago. The voice prompt tells you how much battery left once you turn it on. I am planning to bring it to trips and to the beach. I don't know the sound and volume quality yet when outdoors. Also, I downloaded Bose Connect, which gives you visual specs and control of the speaker. Overall, I think this is great.

I think I am pretty smart but the directions were not helpful,not easy to follow and having not used a Bluetooth speaker for phone connections before, I was very discouraged before I finally managed it.  The speaker is working great but setting it up was an exercise in frustration.  It's a good thing but not getting 5 stars due to setup problems.

What a complement to my Bose WaveLength Radio!  With 3.5mm aux cords, I have the best hi-fidelity sound for just a fraction of cost that a full out sound theatre would cost.  I cannot believe it!  The BlueTooth connectivity is fine, though when it 'talks' to me it mispronounces my "Arathorn" handle, but the sound is magnificent both around the house, while I am in carpentry/plumbing/painting mode, or while watching a movie.

I might give this 5 starts, but it lost a star because I can't see the controls and they aren't readily obvious what each control does.  If I have to pull out the blasted manual, get a flashlight and put on reading glasses to use the controls, then it won't get 5 stars from me, even if it has awesome sound and does exactly what I wanted it to do.

I purchased one of these speakers for myself and was so pleased with the sound that I ordered three more for family members in different colors for Christmas.  It is very portable and easy to set up.  There are hundreds of albums and single songs available on Amazon and iTunes.  I especially enjoy moving it from room to room on cleaning day.  It's a wonderful distraction for a boring job!  It is also nice for background music when entertaining.
My son has a JBL Flip 4 and it sounds a LOT better than this speaker and has a much better bass response.  It's also way cheaper.  Thinking of returning it.  Very disappointed Bose.

We favor Bose products here because of the consistent sound quality. This Bluetooth speaker does not disappoint, the Bluetooth pairing is quick and consistent, sound quality is very good for a small speaker, and battery life more than decent. There are definitely cheaper portable speakers to be had, but life is too short to listen to bad speakers. The Bose engineering under the hood is what makes this speaker special, and a cheaper speaker may look just as good, but pay attention to the sound and you'll see why we keep buying Bose.

I went straight to this product because I have always been super satisfied with Bose products in the past.  I have the Soundlink III and the sound is wonderful.  I was looking get one for my wife.  As for a genuine Bose product, I was disappointed with the new generation Soundlink speaker. The overall sound quality was weak and tinny.  I was surprised as the name "Bose" usually stands for quality.

This is the first speaker I've purchased where there are NO bluetooth connection issues. It pairs as soon as I turn it on. Easy on and off button. Looks nice and feels durable. The sound is awesome! I can listen while in the shower without damaging it. My boyfriend has the same speaker and highly recommended. I'm so happy I made the purchase!! Worth the money!

I was leaning to heavily on the BOSE name, assuming it too, would blow-your-sox-off sound-wise, but can only give it a C+ at best, but more emphasis on it being totally portable, requiring no 110 cord power source, or several replaceable batteries! Liking the internal "rechargeable " battery feature, plus it will broadcast ANY music website on your cellphone,  plus of course,  you control it remotely...from your phone being Bluetooth enabled! Weather resistant too, but not...waterproof, and a bang/scratch resistant surface too, available in different colors! Enjoy!

Do I really need this? Do I really want to drop this much money in one product? These are the exact questions I asked myself, and I’m so glad I ordered this product! This speaker has survived water, drops, and anything else you can think of. One of the reasons I ordered this is because it claims it is water resistant and durable, and it’s true! The quality of sound it produces is also wonderful! There is no crackling or anything! I can also use the app to control the phones that it is unsung! I love this speaker and it’s my go to for cleaning around the house, swimming, or leaving it in the shower!
Used this speaker to produce "white noise" for sleeping.Use your smartphone or other computer to load up fan/white noise from youtube, and connect to bose using 3.5mm audio cable (not Bluetooth ).

I’ve had this speaker for a few weeks and I am disappointed. I expected better sound quality and volume frankly from Bose. I guess you have to pay a lot more for higher sound quality because of the brand name. Anyhoo, my kids both have UE speakers they are lower in price and higher in sound quality and the app to control the device is superior to Bose. The Bose app due end detect my speaker via Bluetooth. Meanwhile my kids have a make shift dance club upstairs with the UE Boom. I will be purchasing UE speakers for Christmas this year the Bose Color II Soundlink just doesn’t blow my mind in the low price point portable speaker category..

The sound fidelity is excellent, and the little speaker can really put out some good volume too.  Bass sounds are also really good.  Battery power - have yet to have an issue after starting with full charge - it will go all day.  I then recharge it (overnight).  The setup is easy (directions included) - however if more than one person has this device on their Bluetooth list, it'll be a guessing game as different devices fight over connecting to it.  My proposal is to chuck the offender's phone as hard as I can into the next county.  Problem's fixed!  +1 Me, -1 friend.

Sound WAS great.  Battery life WAS great.  Bluetooth connectivity WAS great.  Up until a few days ago when the battery died and it will no longer take a charge.  I tried everything, submitted a warranty claim but was denied.  However they did offer a replacement discount, send them $75 and my old one.  I really thought BOSE was better quality than that.  What good is great sound if you have to replace it every year?

This is the second Bose speaker of this model that I have bought. I already had one for myself. Every time my son-in-law came over he would ask if he could hook up to it. He loved it so much I bought it for him for Christmas this year. He was so excited that I bought this for him because he loves it! I have never had an issue with the battery life. I haven’t had any issues at all with this. The first one I have had for over two years without issue. I recommend it. Actually… I’m thinking of getting myself  another one so I can have dual speakers here at my house.

I bought this speaker for my son last Christmas this speaker does have bows quality sound my son is on the swimming team they use this next to the pool with no water issues I’ve had 2 other bows older model and I’ve had power adapter issues where you plug the power cord in the back of the  the speaker loses power connection brakes  but on this model I  have not had this issue so far and it’s been a year.  You can depend on Bose customer service they give you an option of a trade-in ora fix with an upgrade.  I took the option of half the price  upgrade instead of fixing old unit.

I have been a big fan of Bose products and owned QC25, QC35, NC700 and SoundSports for headphones and 301, 201 for Home Theater Systems and Soundbars for TV.  I just needed an outdoor water resistant powered speaker(s) and thought this would fulfill my needs without spending too much again.  I am not comparing sound quality to other expensive Bose speakers but this one can not beat my Google home pair or Insignia NS-CSPGASP2 pair sound quality.Bose made things complicated by keeping 2 APP platforms (BOSE Connect and BOSE Music).  New devices connect to BOSE Music and Old devices connect to BOSE Connect and there is no cross platform.

I really like this speaker. I'd give it five stars if the battery lasted longer. It will tell you when it's full and it will tell you when it's medium and then it will shut off. I would say about six hours depending on the volume. I contacted Bose and they said that is normal and it doesn't say low or recharge, knowing that it makes it okay for me. It is a small complaint for a speaker with great sound. You can also use it while its charging, that's nice. I would recommend this product, great for traveling. I'm sure as the technology arrives they will improve the battery life. I have several Bose products and have always enjoyed all of them.

Quality, sound, design all what you expect from Bose - superb! Highly recommend - we were blown away by the rich sound from this modestly priced speaker. I bought 2 and am glad I did! NOTE! The speaker comes with a micro USB to USB cable for charging. I “assume” it will charge by plugging into a USB wall module, I purchased the offered charging cables (extra).

Had for less than a year. Right out the gate, charging this device was never consistent. A work colleague had the same device, and same problem. It is plugged in, makes a noise that recognizes it’s plugged in, but then never charges.  Lord knows why sometimes it does and sometimes it doesn’t.FURTHERMORE for the same price, you can get other speakers that sound just as good and don’t have the BS issue.

This little speaker is great... Love that it's Bluetooth, you can use AUX as well. Fairly loud- I work in a machine shop, so I needed something really loud, this barely keeps up ( I can't stray to far away from it). I really just wish it retained charge longer. Gets really irritating when I'm in a certain rhythm at work ( the music helps) and the speaker dies. I usually just leave it attached to the charger. Oh well... I'm getting my money's​ worth from it otherwise.

I've had this for about a month and loved it. I've linked it to my Alexa and i use it in the bathroom while i get ready in the morning and i also use it by my pool. The sound is great and i love how it portable it is. Suddenly, this morning it completely died on me. I figured the battery was low so i went to plug it in to recharge......and nothing. I went onto the Bose website and found a forum that gave me instructions on how to re-boot the system processor. I did it and it seems to be charging o.k. now. It seems to be a common problem with this speaker with the complaints i saw after googling the issue. Typically, you don't see a quality product with these issues. I'm a little disappointed, but hopefully this will be a one time thing.
Bose sound never disappoints, the battery life could be better
Great product but the sound is not as good as my old JBL. The base is missing. I was shocked I thought I’d be getting more with a Bose following their reputation. I won’t buy it again.

I love the sound on the speaker. The settings can be a bit tricky. I like that I have my TV, Cell Phone, and laptop all setup and can switch quickly with a double click of a button. However - sometimes the speaker gets hung up and I have to reset it. Last week I could not turn my volume up or down. I had to research and figure out that I had to turn things on and off in sequence to get the sound to work again.

Can’t believe how good this speaker sounds in a living room with high acoustics!  You just can’t go wrong with Bose!! Love the quality!  Oh, and when it was delivered, it was left outside my door in pouring torrential rains!!  Not only was the packaging excellently done, but the speaker passed the waterproof test in flying colors!  That was a great test to show the quality of workmanship.

Amazing sound from such a small unit. Always seems to sound better when I put it against something. The only thing that's disconcerting is that it announces whose phone/device it is joining with and its very annoying. It will also swap while its in the middle of playing music if someone else comes in who has a device it already 'knows'. That surprised me for a Bose speaker...

These small speakers pack a powerful punch. I use them for camping, home cleaning music and parties. I did encounter an issue before when it would not turn on. I learned via online research that you cannot let the speaker's battery die because it causes issues with restarting it. I had to restart the speaker over 20 times before I was able to revive it. Now I always turn the speaker off after use and make sure there is always some battery charge.

Arrived the same day of purchase. Instead of the following day. Which was SUPER AWESOME! So far its blown my mind away. The only speaker it cant beat.
