I had previous generations of the Bose portable Bluetooth speaker and they sounded great. Very disappointed in this one. Sounds like a small transistor radio. Sound is comparable to a speaker you’d pay $30 for. Cool that it’s water resistant though.
Not only is the Bose easy to use and set up, the quality of sound is outstanding. What one expects of Bose, but in a small package!?  We use it for meetings, trips, or just pure enjoyment of music.

Why didn't we buy this sooner!?  We use this speaker while outside doing yard work. The phone stays inside close to WiFi.  The color is slightly light blue, not beige or perfect white.  Easy to pair, super happy with our purchase!
Love this little speaker! Durable and sounds nice. My favorite in that ~100 dollar price range.
Great sound and base.  I bought the blue one it’s soft to the touch (medium sized) looks nice!  My dentist has one and used it while working on me and I liked it so much I bought one.
Omg...oddest complaint, Bose did so well with this product that I can't even play quiet certain times of day. This lil box puts out a symphony!

Birthday gift for my husband and he loves it.  Uses it all the time.  Great quality.  Had a little operator error on set up, but once we figured it out (language with not right), it has been easy to use.  Thanks!

Sounds great awesome base knocking off point because they didn't provide a wall wart. For such an expensive product you would think they would give you a charging block. But no they got to save the extra $0.25.

When the box was delivered it only had one item in it, the paper towel holder.  My box was opened and retaped.  I expect a refund or a replacement ASAP.  I was looking forward to  enjoying my items but they were stolen.  The missing items were my speaker and my closet rods.

I purchased this on Dec. 10, 2017, and today May 15, 2018, it will not power on to charge. I already tested the charger it works with another speaker.  I'm surprised at this, I thought the Bose brand would outlast the 808 Hex speaker from Walmart that I've had for 4 years, which I'm currently using.  Very disappointed in Bose right now.

This speaker completely died in 2 months. I followed all the recommendations to restart it. Nothing worked. So disappointing for Bose to make such junk. Of course the “return date” has expired. I would have given a zero rating if available.$129 wasted.....
Now that I increased my internet d-load speed and a new eero wi-fi system for streaming, works fine.
Don't buy this speaker. After less than 2 months, it won't charge anymore.  While it worked it was outstanding, excellent sound.
A must have if you listen to music. It’s so portable and charge lasts a very long time.  I love this speaker
Sound is good only problem is battery don't last too long possibly 6 to 8 hrs
The sound quality, in particular the base, is not as good as my Bose Mini II Bluetooth speaker.  But it is louder when at max vol.
Love this Bose Bluetooth speaker.  Great sound. Portable and good battery life.
This is a quality product which produces quality sound. I like the fact that it is water resistant and built tough. Perfect for traveling and taking it on the go.
I love the quality of sound, and how loud it can play! I use it in music therapy sessions, and it is easily heard by large groups (around 20 people). This is worth the investment.
Loved how loud it goes, definitely thought it wouldn’t be as clear sound as it was but proved me wrong.
BS. Doesn’t connect in party mode to Soundlink I or II (far superior speakers), though it doesn’t say this anywhere (except once you try).

The sound is great, and the battery life between recharging is really good. However, one speaker pairs with my  PC when I power it up but the second speaker must be paired with the first and converted from party mode to stereo mode every time. Why can't this be automatic as well? For sound quality it's great.
Great quality sound, reasonable price.  Bose sound quality is the best!
I ordered this for our master bed/bathroom. It’s the perfect size for the space and the audio and volume quality are great.
Great sound packed into this little sucker. I also pair it with the smaller Bose speaker and use it outside.Bluetooth works like a charm. Use it with Spotify without issues.  Great buy.
Can’t read the control items on top to operate the speaker. Due to dar color blue of speaker and controls
It's ok, but honestly not noticably better than my $30 Oontz Bluetooth speaker. Sound quality is not remarkable, just average. Would not recommend this speaker.
goods and bads -Good - Bose quality sound (those that have never enjoyed Bose quality...well, you need to)
Purchased this knowing it was a return but did not expect screws drilled into the bottom of it!  Still worked fine, but would have returned if I had the time.
Owned for five weeks and it just stopped working!I’m not sure how amazon will help as I’ve read the other stopped working reviews...

When you turn the device on, it tells you when it is on, how charged the battery is, and all of the devices it is connected to, which is super annoying.  It does NOT however tell you when the battery is running low and it just dies without notice.  It constantly drops devices and can be challenging to pair.  The sound is good but I wouldn't purchase again, especially at the price point....so I give it a solid, MEH.

When the speaker works it is great. However, after the battery fully discharged and I tried charging it again to use it, it is now just a paper weight. I cannot get it working again.I even plugged it into my computer and updated the software. It still will not charge or seem to hold a charge. I tried all of the troubleshooting tips on their site to no avail. Don’t waste your money.
It had good connectivity until it stopped connecting. Had just short of 4 years.
Good sound. Bluetooth works well even far away from phone. I got the yellow and I love the color.

The sound from this guy is unreal! I can’t believe I waited so long to get one. I’ve tried cheaper ones, but I really think Bose is the best of the best in terms of sound quality at a reasonable price.
The charging cord does not last.  And it needs recharged after 3 hours. Good sound though

It sounds great and the battery lasts a good amount of hours. However, it lasted one year exactly. There's no warranty. They suggested buying a replacement on their website for a discounted price ($79). I never used it in pools or beaches, always at home, and still broke :-/
Had to send back. It didn't work.

This is a great Speaker. The sound is terrific and it is small so it can be tucked into a small space. Living in a small apartment this is a valuable asset. I would highly recommend it. Like all Bose products the quality is top notch.
I returned it. Sound was muffled, like it was coming from under blankets!

This little speaker is one of the best purchases I’ve made in a long time. If you crave that clear Bose sound this is the speaker for you. I love that I can bring it anywhere. It’s the perfect little speaker. Plus it looks really cool!
Great item. Easy to hook up and produces great quality sound. Second one I purchased.
Great sound. Small to pack for traveling. Easy to connect. Got it at a decent price. I love Bose products.

Sound quality was atrocious, particularly in the lower register.  Speakers crackled when bass played, even after multiple attempts at adjusting the EQ.  Based on other reviews in several online message boards, my experience was not unique.  This is not consistent with the quality I am accustomed to with Bose.  Surprising.

I have had Bose products in the past and trust them a lot but this product stopped working after only 6 months. It stopped working mid-song and would not power up nor charge. Being out of warranty, I was only offered a replacement (Via service request directly with Bose) at a discount (75.00). And also too late to return via Amazon seller. Not happy!

The speaker Stopped taking a charge about a year after I bought it. I reached out to #Bose but my warranty had just expired and they would only offer to sell me a new one. If you’re buying  #Bose brand because you think you’re getting quality and you’ll get good service you should skip it and buy something less expensive.
Not as load as I would expect from Bose.

Love the speaker! it is small, lightweight, and the sound is clear and loud enough to fill the room. I listen to various genres of music and the sounds have been fliud. The base is pretty decent for such a small speaker but it can sound a little regressed.ONE PROBLEM: After a few days of using this device it did not turn on! It was literally full battery. I found out that it had to be reset or something. Just like what M. Ossa said, you just had to do the following to turn it back on by resetting it:
Easy to use great sound hooked up to Wi-Fi easily
Love this speaker.  Great sound and its not a big bulky speaker.  Easy to move from room to room.  I just need to order a few more.  I will definitely buy this product again!
As expected this is a great speaker from Bose. Sounds great and easily portable.

I already own a UE boom.... But couldn't help trying the bose.....the UE boom has more volume and longer battery life.... the Bose does have a little more base to it..... But all in all I expected a little more because it's a Bose......
Son loves this!  I bought 1st generation, got this for my son -- product improvements are effective and welcomed by the younger generation.  A great product, would buy again!
I now know why Bose is the way to go! Money well spent (and I don’t like to spend money lol!) So happy with this purchase!
It stands up to the Bose name and sounds great. I am very happy.
Incredible sound quality for water proof speaker and compact size of speaker. So easy to use.
Fantastic buy! I was hesitant at first, but I am so glad that I purchased this. I'm using more than I expected to. The sound quality is great. Battery lasts for a long time.
I'm amazed at how good something this small can sound.  I would buy this again, love it.

Worked great for a year and then the battery stopped taking a charge. Followed Bose instructions on how to reset it and then it never powered up again. Just barely out of the warrenty period so it’s $75 to replace it. Apparently this is a known problem for this speaker for some years now. Bose used to stand behind their products.
Best quality, easy connectivity to my computer as well as my phone.
Love my nose outdoor speaker ,would purchase again. FILLS MY PATIO WITH WONDERFUL MUSIC!!!
Simply the best! I have two and I pair them in stereo for backyard music bliss. These speakers are awesome. Highly recommended by me!
This is a great little speaker! Love the Bose sound!
A great Bluetooth speaker that sounds great and very portable. This is the second one we've bought. Love the Bose sound quality.

I love this speaker. I have had it for three months, and I am thinking about buying a second one. The sound fills any room in my house, and its quality is as high as I have come to expect of Bose. It was easy to link the speaker to my iPhone and iPad, and the connection works very well. I like that I can charge the battery and then move it anywhere in the house. I can also easily pack it in a suitcase or duffel bag and take it with me on trips. And I like how it feels soft to the touch.
Great sound and base. I use mine every time I go in the jacuzzi. Connects to Bluetooth instantly
Its a good speaker, not great.  It is not very loud.  I was just expecting much more from Bose speaker I have bought other speakers at  1/2 or ever 1/3 the price that work just as well.
Wonderful speaker. It’s the best!! I love it!! ❤️❤️❤️

Great sound and I am satisfied with the product. For the price it has great sound for such a small speaker. I have had other cheap Bluetooth speakers so I thought I'd try the Bose and it works fine. Not concert hall sound but it is what it is a small Bluetooth personal speaker forlistening to music from your phone, iPad etc.
I love this speaker! It sounds great, but I was expecting the battery life to be a little longer. I recommend buying a case for traveling!

The USB connection within the speaker was fidgety from the time we got it. Soon after it wouldn't charge at all. We probably got a faulty product and should have gotten a refund when we had the chance but it could be a common issue.
My SoundLink one sounded way better than this one. But it seems as though you can't find those anymore.
Works very well, but when I Bluetooth, it makes me use phone for volume not the item itself, I have to reset to use volume control on unit vice my phone.  Otherwise a fine product.

Good Sound for the Size, works well with Alexa.Sound is a touch muddy like many Bose Products.  I still like it.  We got it for our bathroom, and it fits the space nicely.  It is a good balance between sound, size, cost.
I'm very happy with my Bose Speaker. Clear and full sound with no distortion when music turned up.

The system will not take a charge not matter what i do.  I goggled and apparently this is quite the issue with this product. I have had it 1 year, and now I am on hold with CS at Bose and have been waiting 45 minutes.I tried trouble shooting as the internet response said and nothing...I am so disappointed
This speaker has an amazing sound quality for its small size. I like to use it when I’m playing golf.
I got it on special during prime day- there are cheaper blue tooth speakers out there that sound the same....just glad I didn’t pay full price!
Best Bluetooth speaker ever. I use this with Pandora on my phone while working around the house. It's like having a nice stereo system in a compact speaker. Incredible sound. Highly recommended.
Small, weather resistant, and great on the boat or deck.
It's a BOSE, that says it all. Top of the line and excellent sound quality. I have nothing negative to say!
the only think sub par is it could be louder but it has excellent base and sound just not great volume

I love my Bose speaker and this is  my second one.  The first one is the black color and the kids kept taking it to the Lake so I ordered another one but the Aquatic Blue one and now they take that one and leave the black one at the house.  The sound is amazing and easy to use.  Never have had any problems and I have has the black one for two years.  I will be getting on for my brother now for his summer bbq days......
This is the third one I've purchased for family members. Very good piece of equipment. Robust, very good sound quality....delivers on time.
I bought this for my daughter in law and she loves it.  She said that it is the best sounding speaker she has ever had.

I have one of these speakers on a covered porch and have it Bluetooth connected to an echo dot. The sound is amazing, and easily fills the space (17’x12’) at low volume. It is robust yet crystal clear at higher volumes also, to a point where i can use it for yard entertaining. It’s only about 6” high, 7 or 8” wide and a few inches deep. The finish is a matte silicone so it looks/feels really great too.
Very nice speaker. It sounds awesome and it’s waterproof
Sounds great. Am going to purchase another for pairing
AND paid more for it than the other colors but totally worth it!

It sounds awesome.. for three days until it stops functioning altogether. For something at this price point, their quality control should be more on point. And to add insult to injury, they don't even include a charging block. Cheap move Bose.
Excellent sound. Sturdy and attractive but batter life is not up to the competition. I knew this when ordering. Just sayin’

I've always loved Bose products.  Sound is incredible. It's compact and lasts longer than expected.  I use it to listen to my Pandora music. I do not regret buying this speaker at all! Great value for the price!
Good speaker with good sound. The battery didn't last too long as advertised. I'm lucky to get 3 hours.
Typical Bose product.  Great quality, amazing sound and durable.  I got it for my sons dorm room and it’s the perfect size and he loves it!  Highly recommend.
Always been a Bose user .only disappointment was the volume level, on this product was very low Even when it was set to high. which made this product to be rarely used, would not purchase again

Sounds great. Distorts some on max volume. Would have never expected that from Bose. UE Boom speakers get much louder without distortion. This is good for carrying around house for use. I grab my UE Booms when outdoors and need more volume.
I have one at home and one at my massage office. The sound quality on the US is amazing.
love it except the volume button on the device doesn't work!  returning and buying another .
Works great, battery could be better. But great value and sound

Great sound, compact,etc..  Love the color.  I bought a case for it as well so the charger and unit can be stored in the same case.  The only thing I was disappointed with is that the charge cable does not come with a plug-in wall adapter which would have been nice.
Work for a couple of months now it won’t charge. Very disappointed in the Bose
This little speaker has pretty good sound quality. It was so easy to pair with the stereo! Great bargain for the $$
This is the 2nd time I’m purchasing this speaker. It is very durable and the sound quality is amazing. Battery will last up to 6 hrs.
I love this. Great sound. Love that I can turn on/off through ap.
It was challenging getting it to work at all.  The sound is great which is why I gave it a 2 instead of a 1.  In less than 30 days, it quit working.
Typical high quality sound from Bose.  It looks like it can handle some abuse compared to my other sound link.

I purchased the Bose speaker a couple of months ago. I have really enjoyed the quality and sound.  No problems with it. Works great. I may have to order another one my husband has pretty much taken it away from me.
great sound from a tiny Bluetooth speaker. small enough to be easily portable. links very quickly with no issues across multiple different phones we have owned.

I have 2 devices but can’t seem to figure out how to change the name to tell the difference between them in my Bluetooth options. So, sometimes it doesn’t always immediately connect or it takes a few minutes to figure it out. Otherwise, it is FANTASTIC. Great sound. Easy to set up. Fun to stick in my backpack and take anywhere.
This is my go to speaker while I am working out, pairs up with phone well and is favorite color.

Bought this after a friend showed me his Bose SoundLink. Use it when swimming in the pool, playing board games and for background music when entertaining. Overall feel the speaker has fantastic sound for its small size.
I bought this bc I had a friend who had one. The thing wouldn’t charge-this is the downside. The upside, use another usb charger and it works great!!! Sound quality is awesome! Easy to pair!

Bought this to couple with my Echo Dot. Love the results. As suggested by Bose, I keep it tucked in a corner of the counter and against the wall for best bass results. I don't know how the sound would be in a big room but for my kitchen (and sometimes, bedroom), it works just fine. I have a JBL Charge in the bathroom and though that sound is okay, it does not compare to the Bose Soundlink.
Great sound, easy to pair for party mode
this speaker has outstanding sound. i love it. just like all the bose products that i have purchased in the past.you will not find a better speaker than this.
Speakers have definitely made my social distancing experience enjoyable.

I bought a Soundlink Color I several years ago. No problems, no soft covering.  The Soundlink !!  has great sound and is easy to connect to your bluetooth device. A minor problem is when connecting, the speaker looks for a mobile device when there is none and never has been  A major problem is controlling the volume.  It is almost impossible to accurately raise or lower the volume.  It was unclear from the manual whether to press the control repeatedly to adjust the volume or to press and hold the control until the desired volume is reached.  Since I was having difficulty,  I called Bose.  They said to press repeatedly.  This did not always work so the volume is frequently too loud or not loud enough.  The control is covered by the soft, waterproof material and there is little positive feedback when adjusting the volume.,

Weighing in at just over a pound this speaker is incredibly light and easy to carry around. The colour is very bright, with plastic moulding also makes it splash and rain proof, perfect for the British weather! The Sound: Extremely easy to connect to your tablet or smart phone, using the Bose connect app. It will also store the last 8 devices for auto connection when using again. Simple! It also has a great feature which links to Siri, if you apple products, enabling you to utilise all the offerings such as voice commands. For such a small speaker if defiantly packs a punch, I’ve found for the best sound outputs its best placed about 50CM from a wall. We had a few people (10) over for a BBQ, we had the speaker at full capacity, with no distortion, and it was plenty loud enough. We had to turn it down some so we could hear our friends talking. You also have the option to link this speaker to another of the same kind to make a stereo pair. I’ve just ordered another one. On full charge our battery lasted just over 7.5 hours. I’d defiantly recommend this speaker, excellent build and sound quality. Exceptional value for money.

This speaker seems to have some glitchiness that the SoundLink I does not have. Some simple troubleshooting instructions should come with the product. For instance, I had the same issue as a lot of others - that once it was unplugged, even though charged, it did not want to turn on. I discovered that it matters where you plug it in - charging on a computer through the USB cable provided seems to be a problem - doesn't want to turn on once unplugged. I found a wall outlet adapter and charged it there and it works fine once unplugged. The instructions do say to plug it into an AC Power source - I assumed since the computer was plugged into the wall that plugging the speaker into the computer was the same, but apparently not. Also, for some strange reason it does not like my husband's phone - I got it paired, but it would not play his Pandora; then it re-paired with my phone but wouldn't play music (only allow calls). I fixed it by deleting the speaker from my husband's Bluetooth list (he has his own speaker anyway), and restarted my phone - it paired fine and played my Pandora. I also recently took a phone call, but turned off the Bluetooth because I wanted a private conversation, when I turned Bluetooth back on, it didn't want to automatically pair - I had to have my phone search for the speaker, and then when it did pair, it connected only for calls, it didn't want to play music. So, another phone reboot and it paired and played correctly after that. But that's a lot of glitchiness that doesn't happen at all with my husband's Bose SoundLink I speaker - I wanted one of those, but only used ones were for sale, so I got this one and have to say that it's not an improvement. Soundwise - fantastic!! I love the Bose speakers. I also like that it's water-resistant - I can take it to the pool and not worry about an occasional light splash or touch with wet hands.

I like it. The pre-set EQ seem about right. Perfect for a room, patio, and shower. Very decent bass response given it's size. Placement can greatly affect the fullness of sound.  ex. on my wood dresser that's in a small alcove or my wood core bathroom vanity near the corner. The only complaint is the battery charge  monitor. You get a long time when "high" then "medium" doesn't last nearly as long. Overall battery charge is good but I think it's just the monitor that is telling you it's high for longer than it really is.

I am pleased with the Bose Soundlink. I only wish the volume went up a little more. Last night we were in the hot tub dropped it about 7 ft from my to deck to the gravel on the ground below. Not a scratch and still working fine!

If you expect that because this is made (or at least designed) by Bose, it will by some miracle of physics deliver room-filling sound, with deep, rich bass. Think again. For a hundred and thirty bucks you get a decent-sounding product that provides a wide sound stage. But no deep bass (if that’s what you’re after), no AC adapter, and 8-hour battery life.After exposing this speaker to everything from Skrillex to Dave Grusin, several well-produced classical pieces, spoken word, and several other sources, it appears that it’s designed for the Beat By Dre crowd (sans the bass). Very in-your face experience.

When I purchased this unit, I was happy with the product and the ease of use. I also read a review by another user who said: "don't throw away the package the unit came it, as you will need it later." The user was spot on. After two weeks of use the speaker died. The software would not allow future pairing. I called the Bose help center and they were very aware of the issue. I had to send my defective unit to them and upon receipt I will get a new unit. Two strikes against Bose. They should have sent me a new unit right away and once received it, I would have sent them the defective. I will never buy another Bose product again.

I really liked this speaker a lot. It was exactly what I was looking for: portable, bluetooth, good sound quality to price ration, until... it just stopped powering on. I was going crazy trying to figure what the funk was going on. I was googling like crazy. Bose identified the issue on their FAQ but their suggestions were lame and didn't help.I finally found a comment on an ifixit dot com forum that worked instantly: Hold the mute button (the one with 3 dots in between volume up and down) for about 15 seconds- it should turn on, but if it doesn't press the power button.

UPDATE! Contacted BOSE. They tried to get mine to work by giving me instructions. Still wouldn't turn on. (The extra warranty I paid for is not in effect until mnfr warranty expires so had to call Bose direct.) So they sent me a new charge cable but that took 2 months because they said it was on backorder. That didn't work so I had to call again and they said they'd send me a new unit. The new unit lasted 2 months and now it won't turn on or show power or anything. SO..... contacting Bose again.......I wanted a small bluetooth speaker for my mail truck. Several coworkers have Bose products and i love the sound so i found this one. I read reviews that said it suddenly stopped working but i thought, "Hey, this is Bose and i've trusted them forever!" so i bought it. Luckily i bought the extended warranty too (Just in case those reviews were right!) Turns out they were. Speaker had a full charge this morning and 5 songs later it just stopped. Won't turn on, won't charge, no light, nothing. So now i've started the replacement process......BTW, the sound is GREAT for the small size! And charge lasts about 6 hours.

The battery life is pretty good, but I would try to charge it after every use since higher volume listening like I do drains the battery quicker.  Overall, I would recommend this product to anyone looking for a portable speaker.

I never leave Amazon reviews and I order 5-10 times a month but I felt really inclined to leave this review. First of, I love prime and two day shipping, I've been wanting this speaker for awhile and when I finally bought it I was so anxious so two days was quick enough for me! Secondly the packaging it came in is sleek and modern. In addition to the Bose Connect app, the instructions were clear to get the system started. Thirdly, the sound is incredible!!!! I'm currently playing Michael Bublé's live album and it sounds like he's in my house. We are a Boss family with a stereo in the kitchen and three surround sound systems throughout the house so I had high standards for this speaker and man does it perform! Fills the whole house with sound! Some people complained the volume isn't as loud as they anticipated but I'm telling you I can hear music from upstairs with the door shut so maybe get hearing aids not a louder speaker.  I have yet to take it outside so who knows how it sounds out there.Overall great purchase I am amazed at the quality of the sound this little system puts out!!

I bought this to pair with an Echo Dot. I had heard other Bose products that I enjoyed and thought this would make a good speaker for the Dot. Unfortunately, that was not the case. My time with it was plagued with problems, and I finally sent it back. Here's why:Ergonomics: I purchased the black version. The buttons were extremely difficult to read unless there was light was shining directly on them. Also, putting the inlet for the power cord on the side of the device was a mistake. It looks awkward and should have been put in the back instead. And speaking of power, not including an actual charger on a device that retails for $129 is ridiculous. Luckily, I had one laying around. If I didn't, I wouldn't have been able to use the speaker after the initial charge faded without spending even more money.

If you're skeptical on getting this speaker, just go ahead and buy it. I've been wanting to get a Bose Soundlink speaker for the last few years ever since I saw one from an acquaintance. She had the older version in the color mint but I'm glad I waited until the Soundlink II came out. The speaker itself isn't heavy and looks more sleek than the last version and not as cheap. The old version is plastic, while this speaker is all that silicone material. The sound quality is worth the price. The battery life is quite amazing as well. I use it for my iPhone and my MacBook Pro as well. It is so convenient to have and enhances anything you listen to. I wish there were better colors though but you can't really go wrong with black.

I wish I could rely on this thing, but I just can't anymore.

This speaker is awesome. I opened it Christmas Day, plugged it in to charge, turned it on, chose my language, paired it to my iPhone, and started playing music immediately. Not a single problem.  Later I read through the setup instructions, but it was just everything I'd already done. I love how simple this was to use!  The sound is fabulous, and I'm in love with the way the buttons are covered so I can manually change the volume etc. even if my hands are wet (using it on kitchen counter to enjoy music while I cook). Even two rooms away I can hear the music without it blasting at top volume. My phone stays connected to the speaker two rooms away too.  I've listened to a variety of music on this speaker and Bose holds up to its stellar reputation. This would be a fantastic gift for anyone.

2nd version of the speaker I have purchased and initially it worked well for a couple weeks and now every time it connects (if it connects at all) it has horrible sound quality through bluetooth.  I have reset the speaker, dropped the connection and installed again only to have the same horrible sound come out of this speaker.  When it worked the sound was good quality but these are the same issues I had with the first version.  I used to swear by Bose speakers and have bought about 20 of their speakers over the various homes we have lived in (both in wall and mobile speakers) and the quality of the software they produce is really affecting user experience.  They have a long way to go now to catch up with other players in the market.

D0 Not buy. I used this model Bose at a friends house. It was marvelous take it anywhere! Gets a little wet no problem!!! I decided I wanted one. So I did like most people put it on my cart wish list and one day I decided to go ahead and purchase it. First day sound ok, but every so often a crackling sound with the unit (huhhh) I don't remember this when I used it at my friends house. Leave it connect to the AC power all happy watch a movie with it all is well. Day three unit doesn't respond. Completely dead. Hold power button no use. Connect to AC Power nothing. Read Manual. Absolutely nothing... All lights are dead on a brand new UNIT!!! Arrrr... I explained the problem to Amazon and they were wonderful and shipped me another one. (Sent the faulty one back). Still had hope for Bose! The new Bose Soundlink arrives and again like a kid on Christmas.Again the bloody unit goes completely dead. Press and hold power button ---> NOPE. Plug into AC outlet --> NOPE, AC USB plug ---- > NOPE.. Since I'm an engineer, I start going  from the AC plug and work my way backwards testing every component. Everything works well. Just the unit decided to die (completely non-responsive to power button) NO LIGHTS when connected to power. So I figured maybe hardware is fine and it was the silly software people who messed it up.

I have an older car that doesn't have bluetooth. I've been using a Jabra Freeway as a speaker phone, and it works well for phone calls, but no matter what I do it won't play media (podcasts, music) from my phone loud enough to hear over the road noise.  So what I've been doing is plugging an audio cable from my phone to my car's aux jack for media files and using the Freeway for the phone.  But because some brilliant designer put the auxiliary port inside the center console, unless you want to drive around with the console open you have to close the lid over your cord.  So they keep failing.  SO I was hoping the Bose would perform both functions,  Sadly, no such luck.  It connects to my phone fine and all the phone functions work -- pressing the multifunction activates voice commands or answers the phone.  However, it has the opposite problem from the Freeway.  It plays media files just fine but no matter how I set my phone the audio volume on phone calls is just too low over road noise.  Now I am using BT to send phone to the Jabra and media to the Bose,  This works but only if you remember to connect the Bose first; if you connect the Freeway first the Bose can't find the phone.EDITED 1/25/17 I ordered a replacement. It had the same issue. I was still going to keep it until this morning when it suddenly disconnected from my phone, began making a humming noise,  and will not power off. Now I am just hoping it doesn't explode in my car while I'm at work.

This model was a disappointment right out of the box as my daughter unwrapped her Christmas gift. Says Arctic White on the box-  it's NOT any shade of white. Speaker is LIGHT GRAY W/ SLIGHT TINGE OF BLUE. It looks like a manufacturing mistake in the color creation that some one thought would be passable. As if consumers wouldn't notice - are u kidding? This thing is UGLY! I seriously expect more from Bose. Especially since I have the previous model myself in Arctic White & it is the perfect shade of white.BOSE CORPORATION SHOULD BE EMBARRASSED & the individual who thought it was okay to pass off an obvious mistake SHOULD BE FIRED! It's false advertising - There a hundred shades of gray that are actually really nice looking (but u cant call them white) - this is NOT one of them. Now i have to deal with an exchange.....

Expected a lot more from Bose. Definitely *not* up to par with the SoundLink® Mini Bluetooth® speaker II which my girlfriend owns. The sound quality is not that great if you plan on using this in an open room/space. Even in my bedroom I couldn't feel the vibrating sound which some of the better bose speakers command. The bass on this one is weak/poor: can only be felt from a few feet away. However, if you are looking for an average speaker and sound quality isn't a priority, this is OK. It may not be as bad carrying it in a backpack for a hike. Highly disappointed or maybe I just expected much more: I mean it is not a $10 speaker. If possible, you may want to test this at a Walmart or any electronic franchise carrying the product to be sure you know what you are getting into.

My original Soundlink failed, after only 10 months, for a really dumb reason, i.e. the power in-socket wore out! It became so loose, it would no longer make a connection. So ordinarily I would be inclined to get something different this time, however, in this price range, the Bose probably delivers the best sound, so I thought I'd risk another try.And the Soundlink II does sound good, much like the first, but it DOES have a major problem, right off the bat! That problem is that the power transformer, i.e. the power "block" seems to be missing! In fact, I think it is no longer included whith the package (having heard something to that effect earlier)! WTF? Isn't that kind of like delivering a new car without tires ("we thought you'd like to buy your own")? Every single electronic device I ever bought included one, so Bose is the vanguard of an evil trend?

I'll be completely honest, there are certain products that I approach with a bit of trepidation. Usually, it is brands where I feel the name has outgrown the actual product. I totally admit that a part of it is unjustified bias but not surprisingly I don't own any Apple products. Beats? Yep, none of those either. Bose. Nope.So I was curious when offered the chance to test out the Bose SoundLink Color II. Could this little Bluetooth speaker possibly live up to the sky-high Bose reputation and marketing? Is a small(ish) Bluetooth speaker worth such a commanding price?

Superb! The color looks great, and the rubbery outer texture is easy to hold and satisfying to touch, not to mention splash resistant. It is very easy to pair to your computer or phone, and charges pretty quickly and lasts for many hours per charge. The sound is fantastic, with rich, deep lows and clear, sparkling highs, and for what it is (a consumer home speaker) it is quite loud, louder than I could ever use in my little apartment. I highly recommend this wonderful product.

I bought it for a Christmas present and it wouldn't even charge once. Very disappointed. I have bought Bose in the past and been happy. What happened to quality control? This should never have been shipped out.

I charged it and now it will not come on. The first time I charged it and I cannot get it to work. I thought Bose would be a trusted brand. I have been reading and trying to see if I can get it corrected and all things suggested via the Internet has not worked. Very disappointed do not buy one!!!!

The standard Bose sound profile- clear,  bright sound but gets pretty hissy sounding at higher volumes. Punchy and responsive with midrange, but no low end at all. Wasn't expecting to shake the house down with this little thing, but this has zero base... putting it close to a wall so it has something to reverberate through helps a little.  It's also very directionally focused- if you're 3-6 back directly in front of it and move off the side just a foot or two, you lose a lot of the sound signature.I bought two for a garage gym and was unconcerned about the reviews that claimed it didn't have a ton of bass or that the volume did not go that loud, because I don't want to annoy the hell out of my neighbors with noise when I am working out. The pair up easily, thought you are limited to app are integrated in the Bose app itself (Apple Music, etc). I thought them being battery operated would add to some flexibility, especially the the garage gym is a work in progress- it would be nice to easily move them around if needed.
Z6
Not really a true "red" (at all) it's a almost a "salmon" type of color, and the "color" is what I got it for, but I kept it anyway because my little 10 yr old hates to have things taken from her.

I’ve noticed a lot of reviews criticizing certain aspects of this speaker that are so insignificant, so friggin petty that I can’t help but wonder if these people even used the product. First off, the A/C adapter not being included....get over it. If you don’t have one lying around after years of electronics purchases, then I don’t know what to tell you. Ever had a smart phone? A kindle? A tablet? Bingo! A/C adapter right there! Secondly, the voice assist setting is exactly that....a setting...that you can turn off. Don’t subtract a review star just because you can’t read and navigate menus on an app.This is not a lint magnet. It has a smooth finish that is easily cleaned with a damp wash cloth.

As some have mentioned previously, the sound coming out of this little speaker is fantastic. The problem with this speaker is the battery and charging design. When the battery reaches 20%, it shuts down and goes into a kind of hibernation. So, 1) you don't really get to use the full battery, just 80% of it, and 2) you have to go thru a reboot and charging process.This speaker will not charge via USB by plugging into the wall like you can recharge your phone and any other electronic device. Instead, you must plug the USB into a laptop computer. This is a hassle. I'd rather just plug it in while it's in the kitchen or on the back patio but I can't.

I got this speaker a few years ago. I loved it from the start. I have a kindle fire with a lot of music on Amazon. Connection to my kindle has never been an issue. With that said, today I tried to connect to my kindle and nothing happened. No power light. I thought maybe the battery was so low that there was not enough power to turn on the light. I plugged in my charger, and nothing. I tried different plugs...nothing. I got on Amazon and was surprised at the number of reviewers with this issue. Many had a lot less use than I. I found a couple of reviews that mentioned resetting the speaker. I tried it and right now it looks to be working again. So thank you for the tip. I hope I will be able to continue using it once it charges.

It's an ok speaker, but it beeps infernally, even when turned off.  Hard to sleep anywhere near it.  I keep it in the garage, and bring it out when I want it.  When I get fed up, I'll throw it out-  then it can beep away in some landfill site somewhere.....  There might be a workaround, but since they don't give a manual with the product, you'd have to hunt down the solution.  If you have time.

I am a long time bose customer. I have always enjoyed the sound, the consistent quality, and the outstanding customer support. I had two bose color sound link speakers that I pair with my iPhone and Amazon Echos; over time there were some battery issues. I called the company and they were willing to discuss a return and if I wanted, discount and upgrade to the Bose color sound link II speakers. They provided me information about the differences and it seemed like they might sound a little bit better which would be difficult to do because I really liked the ones I had. The new ones just arrived and the sound is spectacular. And unmistakable improvement over the Bose color sound link-clearer, fuller sound across the spectrum. Deeper base, better separation, cleaner treble-and low volume or at full volume! If you are considering buying one over the other, I would strongly suggest paying a little extra for the sound link II. Both models are of course Bose quality and in my opinion have spectacular sound coming out of a little box. They fill a room effortlessly. The sound quality does not diminish as the volume goes up. Another in a long list of happy bose experiences.

This is the second one I bought. I loved the sound and practicality of it. Suddenly, it didn't work anymore. I couldn't charge it. I searched for the issue online, but couldn't find a solution. I bought a second one. And here I am, months later, with the same issue. After researching it online, I see that it's a very common problem with this speaker. I followed some steps mentioned. The power went back on for a few seconds and died again. And... that's it. I did everything that was suggested, many times. Now I need to buy another speaker and it certainly won't be this one. Not worth the headache.

It’s an average speaker, but honestly, I expect more from Bose. It sounds fine for how small it is, but it doesn’t sound any better than other, cheaper speakers. The thing that really upsets me is the battery life is really poor - only about 3 hours. Yes, I listen to it loud, but I expect a charge to last longer. I appreciate that the voice warnings come on (“battery medium”), but once it says medium then you’ve got like 20 minutes until it dies. Then when it dies all the way, it won’t turn back on. As in, if it dies, you can’t use it while it’s charging and low battery. So dumb. I think this speaker is worth about $50-$60, max. I was gifted this speaker and it was purchased at Best Buy, however, I reviewed it here because I think people should know. I’ve uploaded pics to prove I have the thing.

Almost from day one I had problems with it not turning on and off using the button on the device. And it powers off in the middle of pay with plenty of battery lefts sometimes. The only way to power it back on is the connect a power cord and turn it on.  I've contacted support which was mostly a wast of time.  They had me update it which I did and the problem continues.  It also tries to connect to every Bluetooth device we one all by itself.  It can be 3am and you'll here it come on trying to connect to my laptop or one of our phones.  Very bad experience with this product and the support is hands off.  They sent emails with steps.  No real contact or follow up.  Basically you lost your money. Would be great if it worked right.

I loved it while it worked - for only 1 year!  It came on today and immediately shut off.  It said "fully powered" and then shut off.  It will not come on nor will it charge.  No lights will even come on.  Let's see, $120 for a year, that's $10 / month.  Decide if it's worth it to you.  Check the reviews that are from people who have had this for more that 6 months.  There are not many.  MOst people review it right after they get it.  The complaints from those of us who have had it over 6 months is it goes dead at some point 6- 12 months out!

I had the original Bose speaker and just before the one year warranty expired it stopped charging. I contacted customer service and they were great. They sent me an RMA and I returned the speaker and was sent the new color II speaker. When I synched it to my smart tv the sound was ok but the sound volume low. When I attached it to my phone it worked great and I was able to get much more volume out of the speaker. I've only used it a few times and the last time I used it, it worked fine but would not shut off. After repeatedly pushing to off button, it finally shut off only to turn back on all by itself. Now I can shut it off but without doing anything it randomly turns itself back on. I really like Bose speakers and have two other Bose sound systems that have worked and are still working great. This one, not so good.

Got a good deal directly from Bose for a refurbished Soundlink ll (SOUNDLINK COLOR BT SPKR II PLR WHT,WW,FR) in White $79 - order #WH04433014 . First problem is the color isn't white, it's a light gray. (seems like no big deal but I promised the wife it was white, fit her decor, etc & you know how that goes). The next problem was I had some issues pairing it with my Windows 10 computer so I called Bose directly. I first spoke to "Joseph" from their Tech Support and he told me I needed to call Microsoft directly because they are not familiar with pairing their device with Windows 10. I explained to Joseph (the Bose Tech) that there are almost one-billion computers in the world now running Windows 10 but that didn't seem to impress him enough to do anything but have me call Microsoft directly. I called Amazon directly to help pair it, (even though the Amazon tech knew I didn't purchase it on Amazon and it took about 30 seconds for him to help me pair the device. (I made a commitment to renew my Amazon Prime subscription thru 2039, LOL), goodness is Amazon great. I frankly was a little disappointed in the sound of the Soundlink, quite tinny and a bit of "cracking/static" sounding at about 3/4 volume or so. I'm deciding whether to ship it back .... but with Bose's customer support?

So I wanted to like this thing but it is a total piece of garbage. First device I got stopped working completely after a few weeks. Went to Bose’s website and they had a alert for the serial number and said it was defective and sent a replacement.Second device over winter didn’t get used at all since we weren’t outside. Finally opened it up a couple weeks ago and charged it up. Worked fine out of the box for a few days. Today went to play music and won’t play again. Why the in world is it so complicated. Kept trying to update. It’s a speaker and a battery with a Bluetooth chip. It shouldn’t require constant attention to get it to work. Threw it in the trash because I was sick of it.

I'm returning this speaker because Bose flatly refuses to address a major complaint from customers. When you're not using the speaker (and don't want to), any time any device comes within range, it will AUTOMATICALLY TURN ON AND CONNECT. Without your permission. If you disconnect it, the speaker will continually say "READY TO CONNECT" until you walk over and manually shut it off again. And then it turns back on again as soon as it sees another device. Bose has been aware of this issue for at least a year and a half and will do nothing about it. This is the first and last Bose product I'll purchase.

I bought this speaker and used it for the longest of time with no problem. It wasn't used for two weeks and went into a "security" mode. I through all of the processes and tried all of the suggestions to troubleshoot and the speaker still wouldn't work. I contacted their support services and the customer support of Bose is terrible. They expected me to shell out $75 for a new speaker because their product didn't work like it was supposed to. If I'm going to spend another $75, I'll spend it on a new JBL speaker that actually works like it should.

I've never been a big fan of Bose products. Way overpriced, mediocre sounding, and very base heavy. I though this would be a good compact, loud speaker for outdoors and beach. And for those purposes it is, but the sound quality is not great for what it costs. In typical Bose fashion, they emphasize trying to create very strong sounding bass from small devices but it lacks clear highs and is overwhelmed by very muddy sounding bass.. It can get loud but without some distortion. It's a nice speaker for the beach, but not worth this price. I put it up against multiple other speakers that were a fraction of the cost and the Bose was my least favorite sounding.

I love this little speaker, sounds great, easy to pair, great for travel... just beware,  mine stopped working after 6 months, wouldn't charge, wouldn't turn on, I tried the holding the recommended buttons down for so many seconds and releasing and turning on, updated the software... nada.  I called Bose and since mine was still under warranty they are going to send me a brand new one with a new one year warranty to go with it.  I have seen quite a few reviews with this same problem.2-24-18 update, Bose sent me a new one in record time, I have had it maybe 6 weeks and the exact same thing happened. I am so disappointed, this speaker has a great sound and I love the portability!! But I don't trust the product, or the software/battery malfunction that is going on.  They are letting me upgrade to the Revolve, I sure hope that one is more trust worthy.

I recently purchased this speaker after researching several portable Bluetooth speakers. Let me start by saying while I think this speaker is fantastic, I am not a bose "fanboy". I own a few bose products as well as sonos, anka, and others. I do not believe  (rather I know) there is a single one size fits all brand for audio. I looked at several other Bluetooth speakers in the 100--300 price range before purchasing the soundcolor 2 (aqua blue). I was looking for a portable speaker to travel with when I travel for either business or vacation. The priorities for me in a speaker was sound, portability/ruggedness and battery life. This unit for my application is perfect. It sounds fantastic. As I write this review there is a gentleman sitting about 10 feet away from me using a beats pill, my speaker (listening to Pink Floyd pulse streaming in Apple Music) sounds full and rich while his (listening bon jovi) sounds thin almost as if playing from his phone speaker. The form factor of this speaker is perfect to throw in a bag, it is made of hard rubber and feels like it can sustain a drop and being knocked around in a bag. It does not look or feel cheap. I looked at the bose sound link mini and the 3. Both sounded fine, the 3 being the loudest and fullest the mini does not sound as good as the sound color with the sounds I played through them at Best Buy (Metallica, seal. Richie kotzen, Steve vai). I also did not want something so aesthetically engineered that it would require a case or bumper to travel with. I also played the beats pill and was very bass heavy for me while the sound color sounded much fuller and balanced. Battery life in this unit says 8 hours but I have gotten at least 9 without the unit dying. For how I plan on using this I do not care about a 15-20 battery life. For the casual traveler this unit is perfect. I listen to a wide variety of music from classical to heavy metal as well as podcasts and this unit sounds great with all of those genres. I hope this is helpful

What I like is it's great sound for such a small speaker. Bose truly is the best sound quality. I deducted a few stars for physical reasons. For one, when I took it right out of the box for the first time, the volume button is out of place. I tried to maybe push it over back into place but it wouldn't budge. Now I have to press & hold down the volume button to increase it. Not to mention there's an ugly bump on the top that shouldn't be there. Second, the cutouts for the aux input & charger are out of place also. I have to pull the silicone out of the way to even plug it in. Again, another flaw it should not have for the price point. Now lastly, the charging cord does not come with a cube to plug it into the wall. Again, for $130 I didn't want to have to go out & buy an accessory for it that should have been included.

BOSE sound in the size of a picture frame. Great little portable sound speaker.Very easy to set up the link and control devices with the the manual controls. Good Subsonic bass for small rooms and balanced High Midband Low tones for a rich sound.The Battery life is sufficient for say day at the beach. Around my house it lasts a few days, but I find a full charge lasts about 5 and a half hours on it's loudest setting. My BOSE included a USB charger complete with adapter. Osut of the box I followed the battery charging instructions and have owned the BOSE SoundLink for a year and a half, the battery takes the same usual 2 hours to charge and hasn't failed the 5-6 hour life at full range.

Was a gift from my grandma three Christmas's ago. So it lasted a little over two years. Used it five days a week, at five hours shifts every week at work at full blast. The battery never went below 6 hours long after a full charge -- Not even after two years of continuous, incredible use. The sound was good enough that customers would often stop me and ask if I had a real person inside playing guitar. Was able to hear over the loud machines in my store, too. It finally died -- The end of an era, when it was dropped just one too many time onto a hard floor, and it never turned back on. Rest in peace, lil' buddy. You'll be remembered.
The sound quality overall is pretty decent, and the speaker pairs easily with my device.Got the first one as a gift. After ~15 month it stop recharge. Thought it might be bad speaker.

I have one of these speakers myself. They are perfect for anyone that wants a smaller portable Bluetooth speaker. It is easy to bring wherever you want to take it. Because of their size, they can easily be put anywhere you want to put them. Bathrooms, kitchens, living rooms, and the outdoors. It is simple and easy to use, so people of all ages can use it. Children to the elderly. Everyone in my family each has a different color.The sound quality that comes out of it is also amazing. It has really big sound for a little speaker. It is a smaller speaker, which I like, but it is not too small. It really does have big sound that comes out of it for how big the speaker is. I also like that the speaker comes in different colors and not just one color. I also like that there are no moving parts on it, and also around the bottom there is rubber so it protects it. This speaker is durable when it gets dropped.

I've had this  speaker for about two years. I currently own two pair of Bose home speakers and have always found Bose products to be of the highest quality. I recently went to re-charge the speaker after several months of non-use, and found it will no longer take a charge. I had it plugged into the USB charger and an AC outlet for several hours and it won't turn on. I went to Bose Support and found out it goes into a sleep mode when the battery is not charged for some length of time. Per Bose's instructions I tried holding down the multi-function button for 10 seconds while it was plugged in, and nothing. Then I went to see if I could get a replacement and Bose want's me to return the original (fortunately I still have the box), but then they want me to pay $75 for a replacement, when they only cost $100 for a new one. Why would I want to pay 75% of the original cost to replace a speaker that only worked for two years and then stopped? A few years ago I replaced a pair of 20 year old Bose 501 speakers and got more than 50% off for a replacement. This speaker does not uphold the Bose reputation and I would not pay more than $50 to replace it. I have a cheap little "Musky" bluetooth speaker bar I paid $30 for 3 years ago that still works fine and sounds just as good. Bose is definitely slipping in quality as far as this speaker goes.

Ok, so with this I now I have 5 bose devices. 2 headphones, wireless and wired. 3 speakers. Out of the box compared to the Soundlink Mini 2 (the original bar design) I'm not as impressed. There's no charging dock so it looks flush with the area and it doesn't come with a wall outlet adaptor. JUST Micro USB. I have the Soundlink mini that looks kinda like an echo dot and it sounds better to me. The sound on this speaker sounds... off, like I don't know. But you audiophiles know what I mean. Next this thing is light. It may be the lightest of the 3 speakers I have.  And finally, the Bose App, I can't use my Soundlink Mini 2 with the Bose Connect App, but because my phone supports dual pairing I can get it to work. I post an update once I try with all 3 speakers. The mini I leave with my tablet at my GF's.

If you are trying to use it for stereo, STAY AWAY!  You cannot connect two of these speakers for the advertised true stereo unless you use the Bose app for playing music AND subscribe to a special Bose subscription service.  While a single speaker will play using the iTunes app, for stereo it is necessary to use the Bose app, and it takes over your music system completely.  While this may not be a concern for Android users, it screws up the iTunes system.For stereo, both speakers will almost certainly need to have their firmware updated.  This is a long and frustrating process.  NOTE-- Many of the people who have experienced their speaker being "bricked" may have had their speaker going through the firmware update.  While there is some communication about what is happening during the firmware update process, there is not much.  It's easy to think that your speaker has gone dead and then you start playing with it and mess up the update, and that WILL brick the product.

Sound is great! The only complaint I have is that the color (polar white) is waaaaay off from the color displayed here or even on the box that it came from. Our house has a lot of white surfaces, which is why we went with the polar white option. But when we opened the box we were sad to see the color is more blue-ish, grayish white rather than the bright white on the packaging. Still sounds great and is extremely easy to use but has we realized it wasn't quite white we would have gone with the black.
Pros:-Good price! (Even though I got mine for free)

This little speaker looks and sounds great, but like many others have stated, I have had problems charging it. One problem is, there is no battery indicator on this device. It would be nice if I knew the battery when the battery was getting low. Yes, there is an audio feature that tells me "Battery high" or "Battery medium" when I turn it on, but it must not be able to speak when low. I've had this speaker a year now and have never heard it say "Batter low." It just dies. And charging is an issue IF AND ONLY IF the battery dies completely. In fact, I thought my first one was defective and returned it to the store. They couldn't make it charge either, so they gave me a new one. When the second speaker did the same thing, I diligently searched online (not through Bose who still doesn't seem to give a proper solution) but through online forums. There I was able to learn the trick to recharging a completely dead speaker. It really does sound great. (BTW - the solution is, when you plug it in, hold the mute button down for 15 seconds and the light to show it is charging will come on.)

This speaker worked for a couple hours upon opening the package then it turns off. So i leave it to charge over night (2am-6:30am) and it still refuses to turn on 3 days later no matter how much i charge it or dont charge it. And now it gets better because i got a replacement and it broke again the same way.

I bought this to use with my Fire Tablet. I links easily and setup was a snap. The sound however, is a problem. When it works properly it sounds great but most times it can hardly be heard. I try to adjust the sound through the device and I have to raise it all the way to the end to get it in a comfortable range and sometimes that doesn't work either so I try the Soundlink and that is a problem as well. If I turn it off and reset it it does no good. Other times it comes on and is maxed out . I have to turn both devices down to make it work. It is just not consistent.It doesn't matter if I use a hard wire or the blue tooth. The fire works just fine and the volume is good on it just the quality sucks.

I’ve had this speaker for several years, purchased when it cost much more. It has been through several firmware updates which added features like being able to link with other speakers for party mode as it didn’t have that when it came out. Battery life is rated at 8 hrs but I get much more than that. I use it in the shop and it plays all day easily. Don’t play it at full volume so that probably helps.Some people have issues with the voice prompt being bothersome. Just get the proper Bose app, there are two, and just turn it off, I did as don’t want my speaker talking to me. Others are bothered by the buttons being to small, I didn’t find a need for them as volume is controlled by the phone, just use the phone volume buttons, maybe that only works with iPhone?

I was looking for speakers and came across this speaker and tested it extensively in store when no one was there so there were really no sound interferences. I tested it with various settings and types of music at various angles and volumes. This product, like most Bose speakers, is complete and utter garbage. I am a jazz pianist and I have a well trained ear. This speaker can't handle lows (bass) to save it's life. The drivers inside the speaker are literally garbage and honestly very cheaply made as compared to many other speakers on the market. Bose spends a great deal of money on marketing and it is the marketing that fools people who don't know what to look for that their speaker is superior when in actuality it is garbage. I have a pair of Bose qc25 headphones and their noise canceling tech is excellent but the drivers aren't great either. All Bose products rely on this post processing digital mechanism to boost the sound and make it sound artificially better than it really does. Please don't waste your money on this product. Anyone who says its great doesn't know what to look for in a speaker, and I mean truly doesn't understand the complexities and components of sound in a song. I highly recommend the Sonos Sound One over this trash. It's sound is far superior than anything in the BestBuy bluetooth speaker section. It's not portable but it's sound will blow this thing away. If you don't believe anything that I've said google these terms: Bose speaker drivers. You will see how cheap they are and how poorly made they are. Facts don't lie.... don't be duped people.
Pros:- great connectivity. This thing will keep playing music with no skips even if you are in the next room over. It has always connected to my iphone the instant it turns on without fail.

We recently purchased this item off of QVC and I was excited to get it for Christmas.  Out of the box, my Echo Dot or Google Nest would not/could not recognize it.  My phone was able to link to it but I don't listen to music through my phone.  I downloaded THREE different Bose apps to try and get it to work.  My phone would recognize it, one Bose app would recognize it, but the Echo Dot and another Bose app could not find it.I made multiple calls to Bose Customer service.  Once to be put on hold for 50 minutes until we had to leave.  Other times I was directed to the wrong department.  A couple times I was just dropped.  Multiple searches on-line found no answers to my questions.  Decided to just return it to QVC.  Hopefully you'll have better luck than me.

Background: So, I owned a SoundLink Color 1 for over a year.... that thing was awesome... Deep Bass... great with movies, heavy metal, jazz, classical, salsa, etc.... I also own the Bose Speaker Monitors (excellent quality, at least for me, and y limited space...)Short version: came with firmware 1.1.9 (sucks) - updated firmware 1.1.10 is great!!!!

My husband received this speaker as a reward through a safety incentive program at his job about a year ago. It had received almost daily use until around three or four months ago. He had taken it on the roof with him while doing some clean up and ended up forgetting it up there. He just found it after spending the past several months looking for it. It has been on the roof the entire time. It has made it through several heavy rain storms, a hurricane, and being baked in the Louisiana sun, and it STILL WORKS!!!! When he found it he did not expect for it to work since we have had so much rain since he last used it. Yet, he brought it in, plugged it up to the charger, turned it on, connected to bluetooth, and went to playing music. The sound quality is just clear as it had been. We would have never paid $150.00 for this speaker, but I am here to tell you that it is well worth it. It has held up to so much abuse, especially the inadvertent abuse over the past few months, and it is still going strong. You will not be disappointed with this speaker. We now know exactly why it is so expensive for such a little speaker, but it is definitely worth it.

I bought this speaker for Christmas 2019. It stopped working after the 90 day warranty expired.  It stopped working just like that even though it still connects to the sound source. I’ve had other brands that lasted a couple of years. I will never buy another Bose again in this lifetime.

I had this product for almost a year and the charger and charging was flakey. Sometimes it would easily plug in and work, other times I spent time trying to get it to connect. I had similar issues with the Bluetooth on my iPhone. I only ever used this product in my house so it is not like it was abused in a shop or barn. Finally after a year it would not charge at all. I would never recommend or purchase this item again. Major thumbs down.

I bought this speaker for it's compact size, portability and sound quality. I have other speakers that are bass heavy which drown out the vocals and Bose does a really good job balancing the lows, mids and highs. Vocals are very clear. I primarily use this for music and love using it for watching movies- it is surprisingly loud for it's size-it sounds as if the sounds are straight from a larger soundbar. I am considering a second one because you can do party mode which has an option to set up a left and right speaker to create a DOLBY surround sound atmosphere. Although portable-it packs a big Punch. Impressive!!!

I love waterproof bluetooth speakers.  They are my great companions when I take showers and I have been used a lot of bluetooth speakers.  When I got this, I was excited because it was from Bose.  I have been using their speakers and headphones and have never been disappointed.  But, I hate to tell you that this would be the first product from Bose that I am not completely satisfied with.The Bose SoundLink Color Bluetooth Speaker II was a cute and nice waterproof speaker for sure. It had all the features that other waterproof bluetooth speakers have except a backward skip of a song from a button (please let me know if you know how to do this). The aqua color was great and the shape and rubbery finish of a speaker was satisfactory.  And the battery lasted long as the maker claimed.  But, when it came to the sound, all the nice good things started to get faded out.  This is a Bose speaker and it was natural to expect a good sound if not the greatest.  The balance of the sound was not adequate (I mean unbalanced) and it was not comfortable on my ears.  The bass was not rich like other Bose products and the mid and high range sound did not get blended well.  I could not believe that it was a sound from a Bose speaker.  I know it is a bluetooth speaker so it has its own weaknesses. But I could find a bluetooth speaker which sounds better.  I do not mean that this is a terrible speaker, however, it was just not close to the expectations that I have for any Bose products.  I might be biased, so I asked my daughter without telling her that I did not like the sound and she had a similar opinion.  As far as the sound is concerned, she would choose a different bluetooth speaker.  FYI, I own many bluetooth speakers to compare.

The sound quality is awesome; however, I have to give it a bad rating because of the terrible charging issues, complete failure of customer support, and the lack of a charging brick. First, Amazon is awesome. The first one of these speakers we bought wouldn't charge. Amazon happily took it back and sent another. The new one charged -- once. Once it ran that charge down, it wouldn't power on or charge, no matter what we did. We tried to update the speaker online, but since there was no charge, it wouldn't. We called customer service, what sounded like a call center in another country, full of untrained representatives who couldn't care less about our speaker problems. This person told us all kinds of bs about holding the power button down while unplugging the power source. It didn't work. Then, he told us that we must use the charging brick it came with; it didn't come with one. That is idiotic anyway. Bypassing a charging brick and plugging it into a USB wall outlet shouldn't hinder the charge. The completely useless people at Bose are sending us a brick. Woo hoo! I was very annoyed. I went to Amazon reviews, determined that another customer must have gone through this. I immediately found a helpful reviewer who said to plug it in and hold the three dot button down for 15 seconds. It worked!!! Thank you Amazon for making up for yet another company's shortcomings. In short, buy the speaker, but don't forget the three dot button trick because Bose will be of no use to you when your speaker won't charge.

Nice build, nice connectivity. I especially like that the NFC is always active (even when off) and it pairs/connects and powers on when I touch it with my phone. Good battery life too.The sound is not great for podcasts, especially for male voices - too deep/thumpy. For music, I guess it depends on one's taste. I do like to hear the bass, when there, but not have the extra thump/resonatotion (typical to a subwoofer turned up).

I actually love this speaker, I received one as a gift and then purchased another. The sound is rich and a little bass-y. It's small, easy to move around the house and is easy to pair with many devices.My frustration lies with the charging. After having my speaker for about 6 months, I thought the cord had died. The speaker wouldn't charge. I tried other cords with no success. Eventually, I figured out if I wiggled the cord just right the speaker would charge. I figured this was an annoying but survivable anomaly. Then speaker #2 developed the same issue. This speaker is at my dad's house so the cords and user are different. Same exact issue. Again, we decided it wasn't too big of a deal to wiggle the cord until a proper connection was made for charging.

Bought the first one at Sam's Club. It wouldn't work from the get go. Called Bose they couldn't get it to work. Returned and got another one this second one wouldn't work either. This time Bose replaced the SoundLink with a brand new one. Right about 1 year later the speaker plays for about 1 hour and then dies till its recharged.Also the sound seems to be getting a little scratchy.
If it falls off an end table onto a wooden floor, will it stop working?

Ive always looked at Bose as hype and overpriced.  I have changed my mind. I have the mini Soundlink,two Micro Soundlinks the Soundwear and yesterday I got an incredible deal at a Bose Showroom. $176 for two of these Refurbished at $110 for one and if you bought a second one it was 40% off. A no brainer.  I planned buying two so I could get that incredible stereo. I am blown away by the sound. I only wish I didnt have to recouple them everytime I turned the units on,but it sounds so great I am putting up with the minor frustration.Quite a few reviews mention that the product becomes inoperable after only a short time. I hope my speakers dont meet that fate. You would think with the quality of Bose that wouldnt happen. When paired in stereo they sound as good as any high priced stereo system. Bose is not hype. They are that good.

The most frustrating and low quality purchase I have made. The first died just after a year and the replacement died after nine months. The charger stopped working after 6 months. I've tried the "fixes" and done far too much research online trying to get them working again. Bose will do nothing about it. I shouldn't have to work this hard to get a speaker to work consistently. Terrible product. I can't believe Bose still sells this thing.

For a small speaker, very nice sound.  Better than UE Boom2. Works well in a small room.  Perhaps a tad bass heavy, but easy to get used to.  Nice to have volume controls on the speaker itself. Pairs well with multiple devices, which means I can control volume, etc., via iPhone even though the connection is with my desktop computer.One negative - The only adapter that comes with the speaker is a USB cord (no charger), which means that this speaker can not be charged and used at the same time via laptop or desktop computer without incessant beeping.  Very irritating.  Charging via a wall charger (my iPhone charger) no beeping.  This meant that I could not take my laptop and speaker to a gathering without having to bring two chargers, one for the speaker and one for the laptop.

I purchased three of these speakers to connect via bluetooth to my Samsung Smart TV. The speaker would connect to the TV and play sound but it would only play the sound at one level. The volume controls on the device would not work up or down and neither would the remote control for the TV. I even tried using AUX line in, and it distorted the sound. Was not a good listening experience.I have been the the Bose store and they tell me this speaker wasn't intended for TV... Shouldn't that be my call? They said it had delayed sound, but I never found that to be the case. The sound followed the picture correctly, it just would not allow me to control the volume at all.

I originally was a little disappointed with the SLC2. It only sounds "ok".  It's impressive for it's size, but it doesn't blow you away like the Soundlink Mini, which is more what I was hoping for.  I like all of the features, water resistance, speaker calls etc. but I was still just a little down on the audio quality.  I found two solutions that make it 1000x better.  First, though I typically do not like to use equalizers, putting my phone on "Latin" EQ really improved the sound for rock music, which I felt sounded weak bass-wise and a little muddy without.  The second solution was to get a second SLC2 one and play in stereo mode.  I think (though I'm not certain) when the Left and Right channels are split in stereo, it requires less work for each speaker to produce the sound and made the music I was listening to much clearer and better.  I put one speaker on each side of my grill outside and the music sounded awesome.

I bought this Bose as a replacement for the color soundlink original version, which I got several years out of and still works.  (I knocked that one off a table while it was plugged in once, and it jerked the cable around in the back where you plug it in, so now when it charges you have to have the cord positioned just right.  That was entirely my fault, but I found it annoying so I thought I would upgrade to the newer version.)Sound quality of both versions is, in my opinion, excellent.  I use it at work and numerous people have commented on how great it sounds.  However, my issue with the soundlink II is that after a few months of use, it seems to not take a charge now.  If it died during use, the old speaker would play again as soon as it was connected to a power source.  This one does not, and what's worse I can't get it to charge at all right now.  I'm irritated because I only bought it in July.  Now that I see that so many people seem to have this problem, I'm even more annoyed.

Quite a few of my family members have a Bose speaker and my parents love it. This speaker was a gift for my padre and he loves it, for sure used about every other day. The only negative I would say is that you cannot delete phones off of it and my parents have a lot of company who come over and want to connect and to get to their own phone they have to go through listening to all the other connections previously made before getting to theirs. Other than that, it is a good speaker, especially for the house.

Great sound lousy pairing and control. Wow BOSE finally screwed up! Trust me, Don't BUY THIS ONE! I have 3 BOSE devices that work perfectly. This one simply doesn't work. It has firmware issues, volume control issues and I suspect serious flaws hence the low price for BOSE. When JBL beats out BOSE something went wrong.

Speaker sits less than 3 feet from my Chromebook. More times than not, I try to connect and it says connected to,, No sound, setting on puter, i delete the Bose app and reconnect it.. Tried things on the web to reset the speaker yada yada  and still nothing.. powers on, says it connected and puter says all is well.. but noooo sound.. This review may say Im not a verified purchaser but I am..  Speaker sounds amazing when it works
