Every time I spend the money on a Bose product, I am always very satisfied with the quality of the product. That is certainly true yet again in this case. This speaker is perfect for traveling, or activities like the beach. The beach was the first place I went with this, and the sound was great quality and the volume was perfect for my group size(6 people). We could all hear clearly without it being too loud to disrupt others around. It wasn't at max volume yet either, probably 2 or 3 more levels would have been max. Great product!

An amazing speaker .i bought at another source. .however im happy with it ...someone else mentioned the colors selections on the II ..what or who made the decision  AT bose to use these new colors are you  kidding me ?? Definitely wasn't many males in the decision. .gross .i digress. .it is an awesome sound maker and is worth the price also there is next to nothing in accessories for this new model everything is made for the #1 ...not #2 ..and volume settings you can't hear much till ur past half way line ...finally if you are buying this for your phone. .be advised that this will not utilize bluetooth to talk the other speakers ive used allowed to communicate via speaker this function is omitted further your music session wont return to on play ...oh well i guess .nothing is perfect not even bose but as close as needed to buy. .so yes buy it just be aware nothing is perfect

I’ve had two of these speaker for several years. One recently stopped working. At first it would not charge, but by wiggling the port we could get it to charge. But then it stopped working altogether.I was reading reviews with the plan to buy a new one, when I found this simple tip for resetting (?) it. I am sharing it below. It totally worked!

$130 dollars and they can’t be bothered to include an wall plug for charging?!? I think it’s really cheap/insulting that they only included a charging cord with a USB port and no wall plug for it. So it’s on the buyer to find or buy one to use with this.

I own 5 different Bluetooth speakers. None of them even compare to this Bose speaker when it comes to sound quality. The bass is uncomprimised with absolutely no distortion. Nobody could ever desire more from this speaker when it comes to sound quality. If that is what you are most interested in then this is absolutely the best speaker for you.The volume is great, but for this price you could get more volume, however you would have to sacrifice sound quality. This speaker will fill any room and even outside the volume is plenty. Unless you just want the loudest speaker out there or you just have unreasonable expectations for a portable Bluetooth speaker, you'll be pleased with the volume.

This speaker wasn't bad enough to return until 6 months into using it. Every now and then it would cut in and out like I was trying to tune in a station on an old AM/FM transistor radio. Connect/disconnect/connect/power down/connect. Ridiculous hoops to get it to calm down. Then it would tell me battery was low - but the battery was full and the unit connected to power. Crazy AF. I broke up with it via hammer.

Since the last version update the speaker is turning  on by itself at the middle of the night (and day…), and speaking out load commands like "waiting to connect". There is nothing to do about it.There are hundreds of complains in Bose's forums that complain about it but Bose chose to do nothing about it. it is more than an year since it started.

Gets confused between different device names and has a horrible interface. Stops playing music to yell at you about the battery. Complete garbage, defective by design, whoever made it should be fired.

I sincerely try not to be a jerk when reviewing products I'm not satisfied with. So here's the straight dope:Got a very nice and expensive stereo headset as a gift. Not noise cancelling. They are stylish, had great sound, and held up really well. Used them at the gym too much and the soft cushions went to complete shit. $35 to replace. (IMO, Bose makes plenty of money on the product. CHARGING $35 for two pieces of foam that costs 12 cents to make is gougy.
You need to press the "multi function" button to make it work - try to find that button location on the USELESS  instructions !!Try and use the VOLUME buttons that DON'T EVEN WORK !!

Beautiful little wireless speaker you can move around the house with you wherever you want. It is actually pretty powerful with a nice low end. My only complaint is that it seems to go from battery 'medium' to completely drained. And when I plug it in to charge it and power it on shortly after it says battery 'high' again. But despite this the battery life is good (several hours at least) and charges quickly.

I see a lot of reviews complaining that the sound isn't great, or that the speaker stopped working after a few weeks. I'm not sure what those folks are looking for or doing with their speakers, but I got this as a gift last year and let me just say: this speaker is phenomenal. The sound quality is beyond what you'd expect from such a small device; the bass is real and actually packs a punch. I've had people ask where my subwoofer was when I'm using this speaker in my living room. I've never had any issues with connectivity, nor has the speaker ever stopped working. It holds about 7-8 hours of charge, which is admittedly less than I'd prefer, but it is what it is. If you want to solid portable Bluetooth speaker with sound quality that blows away everything else in this price range (or even $100 more), this is your best bet. It's Bose, and if you're familiar with them, you already know what kind of quality to expect. I say, pull the trigger!
Hmm... this speaker is for the pros!If you're looking for a nice bluetooth speaker with amazing sound quality, then I have great news for you. You've just found it!

For the first four hours this worked - I loved it.  After that it died. Wouldn't charge or even show connection to power.  I was hoping it was a fluke and I got a bad one but after reading the reviews obviously not.  My sister also has the old model and customer service told her once the battery goes dead it was almost the cost of a new one to replace.  Hers is the older model which has worked fine except for the cord which has had to be replaced.  Cord price wasnt bad but after shipping its a little crazy.  Extremely dissappointed in this Bose product- what junk.  I have several other models that have lasted what seems like forever.. over 15 years. This one is garbage.

Had problems with this unit at first. Plugged in a Cellphone Charger and a red lite came on. After a hr I was playing music and 10 mins later unit shut off and would not power up. I did the reset thing and it happened again. Decided to use a wall charger as per manual and that red lite turned Orange blinking than Green. A Cellphone Charger will not Charge this unit. I also have a JBL Charge 3 which I prefer but the Bose is ok. Use a Wall Charger that's a Charger with USB Ports that plugs into the Wall.

I believe I have an older version of this speaker, have had it for about 4 years. My fave bluetooth item! I use this speaker almost everyday. Sounds awesome and can hear my music all throughout my house. Battery life is pretty good, lasts a few hours on a full charge. Only good things to say. I never realized how much they cost since this was a gift from my sister. But I would definitely pay the cost to replace it if it ever breaks! Great product!

I have always enjoyed Bose products and I was excited for this speaker as well.  There are many things I like about the design of this speaker but technically it seems pretty cheap and being able to stream to this device has been the biggest  issue and today was the last day it would connect and playback what is playing on my phone.  It is useless now.  Maybe a nice door stop.The buttons on the top of the speaker work for on/off and connecting bluetooth when it's working.  Volume never worked from the speaker.  I have always had to control the volume through the phone.

It’s pretty sound when it works and you can pair it for phone conferences. Like some people have reported, I had the same issue with the speaker not charging and working after a while. I’ve updated it, followed troubleshooting instructions, and tried different chargers. For the price you pay this product you expect better. It’s a disappointment that this product is associated with the Bose name. I believe a class action lawsuit should be made against Bose with the long history of problems with this product.

IMG❗️ I purchased 5 of these. 1st one quit working less than 2 weeks! NOTHING ❗️NOW, less than 6 months the other 4 the EXACT SAME 😳. 3 were given as Christmas gifts, kept 2, one for me and my husband and the other for my son.. his is the first one that quit working after 2 weeks. It was played twice! No charge, no NOTHING ❗️🔥❗️🔥❗️🔥

I will say that I love the sound of the speaker.  Unfortunately,  I have had the same issue with it refusimg to power on or charge MULTIPLE TIMES.  It is NOT broken.  The speaker has a battery protection mode, aka sleep, aka hibernation mode that kicks in if you let it drain completely.  It is very frustrating and, this last time, it took me hours to get it working again.  There are multiple articles and YouTube videos on how to fix it.  I will say that I always forget how and have to try various methods until it starts to chargd again.  No one wants to deal with this over a Bluetooth speaker.  I'm going to be super careful not to let it die again.

I got it for the prime day thing, thinking it would be great since it's Bose but how the hell do I turn this thing off. When I disconnect and push the power button, it automatically connects to my laptop which I don't want to. Pressing the power button for a long period of time just tells you how much battery it has left. When I try to leave it out trying to ignore it, it is yelling ready to connect every other second. I got it to turn it off a few times and I think I know how to turn it off now. I might look dumb to some people, but turning a speaker off shouldn't be this much of a hassle that I have to figure out over a period of time. Even my friend's cheap 20$ ish speaker had better usability. Music gets quite loud enough but it sounds bit muffled.

I've had this speaker about 2 years, and the sound is good but the outlet for the charging cord has become really loose. For awhile, I could least get it in the exact right position to charge my speaker, but tonight I was forced to "fix" it so that it will actually charge my speaker.
I bought this somewhere else as a present for my wife.Better sounding than most portable speakers.

One of the reasons I don't listen to music on a laptop or phone is because I have a nice sound system at home, so I can't stand cruddy, tinny, 'thin' sounding music.  I've never owned my own speaker like this but I've heard plenty of them that friends and family own and I've never been impressed.  This one, however, impresses me.Inside a room, from an average bedroom size to a large great room, it sounds fantastic.  Put the speaker a few inches from a wall and you'll round things out nicely.  Bose has had a name for quality speakers for many years, but I was still surprised by the quality of sound from a wireless speaker.  None of the various ones I've heard have even come close.

I want to listen to Classical music and to voice podcasts.  The sound is very bass heavy, and it needs a preamp and equalizer to keep it from distorting.  I can get reasonable sound by using an equalizer extension in my Chromebook.  But there is no solution when connecting to my Android.  Add to that, too heavy for travel, and user controls that are a pain. This is totally useless for what I need.  I cannot return it because it was a gift. To the landfill it goes!

In late 2018, Bose released an auto-connect feature that can't be disabled. Once you pair a device with this speaker, it will keep trying to connect to this device, even if you turn it off. If it finds the device, it will announce "Connected to device name" or will repeatedly announce "Ready to Pair" if it can't find the device. Highly annoying, especially when it does it in the middle of the night. Bose confirmed that its a "feature" not a bug can't be disabled. Enough for me to toss the speaker out.

Fantastic sound for the size! However, mine only lasted 9 months. Tried every trouble shooting imaginable. My cheap bluetooth is still working. grrrAdding to my review and changed stars.....the troubleshooting suggested on line would bring the speaker back to life, but the battery wouldn’t charge until I pressed both the power button and button with three dots for 15 seconds, disconnected the speaker from power, and then released the buttons. Works great again!

I've had a SoundLink for close to 10 years. I bought it refurbished direct from Bose and I bring it everywhere on vacation, at home, and at work - bathroom, beach, patio, porch, cabin, office. It's treated me well over the years and I will often tell people that it's the best $150 I ever spent. It used to go about 4-5 hours but it's finally aged to the point where the battery lasts about 2 hours. It's been so durable, I'm here buying another while I'm on vacation.

I liked the sound, however I used it a few times and then it went unused for several months. When I charged it, it did charge but only worked for s short period and I have never been able to use it again. I love Bose products but this one takes the award for lemons. BTW, there are videos on Youtube that address the issue but it seems many people share this experience and even after a lot of wasted time, I could not get mine to work again ever.

I purchased this speaker in black from Amazon about 3 years ago.  It's a great speaker. Easy to setup and use.  Good battery life, however, I usually have it plugged in at my office.  When I want to "crank" it up it has a rich sound and is plenty loud enough. I have taken it to the beach and other locations while traveling.  Overall a great purchase for the money paid.  Definitely worth my money.  It's still going strong after 3 years.  Ciao.

Absolutely love the sound quality! The only reason I gave it a 4- star rating was because it doesn't come with the A/C charger and can't charge your phone as similar products do. It only has the USB cord for charging. So now I have to go buy the outlet part if I want to charge my cell phone and the speakers at the same time. Even knowing this ahead of time, the excellent sound quality compared to the other store demos made it well worth the hassle of having to get another AC plug. Because the sound is what you're wanting it for right!  Also, the bass surprised me with how rich and deep it sounds. Definitely recommend!

I was very disappointed with the Bose SoundLink Color 2. I would describe the sound quality as being flat, cheap and somewhat distorted.  Bass was okay, but the mids and treble seemed muddy, like it's a mono speaker instead of stereo. My wife has a Bose SoundLink Mini 2... the difference between that and the SoundLink Color is night and day. The quality of the SoundLink Color is something I would expect from a cheap dollar store speaker, not Bose. I was also disappointed to find out that Bose does not provide a wall charger for this unit, only a small USB cable. Will be returning.

Great speaker and sound for the price. Charges fast lasts a long time before it needs to be recharged.  Compact and easy to pair with compatible devices.  I bought a protective case for my which makes it way easy to transport.  Strong and built well. The voice command was more annoying to me then helpful.  I found a video on  YouTube that walks you through reprogramming this speaker so there is no more annoying voice.

Bought this as a Christmas present for my father, he was really excited about it until we took it and tried to use it... What's worse is the main gift I got him was a set of concert tickets and I had planned to play the music of the band on his see speaker as he opened the tickets.Anyways... Ive had a pair of Bose Soundlink speakers for literally a decade and had zero issues. I love them!  Apparently their quality control has gone very far downhill. The unit will not power on, or charge. I have double checked the charger and it is the proper 1000mA 5v power supply. I tried two different chargers and two different cords. I have tried reseting the unit as bose recommends by holding down the multi function button 15 seconds, unplugging the unit, releasing the button, then plugging it back in. Nothing works.

I just got this as a gift and the sound quality is unlike any other Bose product I've used.  It almost sounds as if there isn't any base.  It's sort of a hollow sound.  From what I can tell there isn't a way to adjust it either.  Overall very disappointed because my iphone sounds better than this speaker.

I bought this to use by my pool. The sound quality was amazing. Then one day with friends over, I accidentally let the battery die by the pool. It took me 2 weeks of troubleshooting and YouTube tutorials to get the speaker back on. You have to reset it, but it’s so sensitive to the reset button combo it’s nearly impossible. It was divine intervention that turned it back on. There’s some secret Bose cheat code and voodoo you have to perform to turn it on after the battery dying. I wish I never bought it.

For the price, this product sounds great.  I have a Sound Wave that obviously sounds better (deeper base, etc), but this little speaker is surprisingly close in terms of casual listening.  Battery life is decent, the product is very versatile, travels well and charges fast.  Product seems to be very well made and will last several years.

AWFUL. Turns on automatically whenever a device it has previously been connnected to turns on. That is, whenever I open my laptop, the speaker wakes up and starts talking, even if i havent used the speaker in connection with the laptop for several uses. Horrible customer experience, Bose, I'm deeply disappointed.

I'm not sure what's wrong with these speakers, but I have gone through two, and given two as gifts, and in every case they die out within the year.  The charger cords are also badly made, so that the first thing is it gets hard to charge them and then finally they're kaput.  They are nice-sounding, however, so if you're rich and don't mind throwing them out after a few months, no worries.

So my Bose soundlink speaker stopped turning on/charging..just doesn't work anymore. Researching the issue online I've come to discover it's a common thing. Why can't this thing work plugged into an outlet even if the battery is shot?? Not happy. I've had this for a year and a month and really didn't use it all that much. With the amount of money I paid for this, I would expect it to last for more than a year. This was my first and LAST Bose purchase. I'm really disappointed in the quality of this product. Totally unacceptable. Buyer beware.I didn't purchase on Amazon FYI. Just wanted to warn people of my experience.

I bought one of these in 2017 for $170. It lasted less than 3 years before it died. I have purchased another product for less than $60 and the sound is soooooo much better than this product -- much crisper and clearer. Never would have guessed that Bose would make a speaker with crummy sound.

Can’t give it a fair rating because what it needs to work is not included. It comes without a charging cord .  At first I thought it just was missing. But it says it s not included  How can a product with this cost and reputation not come with what it needs to work.  So I can’t use it yet.  I cannot evaluate whether it works well.  No instructions for what kind to buy.  I think if it had it it would be a good rating, but I haven’t been able to use it yet

I got this to use with my Amazon Echo Dot, since it doesn't come with an external speaker. Out of the box, the SoundLink looks pretty nice. It certainly looks like something designed for outdoors use like the pool, and it's especially convenient to take camping with me. It comes with an instruction manual and USB charging cable, but there is no wall adapter, so you will need to already own one, unless you plan to charge it through your desktop computer. I received the aquatic blue color, which is a little "too colorful" for my tastes, and if I could choose again, would go for red. It is easy to pair with your devices, and both Bluetooth and NFC pairing is very quick. I have used many Bluetooth speakers in the past, and pairing time is one of my biggest complaints. Audio is very powerful and it can certainly handle a small room or a larger size, like an outdoor deck. There was little distortion when cranking it up to higher levels. I think the MSRP is pretty reasonable for this speaker, but it could definitely use a quality travel case.

This Bose worked great, sounded great, had an easy set up, then STOPPED.  Before you consider purchasing this speaker, Google "Bose Colorlink II stopped working" and you'll find supposedly fixes to get it to work again.  -I've done them all and nothing gets it to work again.  Also, why would you buy a product that has more than a dozen "fixes" on Google.  Big disappointment!  I've spent $thousands on Bose products in my life and this is a pooper.  Go find something else NOW.

Great sounding speaker with a major bug that Bose engineers seem to not care about.The speaker stays on, even when you turn it off and automatically powers itself on and connects to any devices it was previously paired with. Very frustrating to be woken up in the middle of the night hearing a disembodied voice announce that the battery is high and it is ready to connect. I am a big fan of Bose products but this bug was enough for me to return it. Bose has known about this for almost two years, but no change. Pity.

I really like this speaker - great sound and portability and looks for the price. My first one lasted three years until it stopped working. I was very happy with it and eagerly took it in for repair/replacement. That was 15 months ago. Over this time, I have had to go through the steps to fix it a number of times. Doing all the things on the Bose website and following the advice from their techs. I have probably spent - all told - 20/30 hours trying to get it to work right. Well, this one just stopped working - in the middle of a song. Did everything to restore and it just is dead. Bose response? "It is beyond the warranty period. Buy a new one for only $75!" NO THANK YOU! If it is going to last a little longer than the warranty period and I have to buy a replacement every 15 months for $75 I choose to but one that is engineered and manufactured so that it doesn't die every year.

It's great - good battery, durable, decent sound. One major problem.With the latest device firmware update, Bose introduced a "feature" which automatically turns the speaker on when a paired device is within range. This means if you use the speaker at home and own say a cellphone and laptop which are paired and tend to move around, the speaker is CONSTANTLY turning on when not requested.

While this device has fine sound quality and durability, which I recognize as I upgraded from the previous iteration, Bose has completely ruined this speaker with the addition of a new bluetooth connection feature. The device powers on and connects to your device EVERY SINGLE TIME you power up a device that the speaker has EVER connected to. Checking your phone in the middle of the night? "Brendan's iPhone, connected. Brendan's iPhone, disconnected." Opening your laptop for a quick email, or worse, for a college class with your speaker TURNED OFF in your backpack? "Desktop-10539, connected. Desktop-10539, disconnected." It's an unbelievably terrible feature that adds zero helpful functionality, drains the speaker's battery life if I don't constantly turn it off, and infuriates me. I can't believe Bose engineers could design something that literally makes me want to throw my speaker into the trash.

Loved this speaker, sound great, nice size, and easily paired. However, when the battery died I discovered that they want you to return it to Bose for replacement And, if you want to try to replace the battery yourself, the screws used don't match any tool I could find in Texas. So, tossed it and replaced it with a Sony - sound as good or better and this speaker has a replaceable battery!

My step sister has one of these and i have played with it multiple times just to see if i wanted oneoverall i would say its a good speaker but there are some aspects of it that makes me not want to spend $130 for one

This speaker is great.  We have another SoundLink speaker from several years ago and the quality has been kept up on these.  This speaker is super portable and can be easily moved from spot to spot.  It's very light and quick to grab and throw in a bag to take on an outing.  The sound is superb.  We can listen to music or the radio or books and they all sound great.  The controls are easy to use and this speaker connects to all our cell phones, tablets and quickly and easily.  This light blue color is fun and happy.

Purchased when they first came out and it worked great for awhile. We left it be, 70ish percent charged for about two months and when we decided to take it out again and use it, the battery wouldn't charge. It needs to remain plugged in for it to function now. 129 bucks for a brick at this point, wouldn't buy another and can't recommend it. Seems like they cheaped out on the battery components and they discharge quickly and don't have the staying power of more modern options.USB-mini to A, as well..lame. USB-C all the things, plz.

God, this thing. I'm sitting up right now at 2:00 am not able to listen to anything because, as usual, it's decided it doesn't want to charge. It seems such a small thing, but the usb and earphone cord don't seat well in the device. They're always coming loose, so the speaker isn't charging. I have to plug it into my laptop because if I true to pair it with my laptop, my movie won't play for some reason (although it pairs fine with my phone.) The shape is also annoying because it tips over so easy. It tips over, and unplugs itself and the mismatched cords unplug themselves. None of that would matter if the bluetooth worked right, but it doesn't. Ugh.

I used this on my shower ledge for over a year now. There has been absolutely no problems until recently. The power just completely went dead even though when i plug it in it says it’s charged. I am obviously upset, but given the conditions of being in a shower for a year, i’m not surprised it broke! Good sound quality, but not loud enough for a party. I’d recommend for someone who doesn’t plan on moving it around too much and isn’t storing it in a wet environment.

I am very happy with my Soundlink Micro, so happy that I decided it was worth it to upgrade to the newer/larger Bose SoundLink Bluetooth Speaker II. It's more expensive and slightly larger, but really has no improvements over the MICRO. Probably the best thing about the Soundlink Micro is that it always works. Both speakers have great sound, but the Speaker II constantly drops out or turns off for no apparent reason (settings... auto-off timer = never). Sometimes, I even have trouble getting the Speaker II to connect to my device. If I had it to do again, I would just buy another Soundlink Micro.

The bluetooth connectivity is unstable and for like one month it coul not connect to my MacBook Pro. And now it suddenly cannot be charged anymore. I read through all forum posts and tried all the methods including ship mode etc. The only possible way seems to be get a replacement from the service with $75 (While you buy a totally new one with $99). And this is not a problem that happens to only some of us. The bose website reviews for this product is  250 five stars vs. 161 One stars. This soundlink is a disaster!

The experience I had in the beginning was great. A month afterwards the heavy paper weight stopped working and the software won't let it sync up again. It seems to be a common issue and the only way to fix it, is by sending it in and paying a lot of money to replace. Would not buy another bose product again. You can find just as good sounds quality for a tiny fraction of the price. Go else where. 😐 Seriously. Avoid it.

My wife had given me a SoundLink unit as a gift.  Right out of the box, it had problems.  The cord would not properly fit and as a result, the unit would not charge very well.  Finally, it crapped out and would not charge at all.  I bought a replacement cord, and essentially the same thing happened.  I was finally directed to the BOSE support number after leaving a complaint on this site.  I called the number -- a human being answered after a few prompts, spoke english very well and had my problem taken care of in minutes.  My faulty unit was replaced with zero hassle.  It arrived the other day...works great and sounds awesome.  I am very happy with Bose customer service and honestly surprised by how professional and courteous they were (I was expecting typical customer service response).
We have 2 of these. After Bose pushed an update to to the speakers, the volume button no longer works on either of themI have contacted support and posted on the Bose forum.

What a terrible product. Sounds great, when it works.This product seems like it woudlve benefited from some better programming or firmware. Connectivity issues, the battery life is terrible for the price, effective range is about 10ft.

I purchased mine when HSN had a flash sale and I am over the moon for the quality.  I’ve read a lot of reviews for this and I suspect that over time Bose has improved on the negligent reviews because I have had this for several months now and mine is wonderful.  When I put this in a corner of my house if I am cleaning the sound quality is frankly unsurpassed.  A plus!  Love.

I have a soundlink that quit charging, I bought a new charger but that didn't help, it was  in a goodwill pile until my daughter told me it only needs to be updated . Plug it into your computer and go to bose.com, they have the update and it's working fine. Lucky for bose as we were looking for a new speaker and it wasn't going to be another bose.

I received this speaker as a Christmas gift from my mother-in-law. The speaker sounds great but the battery life is is just average...and just like any battery, it's going to no longer hold a charge. I now use this speaker in my home office and leave it plugged into an electrical outlet. My only complaint is the Bluetooth; it's sometimes difficult to connect. In addition, it allows multiple devices to connect to it, which is a real headache. Overall though, it's a pretty nice speaker for the price.

The Bose SoundLink Color Bluetooth Speaker II was a recent purchase of mine. This product would be great for any teenager or young adult who loves music and listens to music at least five days a week. Since this product is used by Bluetooth as its main connection, the individual purchasing this should have the capability on their phone to be able to connect to Bluetooth.This product would be great for an individual who wants their music, podcast, or any other type of streamed media to be played at a loud volume. The speaker comes in four main colors, so an individual can tailor it to their preference. That was one of the reasons I chose this product, because I could get it in the color of my choice. Some other reasons why I valued this product over similar models was its size, the Bluetooth range, as well as the simplicity of the setup. These three things were what I evaluated when choosing between products.

This product is crap.  We have 2 of them now and they are both failing in different ways.  They both worked fine "out of the box", but within about a month nothing but misery and woe.The status lights are virtually meaningless as they have no flipping context.  What does the "circle arrow" button do?  How about the "little dot, BIG DOT, little dot" button?  One of them now pretty much refuses to charge or pair with any device.  It is a brick.  The other will pair..usually, and charges OK, but neither of them will react correctly to the "Bose Updater" application thing on iPhone, Android, and my Mac.  The "Bose Updater" application thing matters because troubleshooting anything on this device from internet searches begins "update the Firmware".  I can't update the firmware and this thing just doesn't work.

Bought this speaker, charged it, and it worked great! Sound quality was awesome--had a few issues with it refusing to pair with my phone. It would claim to be connected, but wouldn't play. Had it for maybe a month and the battery had died. Went to charge it and it would not work. Tried different charging cords/ports. Tried wall charger and plugging in to PC. Tried internet hacks from other users encountering this issue and tips from BOSE itself. None of the tricks worked. Speaker is completely unresponsive, no lights, no sound, no response to being plugged in. Tried leaving it charging over night and nothing. So incredibly disappointed--we were going to use this to play a song in our outdoor wedding as my fiance walked down the aisle, but definitely returning it now that it's proved to be so unreliable. Huge bummer :(

I purchased the Gen 1 Bose Soundlink in 2015. It survived 6 months of an all guys college house, 3 months of an all guys summer beach house, and a few years of normal use. This speaker was left out in the sun and rain multiple times but still works like the day I bought it. The speakers sound great for a small form-factor. The battery still last for 2-3 hours after 4 years of heavy use! Me and my girlfriend use this speaker every single day and have never had a major issue with it. It's great for the kitchen when you're washing dishes, or throwing in your backpack when you go camping. I would absolutely recommend this speaker to anyone.
Bought a JLB GO2 died within a couple hours.Tried a Sony and the sound quality was crap.

For the price I’m not impressed. We’ve had this speaker a little over year (therefore the warranty is void) and it just stopped charging. The charging port seemed loose and would only work in certain positions and would turn on/off all the time. Now it just doesn’t charge at all. We’ve tried several different cords and verified that is not the issue.

I received this as a gift a little less than a year ago. Recently it stopped being able to be charged. This is really disappointing and sad because I thought Bose was a brand of quality but it’s clear they don’t care about anything except money. I never really brought my speaker near water or anything like that and casual use. I tried to look on their website to see if they could service it or offer some solutions. The only thing they offered was for me to buy a new one. Thanks Bose. Very helpful... Extremely disappointed.

It’s a Bose speaker. Of course it sounds great. I especially like to put it in an enclosed space so the sound gets bigger and fuller. Problem areas are all surrounding the battery..... Battery life appears to be reducing over time. At the beginning, the speaker remained charged for about 6 hours (I usually listen to music at a higher volume, so I expected the reduced battery life and was still happy with it). Now, though, I’ve owned the speaker for about 3 months and battery life is down to about 4 hours. Plugging the speaker into an outlet isn’t so much of an issue except that the speaker dies without any warning of the battery levels. (I’ve owned cheaper speakers that warn you when battery level is below 5-10% — this speaker has no such function except for if you press the button to check the battery levels.) So the speaker will cut out suddenly in the middle of a song and need to be plugged in for 3-5 minutes before it has enough charge to start playing again. A battery level warning would drastically improve my experience of this device.

I am not one to write reviews, but I would like to warn everyone to NOT buy this speaker. It sounds AMAZING but you will see in a lot of comments that it has a weird battery problem. I have tried multiple cords that I know for a fact work great, however the speaker will not charge. For the past few months it was only charging sometimes but has just stopped all together since then. My parents had a very similar problem with theirs.There are awesome speakers out there that are cheaper and do NOT have these charging port problems.

The BoseLink Color Bluetooth Speaker II is a great portable speaker with many advantages over the competition.PACKAGING:  The Bose packaging is solid and nothing is torn or destroyed when opening.  The box can be kept for storage if desired.  The instruction fold-out is disappointing - it's one of those translated into one hundred languages that folds out like a newspaper.  It also comes with a white micro-usb charging cable.

Lemme start off by saying one thing. There is but only much you can get sound wise from a small speaker. Keep that in mind. With that said. I think this speaker has great sound at 75% or less volume. Any higher and there is distortion. This speaker I imagine would be great at an office or at a desk. Where its not going to be too loud but loud enough to get great sound. I have this paired with an echo dot and it works great. I have echo dots volume set usually between 6-8. Solid speaker but not for everyone.

Received this item for Christmas 2016. Used it only in the house, took very good care of it, light use I would say. Two days ago I used it during the evening and it was charging normally, but when I woke up the next morning the unit was dead. Went through all the trouble shoots with multiple cords, wall plugs, USB connectors, etc. Even checked all components with other electronics to ensure they weren't the problem. Called Bose...they told me that the unit was dead and they could only offer me $80 to buy a new one. I understand it is over a year old, but it was only lightly used in reality. I expect better quality from Bose and am disappointed in this product. Will buy from someone else.

Advice for those who complained about the device not coming with the power brick: Get a dual USB brick and you can not only plug in the Bose SoundLink Color 2 but a phone or as I have done and thoroughly enjoyed, my Amazon Echo Dot 2nd Generation in black. I haven't had any charging issues related to the speaker and even if I would have to keep it plugged into the outlet to work wouldn't bother me because I switched from the Blackweb Tsunami Bluetooth speaker and both are excellent products but I like the USB 2 connectivity of the Bose over the huge brick of the Blackweb.
We left the device uncharged for a month. None of the reset methods worked.One month out of warranty and they want me to buy a new device for $75.

When I first bought this speaker, I loved it. Durable, great sound quality, and decent battery life. Fast forward 2 years and the battery won’t hold a charge. At all. I’ve babied this speaker, and haven’t put it through heavy use. I realized rechargeable batteries don’t last forever, but for a speaker that costs over $100 and has the Bose name on it, I expected this speaker to worker for more than a couple years. I will never spend the extra money on Bose speakers again.

Update: Problem resolved by owner. Possibly was a bad charger. Speaker is now working excellently. Bose did not respond but I found the help needed on their forum.Good sound, bad customer support, and battery died after only 8 mos. Tried leaving a message with Bose website to no avail. Would I recommend it? Hmmm, I am not so sure, but in fairness I have to say my daughter's, which inspired me to buy mine is still going strong. I have asked Bose to fix it but they have not responded to my message. I might up this to 5 if I get satisfaction.

Speaker completely stopped working and wouldnt keeps a charge. Happened a little over a month of having it. I’m very disappointed because I love Bose and they have always exceeded my expectations. I don’t know if this speaker was just defected but can’t use it

Great speaker and sound for the price!This compact speaker makes it great to take to the beach, out to a picnic, etc. because of its size and superior sound capability. It delivers a loud, clear sound for such a small speaker and holds a charge for a good amount of time.
Pros:- Paired with my iPhone with no issues

Sometimes when this speaker dies, it just will not turn back on or charge and you have to apply a weird factory reset that isn't even in the manuals. I've had to do that roughly 4 times. Now the speaker will pair but there's no audio. Lots of connectivity issues.

I was staying at a friends house for the summer and they had an orange one of these. I liked it so much that I bought my own. The bass is great and it is waterproof. I have gone through 3 of those small round speakers but they were all junk, the ones that light up. This thing is solid and heavy. It comes with a high quality bose cable. They have a soundlink3 now but I prefer this one.

It is obvious the sound has gotten worse - I waited for 2 weeks to give a chance for the speaker to burn in so that I could give it a fair try. There is a tinniness and a vibration in the midrange, high range is washed out and the bass is good if not slightly overdone. The Soundlink Color I had phenomenal sound, so I'm not sure what materials went into this to make it worse. The volume also can't even get close to as high as the previous generation.The only thing good about this is the felt like exterior, and the quick bluetooth connection & multiple paired devices, switching is easy.

Love the sound.ordered a second one a week later so we could use party mode. Also, purchased as birthday presents for my son's.  Does not work as well with Alexa though. I was hoping to add them as extra speakers when entertaining this summer while using Echo Dots in house. So far that has not worked.

This product is HORRIBLE! I have gone through two of them in a year and a half and they keep hosting on me. The first time it happened, Bose replaced the speaker for me. This time, I don’t even want to contact Bose because I don’t want an unreliable speaker. I teach yoga around town and can’t risk having my music crap out. Save your money and get a cheaper, more reliable speaker.

I bought this product a few years ago. I thought it was a bit pricey, but I was happy with its performance. However, a couple of months ago it became temperamental in pairing with my iPhone. A week ago it finally crapped out for good. It would bind the pairing site on my phone even while the power was dead. I have since replaced it with an Anker SoundCore Boost. It is much more responsive than the Bose, and the sound quality good too.

I purchased the citron color. Everything looked great. However, I have a family member who purchased the same model from the Bose manufacturer.  I compared the speakers and played them one after the other and the difference in sound was astounding.  The family member’s Soundlink had noticeably better sound quality with the bass and treble. Not to mention, his was able to turn up significantly louder than mine. (We both have an iPhone X and iPhone 11).  I question the authenticity of this product and will be returning to purchase through the manufacturer.
But stopped working after a few years. I tried all the multitude of ways that the internet, including the Bose site, recommends to reset it but nothing worked. Would not recommend.

I really wasn't expecting this to sound like it does.  It's loud, but the sound is muddy/tinny, like it's on the wrong EQ setting.  I've never heard a Bose product with poor sound quality, I wonder if mine has a defect...either way my other $35 generic chinese bluetooth speaker sounds an order of magnitude better than the Bose.

I purchased the first generation of this speaker, and it still works fine for me. However, I also purchased a second gen and after 4 weeks had to return it as dead. Would not power on or charge.  Received a replacement, and just today, 4 months later, this one is now dead.  I do not use it near water. I travel with it and put it in a carry on for planes in a hard case made for the speaker.  When both died, it was not right after travel, but during normal use of playing, charging, and playing.  UGH, Bose used to be so reliable.

I bought this last Christmas. I wanted the more expensive and  larger one but settled on this one. I take it kayaking, camping trips just about every where. I also  use it in the house. It's all I need the fill a room with great sound. The bass is very rich. All I need is my smartphone and this speaker. I seldom use my component stereo system anymore. Battery life has been satisfactory. This makes the perfect gift yes there are much lower priced blue tooth speakers but you get what you pay for! I love this speaker!

I bought Bose wireless speakers and they literally failed after just occasional use. “Mother Board” issue. The phone rep said that my warranty had expired by a few months, this is true. But a company selling on quality should be embarrassed and fix my speakers as R&D. Nope. Wanted to charge 80% of the total price.If something needs an extended warranty- don’t buy it.

I too had the mysterious, "battery won't hold charge, and doesn't work while plugged in," issue. I was able to squeeze a few months of great sound out of the device but it did not last. Once the batter light would not stay on, I tried all the manual reboots from the Bose website. They seemed to work for a handful of people, but not for my device. Bose does not repair these speakers so I get to buy another, if I want to. This seems to be an issue with these so I will not be purchasing this model again.

Wow, I can't believe all the great reviews for this piece of junk. It sounds great WHEN it works. It turned German speaking on me inexplicably and we could never figure out how to get it back to english even with the instructions. Then it died and none of the Bose tricks brought it back to life.

Received this as a gift and it is truly one of the best gifts I have ever received (going on seven months of use). It is small, loud and stylish. This speaker lasts for hours and charges quickly. Once, my speaker would not cut on and I figured I had killed it, I did some research on Google and apparently I had to do a hard reset. It was functioning and fine after that.Would Recommend!

On speakerphone option, if you touch your smartphone at all it reverts back to the smartphone.  incoming calls no problem, outgoing calls can only voice dial.  Calling into a bridge line or a meeting can be tricky to enter the meeting ID, I can work around it on Zoom by asking zoom to call me, I am not sure every meeting service has this capability.

This is an unexpected let down as Bose usually stands for quality.  The Speaker  plays music sounding like it is coming from a tin can.  This just does not compute; Bose if you  are  going to trade quality for lower prices do us a favor and DON'T.  I am returning this thing as soon as I get the chance.  I have the same speaker as picture only difference is the color.  Also  it is dead.  It wont take a charge and will not come to life.  I haven't  had this for very long.  Totally disappointed.

The thing I love about Bose, and this is important, is that you can turn the volume all the way up to MAX and never lose a single bit of quality. You won't get that with any other speaker. This speaker is great for when you want to bring your music to the shower or to the beach. It's rugged, waterproof, small, and the strap on the back for attaching the speaker to things is perfect!!!

If you have been looking for a portable, easy connecting, and great sounding speaker then look no further. The Bose SoundLink Speaker is high quality, affordable, and will meet all of your expectations. The SoundLink is for anyone looking for an easy to use and great sounding speaker. When looking for a speaker, typically buyers look at three criteria: sound quality, portability, and connectivity. The Bose SoundLink Speaker meets all three of these criteria and more.Sound Quality

The main issue is the fact it only worked once, now it won't accept a charge, no lights illuminate. This was a Christmas gift so I can't return it. I would highly recommend getting a Klipsch "Groove" though. Long lasting battery, great sound and look.

As others have stated the micro USB connection fits extremely poorly and causes the connector to bend and break.  I have to jiggle it once plugged in to get it sit properly so it will charge.  Unless you want to replace your cord every couple of months, avoid this at all costs.  For the cost, it is definitely not worth it.

Not what I expected from bose. Poor sound quality. If you can distinguish poor sound quality from good sound quality you will not like this product. I have bose head phones and two bose surround sounds, this is not representative of that quality. Sorry Bose but you know what it sounds like.

I bought a pair of bose speakers years ago and they always had a bluetooth connectivity problem so I returned. I bought these thinking they had evolved. I was wrong. They always have issues connecting and drop. I have troubleshooted everything they recommend. My mistake was not returning sooner. And instead of replacing they are trying to sell me another at a discounted price. hell no, never buying Bose again. Their support and customer service suck. These are not cheap.

I bought one for myself after using my mom's.  It sounds awesome!  This is one of many Bose products I have used, and I am still impressed.  This thing has great portability and a long lasting battery.  It's small and easy to carry.  They also have carry cases, I don't have one but my mom does.  I mostly use mine for around home.  It's easy to grab from one room and set in the next room.  It also is powerful enough to pump clear sound into the main area of my house that is quite large and has a lofted ceiling.

My Bose Soundlink Color II is just one year old and it will not work at all.  It will not power up or charge.  I tried troubleshooting tips - and it looks like this has been a known problem for awhile in this speaker.  I contacted Bose and they said the warranty has expired but that they would send a replacement for $75.  Why would I want to even spend $75 on this speaker again? Shame on Bose for continuing to sell this speaker when this charging problem is a known issue.

I must step in and support Bose, I have the older model red unit and it's true to it's color, also this little dude is a kick ass speaker and I've had it for 3 years without Any Problems and I use it at least 3 x's a week. Sounds great and, looks Great.. Just not splash proof, but that's not the reason I purchased it, who cares, just be responsible and not get it wet....sometimes the older models are the Best.

Bought this speaker a year ago and it worked well during that time, However, I plugged it in one night and the next morning the power cord, which came with the device, was melted inside the connection.  Apparently the battery conduit got too hot.  We used it in the shower everyday, which may have contributed, but that's allegedly okay and we also took it out and dried it off after every use.  I've had good experience with Bose in the past and this may have just been a lemon, but its worth noting.  Also worthy of mention - the battery didn't last anywhere near 8 hours.

This was my birthday present but I had to return it because the battery was faulty.  Never held a green light and had a red flashing light when it was charging (which according to the site meant there was a battery problem).  The sound was great but the company needs to check these things out before they send them to Amazon.  Now I am waiting on an older model that has a better rep for reliability.  Too bad.

Compared to the 360 model this speaker is just ok. If you like bass and depth in your music spend $50 more. If you listen to music that focuses more on high tones or instrumentals like classical etc this will probably probably be fine. I listened to 2 songs on it before putting it back in the box to be exchanged.
Nice and small with excellent sound.  Batteries died after a year and you cannot open it at all to replace the batteries.  Too much money to throw away that often.

Great little portable speaker for the price! Water resistance is also a great benefit if using beside the pool or in the kitchen or bathroom. I’ve tried a few other brands of Bluetooth speakers and headphone, but bose it the one that I always come back to.

Loved it at first. Got is for Christmas 2016. Its Aug. 2018. Speaker is dead. I did everything I was supposed to do with a representative from Bose to revive it. He said its out of the one year warranty and they can only offer a discount on a new one. Told him no way! I will never ask for or purchase Bose speakers again. Super bad service Bose.

Not what you'd expect from Bose, it's comparable to the $20 anker. I also own the Harmon karden onyx mini. Less money and double the sound quality. I still love Bose and own multiple products, just don't recommend this one. It works great in a small quite room, but falls flat on its face if there's any background noise.
Bought this for my son for Christmas to go with his bluetooth turntable. Very disappointing that after only a few months it will not hold a charge...

This speaker does exactly what it is supposed to do and does it with no drama.So - what is it supposed to do? It's supposed to be a portable speaker that sounds way better than your phone's speaker and it is supposed to be fairly rugged.  -win-

I did not purchase mine through amazon. But this is a great little speaker sounds great looks great light weight connects well. The battery states that it last up to 8 hours on one charge I found this to be untrue we fully charged ours before heading out and it only lasted two hours continuous play. Expected a little more from this brand but it will do the job

Note:  For Soundlink I:  Very nice sound quality, and good battery life at first.  However, I've owned two of them, and within a few months, both of them went totally dead.  I can only use them now when they are plugged into the wall.  Very disappointing for Bose.Unsure if they fixed this problem for Soundlink 2, the website claims that it has gone into "battery protection mode" and that it can be reset.  But I haven't had any luck with that on my Soundlink 1.

I have this speaker.  Loved it and loved the sound.  The problem is that it won’t charge.  My daughter has the same speaker in blue but hers stopped charging too!  We’ve tried multiple chargers.  They are absolutely useless.
nice as usual - every new one is a little cooler than the last one purchased.but where's the wall charger? - every previous wireless speaker has had one.

Short battery life, long charging time. Also, I was surprised to find that this speaker gives no indication when the battery is low while in use, other than announcing if the battery level is high, medium or low when the unit is first turned on. I have owned Bluetooth speakers half the price of this one that would alert you that the battery is about to die while the speaker was in use. This one simply stops working without warning, which is very annoying. I actually thought it was defective the first time this happened. The sound quality itself is great, but, given the brand prestige and price point, I wasn't expecting these little details to be overlooked.

The Bose SoundLink is a nifty little bluetooth speaker. It's water resistant and rugged, able to take a fall. It has a soft silicone exterior that I especially like. Weighing in at just over a pound, it measures 2.2 X 8 X 5.2. It is able to sit on narrow ledges and shelves - and does just fine on the passenger seat of my car. I like to use it to listen to music through my phone. And it's Bose - the sound quality is excellent and you can crank the volume way up if you want. I have several Bluetooth speakers and none can match this one's sound capabilities.Pairing is a snap - it even has voice commands to guide you. (When you pair more than one thing, you can use the commands to switch devices very easily.) It has a builtin speakerphone, too. I am very happy with this feature because it means I can talk hands-free in the car. You just press a button on the speaker and voila - you're on that phone.  (It can handle up to eight paired devices.)  The Bluetooth is supposed to work up to 30 feet away - but it worked quite a bit farther for me, despite several walls.

When I bought this speaker over a year ago, I was very pleased with the sound.  However, a few months ago, after an update, my Bose Speaker will automatically come on when I open my laptop.  This can be very annoying.  I can turn it off and right away it comes back on.  If my speaker is in another room then the people in that room hear it come on.  Apparently on the Bose thread, others have complained but the only response is, "We are sorry this is occurring.  We will report this problem." That's it.  Nothing given to fix this.  Unless this gets taken care of, I will never purchase another Bose product.  Period

My first purchase from Bose were the book shelf speakers 201 in 1996, then I purchased the 301 very satisfied with those speaker purchases I've had those speakers for many years. Then I was intrigued when I came upon the Bose SoundLink Color Bluetooth Speaker II - Aquatic Blue which did not last more than a year. UNBELIEVABLE  when it comes to Bose this speaker does not measure up to previous Bose speakers. BUYER BEWARE too many problems although they look so cute.

I now own my second Sound Link. Had the first one for about two years. It finally quit. Called tech support for help. Only resolution was to sell me a new one for a discounted replacement. I payed the discounted price and very pleased with my new Sound Link. Excellent Bluetooth device!

Interesting color, but very good sound.  The bass is deep; the middle range could use a bit more emphasis.  In fact, things like audio books and podcasts come across with too much bass and can seem to "mumble" a bit.  But over all the sound is very, very good.  Volume is impressive without rattle or distortion.  Solid sound delivery at all levels.  The mic works very well for taking calls; it  provides a clear voice to the person on the other end of the line. Button controls are responsive with just the right amount of tactile feedback.  Connecting to my iPhone 7 was simple and took less than 30 seconds.  Controls on top include on/off; volume; bluetooth; and pause/forward/answer/hang-up combined button. The speaker has a hard/smooth rubber feel to it.  Charges via micro USB (included, but no wall plug).  Unit measures 5"h x 5"w x 2.25" deep.  The profile is nice and slim, so it's easy to use in lots of places (bathroom, kitchen, outdoors, office, etc.).Excellent bluetooth speaker with lots of power.

Someone was able to turn on my Bose Colorlink speaker and play music on it from his iPhone. Tried to play my own music on it but his continued. I was blocked out. I turned off bluetooth, but his music continued. I had to shut down my phone to stop my speaker from playin his music. I am quite annoyed at this.

I bought two of these speakers.  Both are no longer usable because the charging ports have broken.  The very act of plugging them in for charging over time has rendered the port unusable. Very disappointing for a product of such renown as Bose.  THis will happen to you after your warranty has expired.

I purchased this speaker in November 2015.  I loved it so much I purchased one for my son that Christmas.  My speaker died about a month ago, after using it for less than two years.  What I didn't know when I purchased it was that you cannot change the battery and when it dies after approximately 300 recharges, it simply dies!!  If I had known that it would only last not even two years and then when it died, I would simply have to throw it away, I would have purchased it nor would I have purchased one as a Christmas gift for my son.

This is a good bluetooth speaker, maybe a little overpriced.  The casing will survive some water splash but with this redesign, the controls on the top of the speaker feels a little cheap.  Sound wise it is good, if you're budget is within this price range, this speaker is a solid option.  If you have more to spend, add $70 more and get the Sonos Play:1 for a better experience and incredible sound.

I got one of these as a gift and liked it so much I've purchased it as gifts for others twice. It's a good form factor for portability, with great sound for its size. The rugged plastic design makes it very durable. The most recent gift had a defective charger which Bose replaced for the recipient without hassle.
High quality, easy to use.  But, battery lasts maybe two years. Nearly impossible to replace. Wish Bose would just allow battery replacement. I hate having to throw a working unit away.

It worked well until the battery died then Bose said no replacement can be done I had to but a new unit for the discounted price of $75.00 but they couldn't replace the battery , so this one goes in the landfill? , bad policy

got this when i got my phone as a package deal a few years back when these were first launched. it worked for 2 months. then stopped. it won’t charge. an actual faulty unit no user error. sad because this sounded a lot better than my older jbl speaker.

I wish i had not bought this. Itwas advertised as having "up to 8 hours of battery life". Mine gets less than 2 hours. It is difficult to charge. It has to be at the right angle in order to charge. The sound is ok as long as you are not close to it.Both Bose customer service and the retailer i purchased it from (not Amazon) were totally unresponsive.

Received as a gift last year.  Sound quality is full and impressive.  Link it to my iPad and computer simultaneously so I can listen to music and voicemail/videos.  Even has a built in mic to make phone calls/connect to digital assistant.  Considering getting a second to pair in stereo mode.Saw a review mentioning battery dying if not used frequently.  I usually use this speaker on vacation and don't power it up for up to 6 months at a time, and have never had any problem.  Perhaps user stored it with a low battery level--which risks killing/shortening life of most modern rechargeable batteries (particularly lipos).

I have had the mint colored one for 3-4 years now and while the sound quality for such a small speaker is absolutely unrivaled, the battery does get to a point where it doesn't hold much of a charge. I make do by plugging it into a pocket charger, but would've been nice for such a high price if it had lasted longer.
Had one since they came out (2 years ago?), it it still works flawlessly and battery lasts for hours. Fantastic bluetooth speaker!

I was able to get one of these free through an employee award program, but came to Amazon to buy the case.  I love Bose and have three other speaker systems from Bose, but I had a lower bar of expectation for his one because of how I got it for free.  Well, I’ve been *very happy* with the speaker for over a year.  I’ve found it’s great for use in a hotel room or home for music from my iPhone or iPad and also for watching shows mostly on my iPad.  Great for use out on the patio at home too.  Bluetooth set was easy.  I put an extra long charging cord left over from an old phone in the travel case and it fits well.  Although I got this for free, it’s well worth the price here.  Light years beyond any of the portable speakers I’ve owned and have left over in drawers I need to now recycle.

It's great until it doesn't work anymore and/or won't take a charge and it's hard to find out how to fix it.  Wish Bose put out some clear succinct instructions and directions, but it doesn't.  I've had mine for a couple of years and it's been temperamental.  If I have to replace it, it won't be a Bose.

I’m my opinion, my Amazon Echo 3rd gen. Has better bass and highs then my Bose. The Bose can get louder and stay clear at high volumes, and it does sound balanced at all volumes, but overall I was expecting a high quality good sounding product, yes it does sound good, but I’m not amazed by it, you can get better sound with something cheaper. Like a jbl speaker.

Beware - you cannot operate two of these units simultaneously from one device. Go with Beats Pill+ if you want two speakers for stereo experience. Bose speaker does not come close to filling a room with sound.

I originally loved mine. Now less than a year after purchasing, it no longer charges or turns on. Get on BOSE troubleshooting page and come to find out this is a very common issue. Didn't seem like they were doing much to rectify it either... Now I have to go to a BOSE store to replace a barely used speaker

BOSE is synonymous with overpriced in my mind, largely because they charge prices like they're providing audiophile-level speakers while providing medium to lower-end components in their products. The very worst offender in that category is Beats which sells twenty bucks worth of speakers for several hundred dollars. BOSE at least offers products that have the feel and aesthetic of a premium product.This SoundLink II is a reasonably good speaker that produces rich, full sound for its form factor. You can't expect miracles from such a small device, but for most applications, it's a solid BlueTooth option that will please the demographic it's intended for. However, if you want actual high-fidelity sound, this speaker isn't going to provide it. You're better off with an uglier speaker that contains better components.
Bought 2- NEITHER worked consistently.  Chronic Connectivity and charging issues.  Bose is no longer a quality product.

First off, not great when traveling. Not 110-220 compatible. Must charge with USB when traveling to countries with 220V. Almost every time I use it, I must completely erase the speaker stored blue tooth connected devices to pair. I have a couple cheaper blue tooth speakers and head phones that never have this problem. Recommend that you pass on this overly expensive Bose for another speaker. The sound quality isn't spectacular to warrant the awfull pairing and price.

I bought this last summer for use around our pool. It had great sound, connected to my phone very easy and worked with my Apple Watch. Didn't use it for a couple of months, plugged it in to charge and it won't charge. I tried the reset other people have recommended and it didn't fix mine. Very disappointed, because when it did work, it was great!

Purchased the blue one over a year ago, and had horrible luck getting it to work or pair - so I gave up and it sat on my shelf - HOWEVER 2 days ago I got it down, used a cord between my laptop and the speaker, kept it plugged in to a power source, and I'm as happy as I could be, given it is not wireless.  This may be the strategy.

Expected better sound and battery life for a Bose.  My speaker disconnects from Bluetooth constantly and is sooo frustrating.  The battery life is ok, not great.  Sound is good enough but expected better.  I've had it since December and now , just today it has completely died, very disappointed.  I tried to troubleshoot by reading previous reviews and unfortunately I can't troubleshoot something that is completed dead!

It was the first Bose product I ever bought mostly based on the brand reputation. To my surprise after only a couple of months the problem began. It happens if it runs out of battery. It goes off, no lights, nothing happens.  My product simply died out and won't go on again.  I've tried every tip from official  technical support and videos. Hours and hours trying to get a simple speaker to go back to its regular job.
Purchased this speaker after researching and reading tons of reviews.The sound did not impress me but even more frustrating was the poor bluetooth connectivity. Speaker constantly goes in and out.

I purchased one of these Bose Soundlink Color Bluetooth Speaker II for my wife this week at Best Buy. Under normal circumstance I would have given my business to Amazon but we were in the Mall so we grabbed it. There are so many speakers to choose from so it came down to my prior experience with Bose products. Once we got it home, connected it via our Echo Dot we were amazed at the sound. Since then we've been very happy with the battery life and overall performance. I would highly recommend this Speaker to anyone looking to add sound to a remote area, deck, poolside, garage, etc

I love love love this little portable speaker!!! Excellent sound quality, pairs instantly with any device in range, and the battery life is impressive. You can listen to music for hours on one charge. We originally bought this in lieu of getting outdoor mounted speakers, and its one of the best purchases we've ever made. Not only is it great for just sitting outside on the porch, but its perfect for traveling, camping trips, hanging out on the beach, and the list goes on. The lightweight portability of this speaker is a huge plus, and the water resistant quality makes it a stress free travel companion. There are countless ways to use this, we have jammed while riding our bikes with this in our backpack, put it on the toilet while showering, and used it for phone calls as a speakerphone. The mic has a solid range as well. Get this, you will not be disappointed!

This thing is great had it over five years it’s  tough I’ve had one in my shop drop kicked covered in oil and grinding dust yes the battery does not last more then 3 or 4 hours on high but the sound is awesome for the size Bluetooth is hard to pair every once and a wile but I  think it’s more the devices then the Bose and it’s still working

I reallY enjoyed this speaker while it lasted. However it's run was short lived. For the price, I expected a good speaker that lasted a few years-especially considering the name Bose.
